As Mai pulled out another half-dozen or so knives the fake Ty Lee quickly lunged in with a quick series of blows to her arms. The knives dropped from her hands as Mai's arms hung uselssly at her sides and a swift kick to the sternum sent her flying to the ground.

At that point the real Ty Lee had managed to free herself and lunged at her imposter. The pair of Ty Lees traded blows, neither being able to gain the upper hand until a quick movement by the fake got "her" in a position to disable the arms and legs of the real one. At this time Azula decided to join the fray and quickly sent blasts of blue flame flying in the fake Ty Lee's direction. The fake, however, used all of Ty Lee's agility and acrobatic ability to effortlessly dodge the blasts getting into a position to disable Azula's arms as well. Azula, realizing this was who she sought, continued fighting back with kicks but abstained from producing any fire.

It was at that moment that the fake Ty Lee spotted the knives that Mai had dropped on the ground. Reacting quickly, "she" dodged Azula's flurry of kicks and spun around behind her. As she manuevered, a flash of spirit energy caused Ty Lee's form to be replaced by Mai's. Azula spun around to kick once more but she was too slow as the phony Mai picked up the knives from the ground and tossed them pinning Azula to a tree by her clothes much like Ty Lee had been.

"I concede." Azula stated, a statement neither Ty Lee or Mai thought they would ever here. "It appears the stories are true and the master spy and assassin really could change into other people. Isn't that right Liang?" she asked.

"A gift from when I visited Koh the Facestealer in my younger days." Liang replied still Mai's form, "I had ended up in the Spirit World... well it has been at least four decades so my memory is not what it was being near sixty-years-old and all. Koh had taken my face but even without a face I fought on and impressed by my tenacity Koh did something he never did: he restored it." Liang explained, "And in the process bestowed upon me a gift: you see all living things give off spiritual energy. Their appearances, skills, thoughts, personalities... all of it exists as free-flowing spirit energy. By harnessing this energy I am able to tap into the very essence of a person taking not only their form but everything about them. I look like them, fight like them, I can think and act just like them. I am them. That is what is called Formbending."

Azula smiled. "A useful talent and that is why I have come to you Master Liang." She explained, "Though you retired from service twenty years ago your talents are needed now more than ever. We humbly request your help in using your abilities to spy on the Avatar. Become his friends, the people he meets along the way, those close to him... everyone. And if the opportunity presents itself... kill him."

Liang used one of his pale, dainty hands to stroke one of Mai's long strands of hair. "An enticing offer. Using my abilities again has been exhilarating. Perhaps I may consider your offer." A smile then crept onto his borrowed face, "Or perhaps I am enjoying my retirement. Perhaps I refuse. What then, hmm?" he asked.
11531221.title: Last Airbender: A new character

choices: Liang honors his word to Azula
115312211.content:
"If you refuse to help," Azula began, "then you shall be hunted down like a dog. You and your unique form of bending cannot be allowed to fall into the wrong hands."

"Fall into the wrong hands... like I'm some kind of weapon, huh?" Liang asked. "Besides even if I did refuse how would you hunt me down? I just handled all three of you and if you send for an army, well..." with that he changed again, this time into Azula, "I can just become one of your little friends... or you Princess. I could eliminate you here and now and take your place and as the Princess and a military leader I could have your friends here tossed into prison if they don't want to cooperate because who else would know?"

Ty Lee gasped in surprise while Mai stood stonefaced. Azula narrowed her eyes while her clone wore a vicious smirk similar to the one Azula had worn earlier. After a tense moment, however, Liang began to laugh and changed back into himself. "Of course retired or not I am a proud citizen of the Fire Nation first and foremost and if this situation is indeed grave then I shall be more than happy to offer my services." he stated while removing Azula from the tree she was currently attached to. "But first, as it is already early evening, I implore you to stay for the night."

"We could use the rest and the food I suppose and then leave for the Capital in the morning." Azula stated.

"And I would be most honored to have the Princess and her companions stay in my humble home." beamed Liang.

Azula smirked. "Then it is decided." she declared.

It was later in the night when Liang, who had been sitting outside in front of the house, heard the familiar creaking of his door opening. Had Azula doublecrossed him, he wondered? Would she attempt to kill him in the dead of night? His paranoia was eased when he heard a perky female voice. "Man, hopefully some fresh air helps." it said. Liang saw the voice's owner come into view.

"Oh, it is you acrobat." he stated calmly.

"I have a name, you know." she replied in an annoyed manner.

"Yes, Ty Lee." Liang nodded, "So what brings you out this late?" he asked.

"I can't sleep." Ty Lee sighed, slumping against the wall. "I've been trying for the last two hours but I just keep turning over."

Liang looked thoughtful and turned his attention towards her. "Well perhaps it is your enthusiasm.You seem quite energetic." he said.

"Yeah, you would know that wouldn't you!" Ty Lee perked up. "I mean it was a little weird when you were me but that was still cool." She shot him a smile, "Hey, do you think you could show it to me again?"

With a shrug Liang stood up and let the glowing spirit energy surround him and in a moment he had shrunk considerably, becoming a 12-year-old girl decked in Earth Kingdom clothing. Her hair was tied into a bun but in the front hung loosely over her face in front of her most prominent features, her white eyes; an indication of blindness.

"Whoa, that's... that's one of the people we're pursuing!" Ty Lee exclaimed in shock.

"Toph Bei Fong, yes." Liang replied, "I remembered seeing her, and all of the Avatar's friends, in your memories when I had become each of you."

"So what's it like" asked Ty Lee.

"Being so small is strange yet looks can be deceiving as this girl has quite a bit of power to her." Liang answered, with that he gave a quick stomp and caused a small piece of the ground to lift up. "She's an amazing Earthbender and can do things that perhaps no other Earthbender has been able to do. She's also blind but I can still 'see' due to vibrations travelling through the ground."

With that he changed back into himself. "You know Ty Lee, I am making some tea as you can see. If you're interested in a cup I have an extract from a plant around here that I can add to your's that should help you sleep."

Ty Lee's eyes lit up, "Oh wow, really? Yeah that'd be nice!" she exclaimed.

"Then I shall head inside and get it." Liang replied. As he walked into the house's kitchen and looked through the cupboards he came across two containers of the extract. One was what he had mentioned to Ty Lee but the other... he had lied about pulling the Avatar and his friends from their memories. A week earlier that group had in fact passed by here on their travels and much like now he had offered them a place to stay for the night. In talking to them he had learned of some of the terrible things the Fire Nation had committed during its war. Some he was aware of but some were new to him. Having retired in disgust twenty years earlier, he had told the group of his history and that he might eventually offer assistance to the resistance.

However he had given his word to the Fire Nation Princess and as an older man did he really desire to spend the rest of his life in hiding and on the run? At the very least honoring his word to the Princess would allow him to meet up with the Avatar again.

But the burden of the things he had done while in service to the Fire Lord weighed heavily on Liang. He had done terrible things in the name of his nation and lord and for what? Imperialistic desires? He wanted to atone and redeem himself and perhaps... that OTHER container held another, much more potent version of the extract. By slipping it into Ty Lee's tea the girl would be rendered immediately unconscious, an effect that generally lasted for around two days. After knocking her out he would be able to hide her in the shack adjacent to the house and then assume her form effectively BECOMING Ty Lee. As Ty Lee he would be in the Princess' inner circle and as such would be able to feed regular report and inside information to the resistance movement.
115312211.title: Liang agrees to help the Fire Nation

choices: Liang decides to take Azula's place
Liang goes with his plan to replace Ty Lee
1153122112.content:
Though Liang had given his word to Azula he knew that in good conscience he could not follow it. He had done many terrible things in service to the Fire Nation and knew that if they were to conquer the other nations the world could fall into darkness, living under the tyrannical and oppressive iron-fisted rule of Fire Lord Ozai. With that in mind he sighed and grabbed the more potent extract. It would not kill Ty Lee and by the time she awoke he and the other two girls would be long gone. He hoped that this would prompt Ty Lee into living her life out from under the boot of Azula as she was a bright, happy girl.

Azula... Liang walked towards what had been his room, he had allowed the Princess to use it for the night, and peeked in to see her sleeping soundly. As she slept she looked peaceful and, well, like a girl. One wouldn't suspect the type of mind that laid under that appearance though, the one Liang had briefly experienced. Azula was a cold girl, ruthless and driven by the desire to be the best. She was also manipulative and brutal keeping those around her under her control through fear and coercion.

It was at this point that an idea came to Liang, an alternate method of infiltrating the upper ranks of the Fire Nation. Why impersonate one of the Princess' friends when he could just become her? As Azula he would be privy to almost all the secrets and strategies of the Fire Nation, have command over forces and have the support of her two very skilled friends. He would be the perfect mole for the resistance: someone anyone would least expect to sell out their nation. There was, however, one problem...

Azula was a fierce and vicious girl and also a master in strategy and planning. Unlike with Ty Lee if she came back, and she undoubtedly would, she could cause all kinds of havoc for him seriously endangering himself and his plans. No, unlike with Ty Lee if Liang were to become Azula he would have to find a more permanent solution. He would have to kill her.

It was not something he necessarily wanted to do. He had done his share of killing already during his previous service and this had weighed heavily upon him. However, it would be for the good of everyone: sacrificing his feelings on the matter to help the entire world. Would it be able to make up for the personal toll on his conscience however? Impersonating Azula would be far, far more effective to the "good guys" than her ditzy, acrobat friend. But there was also the catch that this would be Liang's most in-depth and most important "disguise" yet. He normally disguised only briefly, never more than a couple of days at most; being Azula would most likely be more long term. Sure the same could be said with being Ty Lee but with Azula there was the added burden of pressure, of making sure to do it right.

Would he be able to do it? To commit one last assassination and to replace his victim, the most important disguise he would ever take. The killing would be easy: put Ty Lee to sleep, knock Azula unconscious and then find a way to quietly dispose of her. But putting it like that sounded so cold. Perhaps knocking out Ty Lee and taking her place was indeed the better option of the two.
1153122112.title: Liang replaces Ty Lee

choices: Ty Lee had only been pretending to sleep
11531221121.content:
Steeling himself, Liang made what he thought was the right decision. He grabbed the container of extract and headed outside. "I have returned, child, with the extract that I prom--" he was stopped mid-sentence, however, at the sight of Ty Lee, still sitting against the wall. However this time, her head was drooping downwards, her eyes closed and the sound of soft snoring could be heard. She had fallen asleep on her own.

"Well, this certainly makes things easier." Liang muttered to himself as he headed back into the house. He put the extract back into the cabinet and grabbed the vile of the more potent variety which, compared to the one he had just had, worked almost instantaneously. As he entered the room where Azula slept, he thought to himself that he'd need a way to easily and discreetly get the liquid into Azula's mouth which was agape just ever so slightly. He was then struck by an idea: the extract was a liquid, of course!

Concentrating he transformed, hoping the glow from the energy wouldn't wake Azula, into Katara, a girl that had been travelling with the Avatar. As Katara was a waterbender, it was a simple matter of manipulating the liquid extract out of the container and guiding it into Azula's slightly open mouth. The movements were precise and as the liquid made it's way into her, Azula let out a series of soft moans before eventually stopping; the extract had done its job and now Liang needed to finish it. He needed a way to kill Azula as quietly as possible and cursed his fortune.

Though his formbending was indeed incredibly powerful, it had limits. At first Liang thought that the easiest solution would be to transform into an airbender and use airbending to suck all the air out of Azula's lungs asphyxiating her. However one of the few limits on his ability was that he was only able to transform into a living person and all of the airbenders were dead... all except for Aang. Unfortunately Aang was the Avatar and the second limitation placed on him was that he could not transform into the Avatar. And those rules also ruled out Avatar Yangchen. But they had given him another idea.

Quickly, he transformed into Ty Lee once more and once again steeling himself, he delivered a pair of quick chi blocking strikes to both sides of Azula's throat. This caused her throat muscles to paralyze and after about a minute or so her breathing eventually stopped. He had done it, he realized. He had killed Azula. Looking around the room he found a large enough sack and moved to disrobe Azula; for conveniences sake he would need to keep her clothes around to "change into" in order to avoid suspicion. Seeing the now naked Azula was, to Liang's surprise, making him a bit excited.

He looked down at his own body, well Ty Lee's body, and marvelled at how fit and limber it was as well as its two most defining "features." If it was one thing that Liang did not shy away from when using his powers, it was to take the shapes of females and become quite well acquainted with their forms. Perhaps at some point he would have to do so with Ty Lee, Mai, Katara and others in addition to Azula's.

Shaking it off, he proceeded to place Azula's now lifeless body into the sack and picking it up due to Ty Lee being stronger than she appeared he carried it outside to the side of the house making sure to grab Azula's robe along the way. He then transformed into Toph and used her earthbending abilities to create a hole in the ground six feet deep, pushing Azula's body into it and then using earthbending to cover it up.

Liang then, finally, transformed into Azula... albeit a nude version of her. He had intended to quickly put the robe on and get back to bed but looking at his new body now... he was surprised at how beautiful it is. There was a sensuality to it that went beyond Azula's teenage years. Shaking his head, Liang picked the robe up and put it on but still his new form called to him. Teased him. Unable to control himself he slipped a hand beneath the fold of the robe and massaged a breast. This caused him to let out a sensual moan in Azula's quite seductive voice. It felt amazing and getting into it, Liang pulled the bottom of the robe up in order to manuever the other hand a little lower...
11531221121.title: Liang decides to take Azula's place

choices: He should go along with azula's plan for now, waiting for a good opportunity.
11531221122.content:
Liang sighed, looking at azula's sleeping body, memories of children, his, others came back to mind. He had killed countless innocents, but he always avoided killing children, and azula, though powerful, cunning, machiavelical, was still a child. He could, he thought, for the greater good. But he had already killed too much for a "greater good" and just wanted to do what felt right. May the spirits forgive me, should i fail he thought, closing the door to azula's room, he may kill again, but someone who deserved it, not some egotic child.

But stil, his plan to be Ty Lee continued to be defective, from the memories he had of her, he knew she was loyal and loving, he did not think she would stay down in his muddy house and know he was using her to betray her friends. Quite the conundrum, he thought, how could he help the resistance without killing anyone? Maiming seemed even worse on such young girls, and he did not want to imprison them either.

He sat back in one of the wooden kitchen chair, slightly damp from the humidity, thinking he could maybe pretend to be mai, but the girl was not keen of being bored and patronized, out of pure spite, she would surely come back to annoy him.

But perhaps he had taken the problem by the wrong end, perhaps...
11531221122.title: Double of the Ditzy Dancer.

115312211221.content:
Perhaps, after all, it was time to use his power to their full extent again...

When he was younger, and he and his husband had children, he thought he could hide his family, after all, you don't become a royal assassin without making a few ennemies, and his reputation assured that someday, his loved ones would be in danger. That's when he started to experiment with formbending, when instead of shifting himself, he turned a person into another, memories, thoughts and all, however, this technique was very dangerous, first of all, the pain experienced by anyone who transformed must've been unbearable, if his lover were to be trusted, and the energy of said person did not continue to flow in the same way after, point being, after one month, there was no return to their original selves, for apart from some scattered memories and scattered thoughts, they were the person.

That had been his wake up call, when he had gotten home from a 3-month mission and realized he'd lost his loved ones, now a mediocre shopkeeper family just 3 miles south of where he lived, disgusted with himself, he abandonned his carreer, and only his visit from the avatar a few weeks earlier reconciled him with his bending, now, he was unsure, but his new plan formed gradually into his head, maybe, he could turn one of the girls into someone else, and become this person, if he kept this form, he could return it later, even a thousand years after, he could give the avatar a new ally.

But another plan, more convoluted suddenly came to his mind, perhaps he could do just what he was asked, infiltrating team avatar, becoming one of aang's friends, but this time, he'd need an assistant, someone who could infiltrate team avatar with him and feel more "empathetic" towards the revolution, of course, he'd have to keep tabs on everyone involved, but if he could get the princess out of the capital...
115312211221.title: The doubles dilemna

1153122112211.content:
His second plan seemed too complicated, even for him, for starters, it implied revelating the true nature of his powers, as well as seeing through the lies he told everyone. But he also had a yearning for some skins, the skins of confident, powerful people, it was the reason he had stayed an earth kingdom general for 3 months, he'd just liked the power, and azula was of the perfect sort, young, beautiful, devious and cunning, impersonating her would be one of the best things he could do.

As he set on becoming azula, he asked himself who azula should become, after all, it would take time before she became someone else, perhaps she'd wake up in 2 days, 3 with a stronger dose, then 2 days to get herself out of the woods, then 8 days to reach the capital, if she had to go on foot, however, that was if she could travel in broad daylight, the idea of giving her a body and the mind of an outlaw was tempting, he knew that in twelve days, people tended to stop their ordinary way of thinking and to think second naturedly as two people: he liked this idea. But he had to find the right person, who could join the avatar as a powerful ally, while possessing in its depths azula's cunning and devious mind.

As he approached azula's bed, wearing the form a water tribe healer he once knew, he smiled as he'd found who Azula would be trapped within.
1153122112211.title: Not the same person

11531221122112.content: How about Hama, the bloodbender?
11531221122112.title: Becoming older

choices: Ebony dark'ness dementia raven way all the way
115312211221121.title: A new hope

1153122112212.content:
He ultimately was satisfied with the solution, he'd turn the girls into members of the gaang and their various friends and make them turn, it would not be easy, or simple in any way, but it felt right. He finally settled on the diluted sleeping tea, and joined ty lee who was fiddling with her fingers on the porch, she told him she was trying to press her chi points on and off again, something tha, in the girl's word "wiggled her aura blueish" Liang and her spent the rest of their time awake talking about life in the capital versus life in the country, while drinking the tea and eventually, both of them went to sleep.

*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤* ¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*¤*

The next morning, he woke up early and went for a walk in the swampy forest, he always liked the smell of the morning dew, he exercised, then finally turned into ty lee, climbing up a nearby tree to pick some pawpaw-peaches, he then went back home, eventually taking the eggs his sheepcken had laid last night, when he finally entered the small kitchen that served also as an entrance, he saw azula, looking a bit disheveled from sleeping on what was honestly a plank of wood (albeit a comfortable one, by fire army standards, she had taken of her chest armor and was now wearing a red-ish ______ , stil the girl looked as alert as possible, while ty lee and mai, who had slept in a tent behind the house, still moaned from exhaustion as they were waking up.

"So" started liang, who knew it would be no use to try and beat around the bush with azula "I've come up with a plan to effectively kill the avatar"

"I sincerely hope for you it's not something like "stab him while he's sleeping" because that kind of thing doesn't work" responded azula with a deadpan expression on her face

"Is it me or" said liang as he turned into azula to light out a cooking fire "do you feel a certain admiration for his capacities?"

Azula stayed silent a few seconds, she had not been impressed by liang's bending but rather by the foolishness of his question. "Of course i do, he may be a child, but he is certainly one of the most powerful opponents i've faced, he has already mastered 3 elements, 2 this last few months, and my deserting cowardly brother must be teaching him firebending as we speak, i'd be a fool if i didn't find that impressive for a 13 year old"

"Quite true, princess" said luang, who had reverted back into himself while he was cooking "And that is exactly why taking him head on is such a dangerous idea, and counting your brother, he is allied to three dangerous benders, as well as a skilled swordfighter, and he has left the capital with other unindentified allies, has he not?"

Azula nodded, without breaking eye contact with Liang

"But where you failed, princess, is that you have considered only that in your hunt for him, how he attacks, how he moves, how to defeat him"

Liang marked a pose as he estinguished the fire under the omelet, covering it with berries and pawpaw-peaches juice.

"The avatar, despite being a powerful opponent, has a profoundly optimistic nature, it is due to his young age, but his upbringing as well, and since he has accumulated achievments, is in company of his friends, he still stays optimistic, doesn't he?"

Azula nodded again, but this time, she was frowning, mai and ty lee, who had sat next to her, listened to him with one ear as they gulped down the omelet he had been slicing.

"What we need to do" Continued liang as he sat down in front of the girls, "is to break his worldview, to destabilize him, imagine waking up to your best friend" he said as he stared intently at mai "to suddenly be cold and heartless, not indulging in what you like or want"

"Must be terrible" answered mai flatly, raising an eyebrow, liang had a hard time supressing a laugh at mai's quip, as well as ty lee.

"How do you intend to do that?" cut azula, " If zuko has joined them, they may know about your existence and be wary, i do not think formbending is perfect to the point where nothing is suspect"

"I won't do that" said liang "you will"
1153122112212.title: Planning ahead

choices: "Does it have to be the three of us?" asked azula, looking at ty lee and mai
11531221122121.content:
As the old man explained how he would force the energies of other members of the team avatar on them, Mai shivered in her seat, if they weren't careful, they would be trapped in the minds and bodies of their foes, essentially, thought mai, a death unto itself, even worse, the old man did not know wether they would be aware of such a condition, or if their spirit would eventually vanish as well.

But the prospect of infiltrating team avatar was to good to pass for azula, who accepted with a smirk in her eye, the idea of breaking the avatar's trust seemed to cheer her up (if she could ever be described as cheery thought mai in the back of her mind)

Liang had led them outside to demonstrate the formbending he would attempt on them, then, without warning, he turned into mai and threw a knife in their direction, azula made a move to dodge, but it hit a bird that was flying above them with the handle of the throwing knife, the bird fell to their feet while liang/mai approached them.

He made a quick description of the type of bird it was, a hummingull, his anatomy, his food preferences, his way of flying...

He then pressed his mai hand on the bird, breathing at a steady pace for one minute, then, he opened his eyes, who were suddenly bloodshot, as though he had stayed too long in a pool, and a blinding white light enveloped the bird, whose shape morphed to a harephant in a few seconds, even though mai never loved animals, her father had bought her one when she was young, it looked quite like hers actually, except hers was old and wrinkly, whereas it was like she had recieved it again.

Except for the screeching of course.

The small beast was convulsing vividly, screeching through both his small trunk and his mouth, breathing with the regularity of a writing.com update, it slashed the hair and shook his ears everywhere. Mai felt sick, ty lee was vomiting, and even azula's face looked somewhat worried. Eventually, the harephant calmed down, as liang was petting it with concern and attention. It looked weird she thought, her face so soft and animated, with such worry, she looked... different with liang inside her.

"If i can believe the people i've tried it on, and i know i can, said liang, regaining his form, is that it hurts as if your whole body, inside and outside, had been put in a frying pan, the rest is an... aftertaste" concluded Liang. "Of course, as a masterassassin, i have some very potent sleeping extracts, one drop of them could knock you out for two days straight" he said, crossing his arms "and you would feel no pain, however..."

"However?" asked ty lee, looking extremely worried

"You would wake up one day after, after being a different person, having their thoughts, their dreams, this can be a very excructiating experience, said Liang, one friend of mine was overpowered by someone else's personality, and was convinced to be an earth kingdom merchant until i changed him back"

Liang reflected one second, he percieved the opportunity for a good lie, for the revolution.

"Coupled with very common ingredients, i was able to make a 20 year old archer girl that she was a 60 year old decadent artist" Azula raised a quizzical eyebrow "April fool's prank were more elaborate back then" smiled Liang "Point being, we can create people to our liking as well" continued Liang "If you girls disappear from the capital or the military, it will be suspicious, and the avatar might be on guard, we will need to be as discreet as possible, so, we have to find people to replace you, and even hold your form if the mission fails and you stay trapped in other bodies, is all of that OK?"

Mai felt positively sick at the idea of another mai in the world, thinking she was the real mai, and herself trapped in an escapeless body, it was not OK.

But her opinion didn't matter after all, it was up to azula to choose
11531221122121.title: To change a mockingbird

115312211221211.content:
"If it comes to a fight or if we are found out, it might be more appropriate to be in the best fighting position, as such, i'd consider replacing the three benders, no offence" he added as he looked at mai and ty lee.

"You just said three, added azula, will you not come with us?"

"No, i will be here, countered Liang, if Avatar aang is to believe people do not like him without suspicion, we must introduce someone he trusts and likes who suddenly will not like him, someone who could not wish him harm"

"The kyoshi warrior" Said mai

"Herself" nodded Liang, agreeably surprised "I'll pretend i escaped the boiling rock, and that i've thought about my friends for the whole time, that it kept me going, and then, over the next couple of days..." Liang then broke a twig he picked up on the ground, looking cold and death like for an instant, mai did definitely not like him.

"Just a question, asked ty lee, looking concerned, you said it would hurt when we become other people"

"Yes?"

"But when we become ourselves again, does it hurt? asked ty lee, and will we still know who we are?"

"Allow me to answer" said Liang as he picked up the harephant, he then looked at ty lee and said " It's all in the back"

With that, he threw the rabbit that had started to faintly glow as if if it was a baseball, it looked like a comet, until the small bird emerged, chirping melodiously as it flew in circles while pedaling with his two small bird legs

"As you can see, it feels great joy, but he still thinks he's got to walk like a rabbit in a way, you'll be experiencing an aftertaste of the personality you were inside for quite the time, but it will be nothing more"

Ty lee felt reassured hearing this, but mai was still nervous at the whole prospect of becoming someone else

"Who will i become then? asked azula"
115312211221211.title: "Who will we impersonate?" asked azula

choices: "Just get going" responded mai before anyone could answer
1153122112212111.content:
"It makes sense to me that a powerful person such as yourself shall remain the most powerful, princess" said Liang, with all the honesty his voice was capable of.

"Oooooh, is she going to be the earthbender?" asked ty lee, seemingly very interested in azula's possible transformation.

"We do not have the same definition of powerful" responded Liang "In terms of pure, raw strength, the earthbender is indeed the most admirable of the two, however" he said as he changed into katara's form "This girl has other powers, first of all, she has healing powers, which is a tactical advantage not to overlook, secondly, she is the moral pillar of the team, she has more influence over how the avatar feels than any of them, and lastly..."

Katara's body paused for a moment, liang was wondering if he should tell azula first about bloodbending, or let her learn of it by herself, eventually, he decided against it, the full moon was in two days, and he did not want her to rush mastering such a devastating technique.

"She has heart" concluded Liang. He always had thought the strength of humankind residing in their heart, in their love, in truth, this was precisely why he had chosen katara's form for azula, it would make her experience compassion for the girl, for they were both orphan of their mothers, both striving to be the best, and yet so different, he hoped that in understanding katara, azula would eventually tend to like her.

"Why should we care if she has heart?" asked azula defiantly

"One trusts one with heart young princess" countered liang "And this girl has the trust of all, you will have the power to break that trust, and broken trust is more devastating that any of you can imagine"

Azula then shut up, looking troubled, possibly angry, after all, the girl had her trust broken once, though she did not see it in these regards, he had touched a sore spot, and both of them knew it. But if anything, he thought, it would make her want to understand the nature of the relationships between this katara girl and her friends.

"Then i believe it most judicious that you, acrobat, shall imitate the beifong girl, you are close to her in character, and in fighting style as well, i believe you should be a natural fit"

Ty lee seemed extremely pleased at this decision, and her smile shone as bright as azula's fire. Azula was still frowning, but she seemed satisfied by this decision, then, with a smirk, she turned to...

"Mai, i believe you are the most fit to impersonate the young prince, you have the most... intimate connection to him, if i might say, and your unhappy nature resembles him as well, and even though i know it's the last person you wanted, i do think might be ultimately for the best"

Of course, it was a blatant untruth, his true motivation was to make the girl understand the convoluted reasons of why zuko had turned to the avatar's side, something azula could have easily dismissed, but to which mai would be more understanding, the fact that zuko had seen horrors of war that mai did not believe in was also a plus, finally he also liked the idea of Mai and Zuko sharing the same mind, it was pretty fun, he thought with a devious smile.

"Any objections?"
1153122112212111.title: The heart has power

choices: "I'll go" said mai, who had stopped blushing
11531221122121112.content:
Liang was, for the first time since a week, surprised, he'd have thought mai would be objecting, but here she was, accepting her predicament first, he'd have to delve into her mind tonight to understand her reasons. But he was as happy as can be, after all, the role he'd given the girls served his purposes, and here they were, accepting them, this was going more smoothly than a waterbender sailing at sea.

"Who wishes to start then?" he asked, curious to see which girl would answer first.

Ty lee looked hesitant, and was twiddling with her fingers nervously, expecting to see how it would affect someone else, thought Liang.

Mai was furiously blushing, whatever was the reason she had chosen to bring the team along in his plan, she was embarrassed from it, and as such, she might've been embarrassed to go first, she was looking with some awkwardness at her shoes, while she tried to cool down.

Azula finally answered "I'm the leader, am i not? It means i gotta go first, doesn't it?" The question was rhetorical, of course, and she had put on a pompous air he knew wasn't hers, he also recognized the words as something general iroh, his former superior, and azula's uncle, might've said.

"Very well, said Liang, as he turned towards Azula, Ty lee, Mai, could you go get us some water? i'll also need the sleep extract i gave you, it's in the red box"

Ty lee and mai went to the kitchen with slow, deliberate steps, while he was not looking at them, he could feel glances of curiosity aimed at him. However, he was looking at Azula, who was keeping composure, though her left hand trembled slightly. Azula was gazing at him too, her eyes, though in their calm, defiant look, had gained in size, it was the look of men before hard times, who knew they were going to endure, without breaking eye contact, she asked, her voice seemingly disinterested, though trembling: "Does it hurts too bad?"

Liang tried to plaster a kindly smile on his face, as he answered "Did you know i studied medecine in the army?"

Azula didn't flinch, she knew the look of men monologuing from the first syllabe.

"Well, one day, i learned that some flying creatures, as well as some tpes of hares, have twice as much human nerves as a normal human? quite surprising actually, they must feel things so... differently

Liang tried to mark a dramatic pause, though azula was a bit relieved, she hated dramatic poses, and kept her look on liang as tough as possible

"One really learns interesting things, or meets interesting people, i knew of a water tribe healer, some girl, i tell you, she couldn't heal a scratch, but she made some trick with the nerves and BAM! couldn't feel my arms or legs, glad i wasn't on the other hand of her water"

"Why didn't you tell us that?" said azula, in a spiteful tone.

"Excuse an old man wanting to put on a show princess, but i wanted to show you the worst that can happen, so you'd feel relief when i have to turn you, it's also worthwhile, if i am to fight by your side, to see how all of you react to threats and obstacles."

"Is that all?" Asked azula, seeing through his lie

"I also like frightening royalty" smiled liang "i guess your father never told you of the turtle duck your uncle sent him"

Azula was about to respond, but Mai and Ty lee had come back, carrying respectively a jar of the rain water he used to shower, and a small radish-colored box.

Liang then shifted silently into a woman close to his age, her brown skin burnt in the neck, wearing a green earth kingdom man-ish garb, with a matching dome-shaped hat, only a blue and purple collar wrapped around her neck and her sea blue eyes betrayed her water tribe origins. She then sat down cross legged in front of azula, with somewhat of a severe air about her. Liang, walking down on memory lane, observed the last 8 years of the woman known as Kayltanuq, she had gone south, and in doing so had joined the earth colonies resistance, and had perfectioned herself while living in the swamp, however, she deserted it a year before the fall of ba sing se, he knew why: revenge. She was coming for him. At the moment, she was in Yu Dao, negotiating the fare of a boat incognito to ember island. Where he had been living ten years ago. he couldn't help but smile at her determination.

"Sit down princess" he said with the rough voice of someone who smoked a lot or was buried in a meat smoking cave for a week thought liang.

She first took a blob of water from the jar, scooping brutally with her bare hand. She heated it up with the mastery she retained from three other benders, and took the jar from Ty lee's hand in a swift motion. The floating sphere was then troubled by the deep greenish brown of the herbs, she then changed it from steam to water, then to steam, until every drop of useful chemical was extracted. She then divided it into three distinct spheres, and hanged them in front of the girls.

"Need a straw?" She asked with what Kayltanuq once called affectionately her Deaf Grandma Voice He'd really have to get back in touch one day, once the whole gonna kill you thing would be sorted out.

While he was thinking, the three girls had drank the infusion, and they'd sat as well, their eyelids being more heavy by the minute.

Liang then bent the rest of the jar to lightly cover azula's body, as if it were mucus, leaving only her head and some part of her front untouched by the water, in order not to kill her organs (something that his poor liver hadn't had the luck to do)

All of azula seemed to shine brightly, as she was slowly losing control of her body, her head slumping downwards, as Liang approached her withered hand from azula's forehead, she paused inches away, looking at ty lee and mai's dizzy but concerned expression. She opened her palm, and in one swift strike, she hit azula's forehead, pushing her to fall downwards, as her water and azula's body shone as bright as any fire, any color, any light from any star.

And Katara fell unconscious between Mai and Ty lee.

"Who's next?"

choices: Try and contact her past lives again
115312221221.content:
Korra couldn't be happier to have air bend to her will. After so long of trying and struggling and countless hours of frustration, she had learned the fourth element.

Sure, she had a long way to go until she mastered it. A gust of wind would hardly save the world if something more dangerous than Amon ever showed up. It had stopped him, but it was because he had been as surprised as she had. Now that the world knew she was capable of bending all four elements, a new danger would not likely make the same mistake.

Thus, despite her happiness at having the element to control, her frustration built quickly as she practiced. She knew airbending now, but the techniques seemed to come almost to her as difficult as the bending itself had.

"Don't force it," Tenzin said. "Balance should come with peace of mind."

Korra gritted her teeth as she got back to her feet. Peace of mind, yeah right, she thought. She didn't know who Tenzin was fooling, but with her aggravation there was no way she was going to master that right now. Still, she attempted to reel in her temper as she circled her arms, creating a ball of air. She jumped up and got into a sitting position with one leg down. She pointed her toes into the ball of air, and for a moment she remained up on the air scooter. A second later, she slipped off easier than if it had been a ball of ice. With a painful thud, she slammed the ground.

Korra stood up and breathed out angrily. Flickers of flame darted from between her teeth.

"I think a break is in order," Tenzin said. "We'll start again in ten minutes."

Korra's hands balled into fists. "Yes, Master Tenzin," she grumbled. She kicked the ground--sending a small stone off into the bay--and stomped off out of the courtyard.

She went down to the beach and sat down on the rocky shore there. "How do airbenders do that?" she wondered aloud. "It's like they can just shut off emotion at a whim."

She crossed her legs into a meditative pose. Tenzin was patient, but he didn't seem to understand how hard it was for her to keep her temper in control. Avatar Aang might not either, but as the previous avatar he would have a better understanding of the frustrations associated with mastering multiple bending styles.

Korra sat for minutes, trying to calm down enough to enter the meditative state necessary to commune with Aang and the previous avatars. When the shift finally came, she felt her mind leave her body.

When she opened her eyes, she was disturbed to see a different sight than when she usually entered the spirit world. She was in what appeared to be a stone hallway, but the ground beneath her was feet was smooth like marble.

"Aang?" she called out.

"He's not here," said a squeaky, timid voice behind Korra.

Korra spun around in surprise to see a small, cloaked figure standing there. "Who are you?" she asked, shocked.

"I am Trigreau," the cloaked figure said. "Welcome, Avatar."

Korra paused. "Yes. How did you know?" she asked.

Trigreau looked up, and while the hood of the cloak concealed much of its face, Korra was able to see the lower half of a woman's face. "You have been here before, avatar," Trigreau said. "In a previous life, long ago of course," she added.

"Oh?" Korra asked. "Well, uh, it's nice to, I guess, meet you again?"

Trigreau giggled. "Indeed," she said. "What brings you back to my family's home, Avatar?"

Korra looked around. "I'm not really sure," she said. "I was trying to speak with my past lives and I wound up here."

"Ah," Trigreau said. "As before. Then perhaps we will have as much fun as before."

"Fun?" Korra asked. "What happened last time?"

"Your past life took me to see the real world," Trigreau said. "It was so magnificent. I would like to go again and see how it has changed."

"Er... okay," Korra said nervously. "How do I... take you?"

"Like this," Trigreau said. With that, her form began to glow white. Her form lost definition as she became little more than an aura of light. When the change was complete, the glow of light drifted towards Korra.

Korra stepped back nervously. "What are you doing?"

"I cannot enter the real world on my own," Trigreau said. "I must have a host."

Korra's eyes widened. "Wait! Don't you-"

Korra had about turned to run, but Trigreau's light consumed her. Her mouth was forced open, and she could feel the warmth of the light entering her. When Trigreau had entered her completely, the world instantly vanished.

Korra's real eyes flashed open in shock and she gasped from the sudden change. She looked around hastily, reacquainting herself with her surroundings. "Trigreau?" she asked.

"I am here," came Trigreau's voice. It sounded as if it came from inside Korra.

Korra looked down at her body. "Uh... so you're not going to... take over my body or anything right?" she asked.

"No, I will not," Trigreau said. "But there is no room in here. The body of the avatar is always so full of spirit."

Suddenly a hot feeling began to burn in Korra's chest, and she reached up to clench at the feeling. "OW!!! What are you doing?"

"I need room," Trigreau said.

A strange feeling welled up in Korra's chest between her breasts. She looked down and her eyes widened in shock. Her breasts were moving apart from each other, stretching her clothes a bit wider than before! And as they moved apart, a pleasurable sensation grew out of the burn and strange sensations in between them. As she watched, a third mound began to form there.

"What?!" she exclaimed. She grabbed the collar of her shirt and pulled it out to look down. Sure enough, a third breast was growing there, and as it grew so did the sensation of pleasure.

When finally the third breast attained the size of her original two, the sensation overtook her and surged through her body in one powerful wave. Korra looked up at the sky and had to resist crying out in ecstasy. It was an incredible feeling, and while it only lasted for a few moments, it left her sweating and panting.

Korra stood panting for several seconds before she reminded herself of what had just happened. She looked back down to still see the third breast there.

"What did you do?!" she exclaimed.

"I made room," Trigreau said. "I hope you do not mind the good feeling. I did not want you to feel the pain I would have caused."

Korra stared down for several seconds. She had to do something now, because she had no idea what she was dealing with with. She would have to...
115312221221.title: Multiple Spirits

1153122212212.content:
Korra shook her head. Looking down at this third breast, she figured this was something she did not want to let others know about. With her past lives at least the knowledge wouldn't go anywhere. Tenzin probably could help, but Trigreau had said she had met one of her past lives. If so, then perhaps that past avatar would know what to do.

Korra sat down, but even as she did she felt her bra snap. It had already been stressed with the third breast, but sitting down seemed to be the end of its tolerance. Korra fumed as she got into her meditation pose. When this is over with, I'd better put on a new one, she thought.

"What are you doing?" Trigreau asked. I want to see the world.

"I can't go into the city with three breasts," Korra replied. "I need to talk to my past life that met you. Do you remember what his name was?"

Her name was Anaya, Trigreau said. "She came from the Earth Kindgom."

Korra closed her eyes and started to recede into her meditation. Avatar Anaya, I need your advice, she thought as her spirit started to separate from her body.

When the shift came, she opened her eyes. She frowned however when she found she was back in Trigreau's home. "Again?" she asked.

We should go, Trigreau said, suddenly sounding fearful but still speaking from within Korra.

Korra looked down to see she still had her third breast. "How do I get out to find my past lives?" she asked.

Be quiet! Trigreau said, still scared. They might hear you!

Korra looked around the hallway she was in. She listened for a few seconds before finally whispering, "Who?"

My sisters, Trigreau said. We need to get out. Go to the end of the hall!

Korra nodded and hurried quietly towards the end. Trigreau's fear infected her as well, and she found she wanted to be away from here as much as Trigreau did. When she reached the end of the hall, she reached for the door in front of her.

Not that one! Trigreau exclaimed. "On your left!"

Korra withdrew her hand as if shocked before grabbing the doorknob to her left. She pulled it open, and through it she saw a swamp ahead of her. She stepped out and closed the door behind her carefully so as not to make any noise. "Can they hear us now?" Korra asked.

"No, we're safe," Trigreau said. With that, Korra felt a warmth in her throat and tingling in her third breast.She looked down, but a second later an invisible force pulled her head back and opened her mouth. Light poured out of her mouth and drifted a few feet away from her before reshaping into Trigreau's form.

"That's uncomfortable," Korra said as the force let go of her.

"I apologize," Trigreau said. "But now that we are safe from my sisters, I can walk free."

"What's so bad about them?" Korra asked. She glanced down. "They're-- hey! I've still got a third boob!"

Trigreau nodded. "Yes. I left it there so I can go back in."

Korra sighed. "There's got to be some other way you can come to the physical world," she muttered.

"I need a host," Trigreau said. "Avatar Anaya will tell you the same."

Korra looked around. "Oh yeah, where is she? Actually, where are we?"

"We are in the spirit world," Trigreau said. She smiled. "It is primal, compared to your city." She looked up a bit, as if reminiscing. "The physical world has changed so much since last I was there. In that short time, I saw the sky-touching towers and the giant balloons. It is so different than it used to be."

"Yeah, it is," Korra said. "That's how I felt when I came to Republic City after leaving the South Pole."

"It's incredible," Trigreau said. She looked back at Korra. "I think if you call for Avatar Anaya now, she will come."

"Oh, okay," Korra replied. She looked around. "Avatar Anaya! I need to speak with you!"

There was nothing at first except that the swamp fog seemed to be getting thicker. "Avatar Anaya!" she shouted."

The fog in front of her stirred as if something was in front of her. Korra stepped back automatically when she noticed it. A second later, someone rose up out of the fog like a ghost. The fog rose with the person before finally falling off. Before Korra stood an woman robed in a large, Earth Kingdom-green gown. She had short black hair and a pointed face. She held her arms behind her back, and there was a slight smile at the corners of her mouth.

Korra paused for a moment before finally realizing who was in front of her. She put her right fist into her left hand and bowed. "Avatar Anaya, it's nice to meet you."

"Avatar Korra, I feel the same," Anaya replied in a soft, ghostlike voice. Her eyes looked past Korra and rested on Trigreau. Her tiny, almost imperceptible smile enlarged into a joyous grin. "Trigreau! Old friend, it has been so long!"

Trigreau bowed. "Avatar Anaya, I am happy to see you once again."

Anaya nodded her head and looked back at Korra. "Ah yes, I see you have already taken Trigreau to the physical world." Her eyes dropped to Korra's chest for a moment as she spoke.

Korra rubbed the back of her head in embarrassment. "Yes. I wanted to know how you took her without... this."

"I did not," Anaya said. She grinned mischievously before bringing her hands out from behind her back. She pressed on her gown at her stomach, flattening the fabric against her skin and tightening it over her chest. Korra's eyes widened to see--though difficult to discern under the poofy clothing--a third bulge on her chest there.

"You went around like that?!" Korra asked.

Anaya nodded. "It is why I began to wear clothes like these," she said. "I enjoyed Trigreau's company far too much to want to return to normal."

Korra gestured to her own clothing, which clearly defined her body shape. "That's not going to work with me." She put her hands on her hips. "And I can't be weighed down with large clothing. I can't take Trigreau into the physical world if I have to be like this."

Anaya nodded. "I understand. It is unnerving to have one's body forcefully changed. For a long while, when I was not adept at entering the spirit world on my own, I was upset about Trigreau's change." She looked over at Trigreau. "Friend, tell Korra about your sisters and why you want to see the physical world so much."

Korra looked back at Trigreau. "What do her sisters have to do with this?" she asked.

Trigreau sighed. "My sisters are... mischievous... at the best of times. They are little more than poltergeists at their worst. We all share this ability to take another as our host, and like me they can change a body to fit into it. But they do much more than simply make room for themselves; they play with their host's form for their own amusement. Many abominations were made by them... us... when we were free to roam the physical world before Avatar Gorli banished us to the spirit world forever. None of us can leave that place," she pointed at the building they had come out of, "without a host, and since few humans besides the Avatar manage to make it to the spirit world and return to the physical world, you can understand why it's been so long since I left that place."

"You were like them once?" Korra asked.

Trigreau nodded. "I have missed the beauty of the physical world since my punishment, and I have come to regret my actions for taking me away from it forever."

Korra looked back at Avatar Anaya. "Why did you put her back in there if she's stuck in there?" she asked.

"She asked for it," Anaya said.

"My sisters escaped when I was with Avatar Anaya," Trigreau said. "They returned to their old ways as soon as they were free. But in order to banish them back here... I had to be returned as well. We are four parts of a whole, and something that affects one of us affects all of us. I have tried to make them see the error of their ways, but instead they have become vengeful. They hurt me and torment me for fun, since there are no humans for them to use their powers on."

Korra frowned. "Did something stop you from bringing her back out?" she asked, looking at Anaya.

Anaya nodded. "I died two days after banishing them," she said. "I was weakened by the action, and the cult leader, Harscath, took advantage of that to ambush me. I did not survive, and once in the spirit world, that place becomes locked off to me. Avatar Gorli sealed those doors so that only someone from the physical world can pass through them. He did not want any allies of the sisters to free them."

Korra crossed her arms. "Okay," she said. "I can see why you want to get out." She looked back at Trigreau. "Is there any way I can host you without having... this?" She nodded down to her third breast.

"My ability to modify one's form is not limited to that," Trigreau replied. "I chose that because it is what Anaya became used to, but I can do something else. Is there some other change you would prefer?"

That worked, as Sheldon's eyes shifted from staring into the distance, and back to Penny. She was trying not to look at Howard, as that girl just couldn't leave her breasts alone.

"Oh... Oh... No!" she shook her head, obviously not answering the question. "He should have brought us back by now. You see Penny. You are Penny, aren't you?"

Shelley barely waited for the slightest nod before continuing.

"There were an infinite number of realities, where we could all appear. But whenever, another one of us arrives it makes this ... heavier ... more real."

Penny nodded, just to keep Shelley talking it did seem to keep her focused.

Behind them, there was a gasp from Howard. It didn't encourage her to look, "Heisenberg!" came the high pitched cry.

Shelley wasn't so shy, "Heisenberg!" she answered.

The two girls shared a look of deep concern.

"Heisenberg?" Penny asked.

Penny blinked as the lab appears around her.

"Yes..." she sobbed.

Raj stumbled backwards, barely able to look away from the abundant flesh on display and pressing unwisely through the too tight and too brief clothing. As he hit a chair he climbed into it.

"Oh my..." Sheldon exclaimed, unsure how else to express her confusion.

It was then that Amy entered the lab.

"Okay what's the breakthrough." she grumbled as she entered.

Her teeth clicked shut with a snap, as she took in the sights.

Raj was still in shock. So Leonard took the opportunity to introduce everyone.

"This is Penny."

Penny gave a curt nod, before burying her head back on Leonard's shoulder. He rubbed her back reassuringly... or he hoped it was reassuringly.

"Oh my."

"That's Sheldon." with an awkwardness that confirmed her identity, Sheldon gave a polite nod too.

"Oh my."

Amy's eyes wandered up and down her boyfriend's new body. Although Leonard caught her glance flicking to Penny as well.

"..and that's Howard."

"Oh." she finished.

After a moment she added, "Bernadette's parking the car."

In a little town called Riverdale Archie Andrews gathered together with his friends. Jughead munching down on his usual pile of burgers. Veronica Lodge whined about the display. Pop Tate owner of the Chok’lit watched carefully tallying all of the burgers for the ever increasing tab. Betty Cooper attempted to pin down Archie on his plans for the weekend, “So Archie what are we going to do this weekend?”

“Archie-kins if you are going to be doing something with Betty then you certainly should do something with me instead. I think we should go shopping. You can drive me in your car.” Veronica started to lay out the weekend with commanding detail.

Jughead interrupted, “Archie isn’t going to spend the weekend with you he is going to spend it hanging out with me. Ain’t that right buddy?”

“As if. Listen you disgusting human vacuum Archie-kins likes me more than you.” Veronica shot back.

Jughead dismissed, “He doesn’t have money to spend on you princess.”

Archie hoped to break up the fight, “I actually need to work on an article for my weird mysteries article. I have a few ideas that I am trying to decide on. Dilton told me that he has a new project that he is working on that he says, ‘Is a revolution for our world.’ Then there has been a lot of talk about odd activities in Picken’s park. Strange lights and the rumor mill is in full swing. Some say aliens others the ghosts and I also heard that it might be cultists.”

“Another one of kooky adventures Archie. Well count me in so I can laugh at you after it is all over.” Reggie Mantle frenemy to Archie casually strolled up.
