12111.content:
The ISS Venture Star turns slowly around you, inducing an unpleasant sense of virtigo. That, combined with the zero gravity and the nausea of cryosleep, soon has you dry retching, trying to vomit up the contents of a stomach that has been empty for five-Earth years. You swallow a few anti-sickness pills and wash them down with water squirted from a tube. They kick in during the Valkyrie ride to the planet of Pandora below, though you still slump weakly in your harness, shivering with cryosickness. The vast expanse of untouched jungle sweeps by beneath the shuttle, before giving way to the churned red mud of Hell's Gate.

You sit through the induction - exobreathers, toxic fauna, ultraviolent flora, yadda yadda. Can't be much worse than Earth, that's for sure. You listen half-heartedly, but your mind is distracting more on the thought of meeting your Avatar and walking on two legs once again.

The RDA compound has hardly been made with wheelchair access in mind, but your strong upper body and willpower power you through the clinging red clay that sticks to your wheels. Leaving long muddy marks across the immaculate floor of the Link Room, you wheel yourself towards one of the massive amnio-tanks, in which floats the body that you'll be inhabiting for the duration of your stay. The Avatar is...
12111.title: Jake Sully

12112.title: Avatar: One of the good humans

choices: The Na'vi will allow you to join with Eywa before you die.
The Avatar gestation tanks are still functional...
121122.content:
Life hasn't exactly been the idyll people hoped it would be after Quaritch and his cronies were forced from the surface of Pandora. Sure, it's great if you're Jake Sully, with your strong, healthy Avatar body and beautiful indigenous lover, but if you're a human whose Avatar died in the battle, or who never had one to begin with, life has become a struggle to survive.

Even after the fight, Eywa has continued her hostility, the alien ecosystem swallowing up the human settlements with a speed that was scary. The larger bases, such as Hell's Gate, were torn apart by hammerhead titanotheres after just a few days, the machinery trampled beneath their feet. Outlying structures were merely swallowed up by aggressive plant growth, and most can barely be found, let alone salvaged from.

The oxygen cylinders needed to replenish the exopacks are a dwindling resource, though you rounded up as many as you could. The equipment to filter breathable air from the toxic atmosphere is destroyed, once the stockpile of clean oxygen runs out. that's it - the remaining humans will die choking. At your most optimistic estimate, you've got little more than a week of oxygen left.

What really leaves an unpleasant taste in your mouth is that many of the Na'vi refuse to help search for the valuable exopack canisters. They're grateful for the help the humans gave in the battle, sure, yet they still don't trust them. You suspect most of them are simply content to wait for the remaining humans to run out of air, and remove their taint from Pandora for good.

If only you hadn't gone and got your Avatar killed, you could have transferred into it permanently, like Jake and the other Avatar pilots have done. Still, perhaps there is another way...
121122.title: Norm Spellman

choices: Put Norm in Grace Augustine's still-living Avatar body
Place Norm in the body of Neytiri's unborn child
Place the humans in the bodies of indigenous animals
1211221.content:
It's the end of another long day, as the Samson pilots its way over the treetops back to the clan's temporary home, the Tree of Souls, where they've opted to stay until a new Hometree is found. It's not been a successful search. Though you located a half-dozen of the outlying research stations, it took hours of backbreaking work trying to force your way through the tendril-like roots that now enveloped them, and in the end only one of them contained anything still salvageable. You came away with enough exopack canisters to last another day at best, but all the research stations you know of have now been thoroughly ransacked.

The Na'vi slink away from the aircraft as it touches down in the clearing. They've seen enough of the human machines to last a lifetime. Fuel is getting low too. Only a few more trips and you'll be flying on empty, and you make a mental note to keep a close eye on the gauge in the coming days - the last thing you want is to get stranded out there in the wilderness.

You sling a canister over each shoulder and jump down from the aircraft, slogging through the soft Pandoran dirt towards the huddle of tents. A tall, gangly blue figure waves as you approach.

"Hey, Norm, good haul?" Jake call, forced optimism in his voice. You can tell he's worried for you and the other humans.

"If I start taking small breaths now, I might still be here next week," you reply with a brave smile. As you get closer, you notice a dry trickle of blood running down the blue skin of his chest, and the bandages of leaves wrapped about his upper chest. "Are you okay? Did you hurt yourself?"

He waves your concern away airily. "Ah, it's nothing. Just a little leadership dispute. A few of the others... Don't worry about it."

Now that the dust has settled, the other males of the clan must have started making shows of aggression, challenging his authority as leader with the intent or either deposing him outright or simple to establish themselves in the new hierarchy, securing territory and mating rights over a number of the females. Eytukan's reign had been long and strong, each male kept firmly in line by his physical and social might. They had chaffed under his rule for many years, and Jake is in for a hard time until his authority is established.

"Look, me and Neytiri have been thinking," he grins. "We think we might have found you a solution..."
1211221.title: Another body is available.

choices: You wake up in Neytiri's womb
You wake up inside the Tree of Souls
12112212.content:
"When I say we've been discussing, I mean we've been "discussing" it, if you know what I'm saying," Jake says with a salacious wink.

"I... don't follow."

"Look, it's simple. You need bodies to upload into, right? Native bodies that can breathe this atmosphere. Except they need to be half-human, or at least part human like the Avatars, so that you can upload into them, so that you're compatible, right?"

"That's right. The Na'vi cells require the insertion of human DNA to produce viable host bodies."

Jake grins lustfully. "Oh, I've been inserting human DNA alright. Inserting it all night long, if you catch my drift. Neytiri's pregnant!"

You're stunned. "Jake, that's great news! Congratulations. I can't believe it! Honestly, I can't believe it, that should be impossible."

"Well it took a lot of trying," he chuckles. "So what do you think? How do you want to be my son?"

"Wait. Waaait, you can't mean... you want me to use... You want me to transfer my mind into your child? That's abominable! I won't do it! And besides, what of all the others?"

He shrugs. "What about them? I'm making more than enough host bodies to go around. One of the perks of being clan leader. The females have been lining up to play my blue flute. Peryal, over here!" he calls sharply, summoning a female Na'vi from the group. She is tall and strong looking, with the proud stance of a capable hunter. He bends her over, pulls aside her loincloth, and you avert your eyes as he mounts her. The two grind away for a few short minutes before he pushes her away, evidently finished. She slinks away, tail slung low between her legs.

"Jake, are you sure being clan leader isn't going to your head?" you ask cautiously. It seems very unlike Jake to be going around mating with anybody other than Neytiri. Perhaps being permanently, fully inside his half Na'vi body is having an effect on his mind, especially with male aggression and hormones so high at the moment.

He looks taken aback by your suggestion. "Norm, I'm fine. Look, do you want a new body or not?"

"I'll find another way," you say primly.

-|-|-|-|-|-|-

One week later. The vast boughs of the Tree of Souls spiral around your head. Your lungs burn as you suck desperately on the last dregs of the exopack. Your head burns. Your lips are turning blue, and you can no longer feel most of your body.

You're dimly aware that you're being carried. Voices are chanting together, hundreds of them. You are being laid out and wrapped in glowing vines. You're too weak to resist as Jake entwines the tendrils of the Tree of Souls about your head.
12112212.title: Place Norm in the body of Neytiri's unborn ...

121122121.content:
You hear Mo'at calling out above the chants. "Norm Spellman died so that Omaticaya clan might live. Today, Omatacaya clan will repay his sacrifice with a new life." It is the last thing you hear before you pass out, save for the choked gasps of your dying body.

There follows the familiar sensation of having your mind poured down a plughole, though it is less harsh than you remember the Link Beds being, and there is a presence there, comforting, all-enveloping, old, and motherly, which wraps you in its embrace, surrounding you in warm light.

When you open your eyes again, the presence remains, it is still comfortable and safe and warm, but dark. Only the faintest of light illuminates the stubby-fingered hands curled in front of your face. Your lungs no longer burn, though you still can't breath since you're submerged completely in fluid. A dark cord waves back and forth in the dimness, possibly your tail, possibly your queue, possibly an umbilical cord.

He actually did it then, you think with unease. You're grateful to be alive, though the cost doesn't bear thinking of.

You can hear Neytiri's heartbeat all around you, mingling with the distant, faint chant of the ceremony. You wonder if the other humans will be given similar new bodies.

For a long time you just float and think. There is little else to do. You count the developing fingers on your hands. Four of them on each hand, including the thumb, like a true Na'vi, rather than the five-fingered Avatars. You suppose you're only a quarter human now, being only half-Avatar. You're just grateful to have two hands and two feet. You could have been a hideous mutant.

You think you sleep, though it's very hard to tell. You can sense very little from the world outside. Every now and then you think you feel Neytiri stroking her belly, so you do your best to kick back. You try some basic morse code, though there is no reply. Evidently your mother doesn't know morse.

At least Na'vi gestation is short, you think, settling in for a long wait. For the most part, it's quite relaxing, though at one point you feel a surge of acceleration, a series of swoops, turns, and dives. Please don't tell me she's flying! In her condition?! What about the baby!

Shortly after, you feel a rather rhythmic disturbance in the fluid, and the ever present heartbeat quickens. An unpleasant realisation sets in. Jake! Not now! I'm in here! You squirm in discomfort as a series of lustful moans filter down to you. Evidently all it takes is a few high-speed aerial maneuvers to get Neytiri in the mood.

Outside, the days turn to weeks, turn to months, until finally it happens. The waters stir and a series of contractions force your from your pleasant home, out into the painful, bright, cold air. Bawling your head of in discomfort, you look up into the face of your grandmother, Mo'at. She cradles you in her arms, scrutinising you carefully before passing you into the arms of a sweaty, smiling Neytiri.
121122121.title: You wake up in Neytiri's womb

12121.content:
The bumpy entry to the dense Pandoran atmosphere shakes the vestiges of cryogrogginess from your bones. You sit huddled in the Valkyrie hanger, nursing a headache while sucking down vitamin water and pills. The safety induction, delivered by a marine to the uneducated military meat around you, makes for unpleasantly loud background noise. Wear your mask at all times blah blah blah.

Spears lightly pepper the underside as the craft makes the low approach to Hell's Gate. Barbarians must be a good shot.

The Valkyrie makes a soft landing in the churned red mud that fills Hell's Gate. Thick alien air floods the compartment as the hanger doors swing down. Even through your mask you can smell the exotic aromas of plant life. This is going to play hell with your hayfever. The safety induction marine yells in your face to disembark while you lug bags of scientific equipment down the gangway. Nobody helps you drag it through the mud to the barracks.

Another safety lecture, this time given by what you guess is the King of the hired muscle here, judging by the scras and the self-aggrandising. When its finally over, you face a long trek across the compound to the science station, where you'll be living and working for the next few years.

It's a frosty reception. Doctor Grace Augustine ignores your outstretched hand and pretends to tinker with the equipment that fills the labs.

"You must be the Xenobiologist RDA sent," she says venomously. "I read your paper on the Na'vi; arguing for their reclassification as non-sentient organisms. It's garbage."

You force a smile. "Well that's why I'm here. The RDA wanted a thourough, scientific study performed by an impartial scientist to judge if their status as sapient creatures was fully founded."

She glares daggers, but her next words are sweet as treacle. "Well then, we've got no time to waste. Let's get you in your avatar body."

She leads you across the laboratory to where a large glass chamber filled with liquid.

"Say hello to your avatar."

"But this is... I was supposed to-"

"Oh, I'm sorry," she smiles as though only just remembering something. "Your first AVATAR body failed a few months after your shuttle launched from Earth. This is your replacement."

You stare through the glass at a-
12121.title: Michael - Xenoanthropologist

choices: You go with her on a mission
You insist on setting up your own observations
121211.content:
There before you was an avatar that had a major problem, "That is a female!"

Grace grinned, "Yes. When they started the new one they seem to have flipped a chromosome." She looked at the avatar, then at you, "I can see the resemblance, but she is much better looking."

You protest, "I can't go in there as a female!"

Grace smiles wickedly, "She is viable, and as a young female, you have the most options on how to be accepted, which is not easy at any level. That body is the only one with your DNA. It is her or nothing. Are you saying you are going to abandon your research?"

You know she has you, "No. I will prove these creatures are nothing but smart animals." You put your hand to the window, "How young is she?"

Grace shrugs, "Of course, their life-spans are far greater than ours, but In human terms, she would be a late-teen. The 'age of becoming', where she must choose her path. As a female she has three choices, warrior, priestess or what we would call a home-maker." She snorts at you, "I would not even think of warrior. They train for that from a child. That leaves you with priestess or home-maker. Of course, if you acknowledge a priestess is real, that mean sentient development of a religion, and that would go against your theory. Wouldn't it?"

You glare at her, "A home-maker is perfect. I will get to observe their internal hive culture first hand."

She laughs, "Well, that culture is hard to break into as I said. You will need to earn their trust, and that is not easy to do." You also get the feeling there is something that she is not telling you. Before you can ask though, she opens a module, "Hop in. It is time for you to give her a test drive!"

You climb in, feeling very confined. Soon you are traveling down the tunnel that you heard about. Then it stops. You can feel yourself breathing. A bright light shines in your eyes. When you sit up, you can feel the undeniable shifting of breasts which you try to ignore.

After you have been cleared, and gone through training, you are walking outside one day. You are always amazed at the agility and energy of this body. You also wonder about how different you feel, and how much of it is because you are now an alien animal, or because you are female? You don't know what bothers you the most, the breasts or the absence between your legs.

An avatar walks up to you. You can recognize Grace in her face, though she is a good bit taller than you. She asks, "Ready to come and observe?"
121211.title: Female Avatar

choices: You go back to find yourself surrounded by children
You go back to find yourself tied up
1212111.content:
You realize that you have been avoiding any excessive contact with others. You are still not comfortable with the idea of being a half-naked female. But you have to do research some time. You look up at her, "Okay. When do we leave?"

She grins, "Right now!"

Before you know it, you are in an aircraft heading deep into the Pandoran forrest. You land in a clearing and follow Grace and a huge male that is somehow a marine in an avatar. As Grace is taking samples, you see the marine, Jake is his name, wander off. You are glad, since being around him was stirring strange feelings in your body. You figure that that is some proof of your theory. You are reacting on instincts, not reason. Then you worried what would happen if instincts ruled you in this body?

You notice a strange flower off to one side. As Jake wanders in one direction, you go in another. You had no idea how far you had gone until you hear some kind of strange animal call. Then growls, howls and yelling! You turn and realize that you have no idea what direction to go in to get back!

Before you can get your bearings, the ground is rumbling beneath you. You want to run, but find yourself scared. Suddenly, the bushes in front of you burst open and a hammerhead like creature runs right into you, knocking the wind out of you and launching you high through the air! You are in shock, gasping, when you hit something and everything goes black.

Soon, you find yourself back in the pod as you hear it being opened. You look up to see Grace, "What the hell were you doing!?! Where is your body now? Is it still alive?"

You look at her as you sit up. "I, I don't know. I was looking at some flowers when I heard all kinds of noise. Before I knew it, some creature rammed me, I flew through the air, then everything went black, then I was here."

Grace paced, "Then your avatar might be alright. You have been out for three hours. Most Pandorans that survive that kind of blow that long are alright. They have incredible regenerative powers. Get some rest. I won't send you back in until you have decompressed from that experience."

___________________________________________________

Back in the forrest, Akwey, a young male, had been watching the strangers. He noticed a new dream walker, a young girl, who was very attractive. If it had not been for their order to stay away from the off-worlders, he might have gone to talk to her.

From his hiding place in the tree, he heard, then saw the ruckus caused by the other new dream walker. How stupid were these people? He was frozen by indecision as he saw the beast heading toward the girl. He could save her, but he was not supposed to go to them! Too late! It hit her and sent her sailing through the air! He lost sight of her in the thickness of the leaves.

He then realized that the other off-worlders had flown off in their air machine, leaving the girl behind! He headed in the direction he had seen her thrown. Perhaps she still lived?
__________________________________________________

Your avatar body was laying limp on the forrest floor. Strange, floating seeds landed on your body. A green glow formed on the ground beneath it, especially beneath some wounded areas. You were not aware as your body glowed inside and out and healed. There was a strange glow especially through and around your hips and abdomen.
______________________________________________________

Akwey found the young girl lying on the forrest floor. When he looked, he gasped! The sacred seeds watched over her, and there was a strange glow about her. It was as though Eywa herself was healing her!

When it faded, and he saw her gasp back to life, he knew he had no choice, this was a sign! He had to take her back to Hometree! He picked her up, still awed by her beauty as she slept, then carried her home.
1212111.title: You go with her on a mission

choices: The security chief asks to see you
12121111.content:
You wake up in a strange place. As you begin to regain your senses, you realize that you are surrounded by Na’vi children! When they see you awaken, they seem to be excited and happy. As you look more, you see that you are on a bed, but more important, you are literally under the branches of Home Tree!

You see motion, and you get more of a shock. The chief of the tribe and the priestess are walking up to you! You manage to stand and give a Na’vi head bow. Without a word, the priestess walks up to you, poking you, sniffing you, then actually stabbing you and tasting your blood!

You looks at you curiously, “You are a strange one. You are more Na’vi than dream walker. Awkey has told me of you. You were healed by Eywa herself.” She continues to walk around you, “Eywa has a reason for saving you. And Awkey is part of it.” She sniffs, “What is your name girl?” And your tribe?”

You feel odd to give a male name. You had taken to calling your avatar ‘Lady’, and for some reason that pops out of your mouth, “My name is Lady. I am of the, uh, Skeptic clan.”

Her eyes open wide, but she recovers and nods, then looks at Awkey, “Eywa has chosen you. You will take Lai-di and teach her the ways of the People. See to it that she spends much time with the young females and learns such duties as she can.”

Awkey protested, “I am a warrior, a hunter! I could choose my mate from among the females of the People! How can you ask me to spend time teaching a female how to be a, a, female?”

The chief stepped in here, “You will obey! If Eywa has chosen you, there must be a reason. Until we understand that reason, you will help this creature learn our ways!” That was the end of that discussion!

Reluctantly, Awkey took you into Home Tree! There he put you in the care of females around your age, who began to teach you how to prepare meals for the tribe. It was hard work! After the meal, Awkey showed you to a sleeping pod. You soon drifted, then found yourself back in your own body.

As soon as the lid is mostly opened, Grace is drilling you! “What the hell happened out there? Where did you go? What happened to your avatar?”

She listened, as dumbfounded as the rest as you told about how you were almost killed, and then how you awoke near Home Tree, then was taken in. She shook her head, “Why weren’t you automatically returned here? The safe guards should have done that the moment you were unconscious!” She scratched her head, “And what sign were they talking about?”

You shook you head, “I don’t know. It must have happened while I was unconscious. One thing is for sure though. I seem to be getting that home-maker training we discussed.”

Grace just walked away shaking her head.
12121111.title: You go back to find yourself surrounded by chil...

choices: Yes, I will become one of the People
No, I am not a real Na'vi
121211111.content:
The next morning you met with Grace. She grinned at you. “Do you know what the Na’vi meaning of your name is by the way?”

You look confused. You had not thought about meanings. When you said no, she grinned, “Roughly, it means ‘child bearer’. In one way it could mean you are loved of children, which seems to be true from what you said.” But she couldn’t help smirking, “Of course, you can be glad the avatars are sterile, since the other meaning for it could also mean you are a female who will give birth to many children!” She got a great laugh out of that!

As soon as you were ready, you had to go back in for more training. Part of the day is humiliating to you as you help to cook, take care of children, and make jewelry. However, you also have language lessons with Awkey, and after a few days, he begins to teach you survival skills. On the language and culture, you are way ahead of Jake, who has also somehow been accepted as you have, driving Grace even more crazy.

On the survival skills, you were slower, but what was beginning to move you was that somehow, you were sensing, even seeing, connections between the living things around you. To your further surprise, Awkey did not seem to be as aware as you were on that level.

Things progressed well over the weeks that followed, but you kept some things to yourself. First off, you knew you could not betray these people. You were beginning to love them, especially the children. And not only were you feeling more and more like one of them, but you were feeling more and more like your female Na’vi body was your ‘right’ body, and your human male body was wrong. You really kept that to yourself!

This all presented a dilemma for you. Grace had read your papers about calling the Na’vi animals of course. What she did not know was that you were being paid to not only say that but prove it, true or not. You had sold out for a lot of money. You could never go through with that now! However, if you let it be known how you feel, you might be pulled out by the company. It was not the money you cared about. The truth was, you did not want to stop being Lai-di. The part that was hardest of all for you to admit was that you were falling in love with Awkey.

One day, the priestess came up to you. “Lai-di, you have shown yourself a great addition to the women of our tribe. You now must choose. Do you wish to become one of the People?”

You understood very well what this would mean. On the one hand it would give you many rights and freedoms that you did not currently have. On the other hand, as a single female of the tribe, and of the proper age, if you became one of the People, you could be chosen by any eligible male. That would not be bad if it was Awkey, but there was no guarantee, and in a conflict, the older male had first choice, and Awkey was your age. Could you risk becoming any males mate? Could you risk not becoming one of the People?
121211111.title: You return for more training

choices: Oh yes! If it can be done, please help me do it!
Not yet. There are things I must do in the other world
1212111111.content:
You saw no choice, if you said no, you would have to leave. You looked at her and said, "Yes. I wish to become one of the People." And that really expressed your deepest desire! To remain Lai-di!

Jake was not around when the ceremony happened, and you were glad, because after the celebration settled down, and you were with a smaller group, Awkey came up to you, and gently said, "I see you Lai-di."

You replied, "I see you Awkey."

You caught your breath as he went though the ritual. When he was done, he said, "I claim Lai-di for my mate. Does anyone challenge my claim on her?" You held your breath. This was a critical point, but no challenge came. Awkey smiled, "Come." You took the hand he held out.

He took you to a secluded spot under the sacred tree. There you made love to him, your legs wrapping around him as he held you up and lowered you onto his member. You gasped in pleasure at the feeling of being penetrated. Na'vi did not have orgasms the way humans did, but for you, it was like hours of constant pleasure. When it was over, and Awkey was asleep, you cried. You could not bring yourself to tell him what a terrible mate he had selected. How could you tell him you were sterile? It was not a condition that existed among the Na'vi! You felt terrible! On the one hand, as an eligible female, you had no right to refuse his choice, but on the other hand, you knew now that you loved Awkey, and it killed you to know you could never bear him the children he had the right to expect.

The next day, you persuaded Awkey and the leaders to keep your mating secret from Jake and Grace at this time. You had to figure out what to do next.

The days that passed were the most wonderful you have experienced in your entire life. The Na'vi were similar to humans in one way. Newlyweds seemed to have sex as often as possible! However, you found time to learn and grow as a woman of the People. The jobs that you had once considered demeaning, probably because in your mind you considered them "women's work", you now understood the need for. Yes, there everyone had a role to some extent, but there was no such thing as demeaning work, because there was no such thing as 'trivial' work. Every single thing contributed in some way to the physical, mental, or spiritual well-being of the tribe. And it was not uncommon for a male to come in and help the women when need arose, or for the women to take part in a hunt at some level.

That was another thing you began to realize, there were no bullies in the Na'vi. All were of equal worth. Even the Chief and the Priestess. Their positions gave them honor, but their voice was no louder in tribal councils, nor did the youngest female, you, have less voice than they.

You found yourself feeling happier every day, and even joyous. Even when there was no reason to. And if possible, you came to love the children of the tribe even more! At the evening meal one night, you commented on this to the Priestess.

She smiled at you, "Of course. That is normal for a female who has been blessed by Eywa. Especially one so young."

You stared at her. You knew what she meant. For a woman to be blessed by Eywa meant that she was pregnant! But that was not possible! Avatars were intentionally rendered sterile! You finally recovered, "Forgive me blessed mother, but are you sure?" You hesitated and tried to choose your words in this language that was still new to you. "Dream walkers are not supposed to be, capable, of such a blessing."

She smiled, "My child, whatever the off worlders intended for you as a dream walker, Eywa has chosen differently for you. I can see the new life within you. You would see it and feel it yourself, but your mind is still filled with the joys of your mating with Awkey. He will be pleased that you have been blessed so soon, and that you bear his son. Eywa must be pleased with you indeed!"

When you recover from shock, you say, "Thank you blessed mother. Awkey will indeed be pleased." You pause, "But the off-worlders would not be. We must keep this from the other dream walkers for now." You sigh, "If only I did not have to leave this body. What they think would have no meaning."

She smiled at you, "This can be done Lai-di. However, if it becomes so, your off-world body will die. There will be no going back to your old people. Would this still be your desire?"
1212111111.title: Yes, I will become one of the People

choices: Jake and Grace return with a warning and a plea
Grace runs into you by accident, and begs to be allowed to become Na'vi too!
12121111111.content:
When you recovered from the idea of what you had just heard, you replied, "Oh yes! Yes blessed mother! If such a thing could happen, if my dreams were only of this world and not a nightmare of another world for me, it would be the most wonderful thing! To know I could not be taken from my People would be worth any risk!"

She smiled, "We shall begin preparations tomorrow Lai-di."

You were a bundle of nerves the next day. It was joyous to tell Awkey of the news of your pregnancy. The two of you celebrated as newlyweds often do! You were afraid to tell him the next part, for fear of his reaction. When you did though, he held you close, "Truly I have chosen well! That you would leave your old world for the People, and for me. It will be a blessing to not need fear that tomorrow you may not wake again."

His thrill at your decision cemented your decision all the more!

The tribe was called to around the sacred tree. The Priestess instructed you to lay at the base of the tree. As she and the tribe chanted, you felt yourself being drawn out of yourself. You could see your body, and a tread of energy going from it, off into the distance. It looked solid, and in your mind, you reached out and pulled on it. It gave, and the amount you pulled in seemed to blend into your body. You pulled more, more of the same. You began to steadily pull on it as a rope.

-------------------------------------------------------

Back in the lab, alarms began to sound. The module holding your male body sounded alarms as your vital signs began to slip. Lab personnel began to follow emergency procedures!

-------------------------------------------------------

You pulled faster and faster, and all that you pulled in slipped into your Na'vi body. For a time, there was resistance. At one point, there was a pulling in the other direction! You mustered your strength, gathered your will, and pulled as hard as you could. You felt a snap, as a rope tearing, and you quickly hauled in all that was left.

-------------------------------------------------------

In the lab, the team fought to save your life. At least, that is the way they saw it. They could find no reason for your body dying, but it was. Then it was over. Your body was dead. The team was in shock. They had no idea why this happened.

-------------------------------------------------------

As the last of the rope of energy sank into your body, you felt yourself sinking back as well. You slept, then you awoke as Lai-di. As you sat up, the Priestess examined you. She stood up and looking at you, "You tie to your old world is gone." She helped you up and raised your hand, "Lai-di is no longer a dream walker! Eywa has made her truly one of the people!"

People laughed as you danced and danced through the tribe! You felt free! You were Lai-di! Mate of Awkey and blessed by Eywa! And there was nothing the off-worlders could do about it!

It was so wonderful to sleep a real sleep at last! The next day, it was decided to keep your new life secret from the dream walkers for now. It might not be well for their leaders to know that one of their own chose of her own free will to become Na'vi, for that is what you were now.
12121111111.title: Oh yes! If it can be done, please help me do it!

choices: The priestess asks for your help with Grace
You run into Jake and tell him the truth.
121211111111.content:
You enjoy your new life from the start. Not only do you prefer being Na'vi, but you are glad that you are female. Your love for children is intense, and the thought of the new life growing inside of your body gives you intense joy! On top of all of that, you love sex as a female, and your love of Awkey increases each day! And now that every waking minute of your day is spent with the Na'vi, your language and social skills grow very rapidly!

All was going wonderfully until the day that Jake and Grace came to the tribe with a warning. From a distance, and out of their sight, you listened to what they had to say. You watched as they were arrested and tied up. You found yourself terrified when, not long after, the chief and priestess come looking for you! You fall on your face before them, "No! Please! I am not one of them! Please do not harm me!"

The priestess smiles and speaks calmly, "Fear no Lai-di, for we know your heart. We have come to you for what you know of these dream walkers and the off-worlders. Does Jake-sulley speak the truth?"

You still tremble as you stand, "It is hard to explain in our terms. When I was an off worlder, my chief was not their chief." You paused, "But I did meet their chief. He was a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants, and he wants what is in the ground under our Home Tree." You plead, "I do not know more than this of their chief, but two things I do know. Jake and Grace love the Na'vi. They took great risk by coming to warn you. The other thing I know is that the off worlders are used to war, and have powerful weapons that you have not yet seen used. Take their warnings seriously." You hesitate, "I know we must fight, but please, let me take the children now, and go to the sacred tree." You hesitated, "And, if you believe me, please, free Jake and Grace."

You are grateful they allowed you to evacuate the children in light of the coming battle. They chastised you about pleading for Jake and Grace. As a Na'vi female, and not being a hunter or warrior, you have no choice but to let it drop. They are your leaders now.

You gather what other females as you can, and round up the children. When you are almost at the sacred tree, you hear the sounds of the many aircraft go bye. Not too long after that, you hear the terrible sounds of battle, and you know it will not go well for your People. You act strong for the children, but the other adult females can tell of your fear.

Your worst fears are confirmed and then some as, after a while, many of your tribe come straggling in. You cry with the rest at the loss of life, and worse, the death of the Home Tree! You are also the first to pull yourself together as you begin to organize a hospital to treat the many burned and wounded! It is during this time that it is revealed to you, and everyone, that for some reason you have a unique and strong power. You are able to direct the flow of living energy all around you, and turn it into a healing power that totally restores lesser wounds, and does great healing even on the worst of injuries. It does wear you down though, and you collapse with the effort.

When you awake, you find that you are now known as The Healer. The chief and priestess have given you a new title, and granted their authority to you in all matters of healing, though they bid you to pace yourself for the sake of the child you carry. You smile as you are grateful that your new found power gives you the ability to know that your unborn child is still healthy.

You were saddened to hear of the exile of Jake and Grace. Even your new leadership status is not enough to overcome the blame given them for the attack. However, when Jake shows up riding a Last Shadow, he becomes leader of not only the tribe, but all of the People. As he begins preparations for war, you begin preparations for dealing with the wounded.

1212121.content:
A direhorse floats within the tank. It is about the size of an small elephant, requiring that the massive amniotic tank dominate the room, and bears a superficial resemblance to an Earth-horse with mottled blue skin, a slender snout, and an extra-pair of legs. What it doesn't look like is an Avatar.

"What the fuck is this."

"Your new body," Augustine says with a triumphant grin.

"It's... a horse."

"No, it's a direhorse. Count the legs."

You resist slamming your hand against the tank in fury - the last thing you need is two tons of alien horse and amniotic fluid on top of you - and instead meet her hate-filled stare with your own. "How am I supposed to make my assessment of the Na'vi as a horse!"

"Direhorse. And that's really not my problem." She gestures at an open Avatar-bed. "Now are you getting in or should I go tell the RDA I had their five billion dollar investment destroyed because you refused to use it."

Reluctantly you slide on to the bed, stil glaring daggers. "I'm reporting this after, you know." The lid slams back down.

"I'm going to enjoy riding him," Grace mutters to Dr Patel as she slides into her own bed.

121212221.content:
"This is your replacement."

Nothing but sterile amniotic fluid sits within the tank. "But it's empty."

Grace snaps her fingers as though recalling another minor detail. "Ah yes, the replacement foetus also self-destructed a few months into gestation. As did the third. I guess there's something wrong with your genes."

Impossible. Your entire genome had been screened hundreds of times and selected from thousands of potential candidates for application in the Avatar project. There was no way... "Did you sabotage my bodies!" you demand.

"Of course I didn't." She looks hurt. "I'm not the RDA; as a biologist all life is sacred to me - even avatars." Bullshit, you mutter under your breath. "Besides, you do have a replacement. As a matter of fact, you're standing in it."

"I don't have time for this. Get to the point," you groan.

"We were able to rig the Avatar link-ups to project a mind into things other than an organic body. Inanimate things. Anything with circuitry anyway. Like this room for example. Or an AMP suit." Or the vibrator for your dusty vagina. You bite your tongue. "Shall we get linked up," she says, gesturing at an open link-up bed.

You climb on and swing your legs up, and allow the lid to be lowered down over you. Lights begin to flicker around your head. You consider the fact that letting Grace Augustine decide the body you're about to be projected in to may not have been a good idea.

"Phase lock at 99% Establishing connection."

There is a blur of sight and sound. Then...

You look about yourself in disorientation. As you discover what is definitely a toilet cubicle, you can't help but feel your distrust of Doctor Augustine was entirely founded. This body is rigid and unnaturally shaped - almost like your body has been embedded up to the neck in the floor and your head warped out of shape so that the mouth takes up most of your head and faces the ceiling. You rather wish you could close your mouth; it has a rather bad taste in it...

Oh shit, you think as you realise what you are.

122.title: The Incredibles

choices: She begins searching for a way to escape
1221.content:
Mr. Incredible was trapped inside Syndrome’s lair. The energy device holding him was too strong even for his incredible strength. Syndrome was gloating, “You see? Technology can do more incredible things than you could hope to. But supers do have their uses. That is why I came up with this.” He patted a device that was in front of Mr. Incredible, and between him and some kind of table. “And now is the time to show you how it works.” He turned, “It is time my dear Mirage.”

His incredibly sexy assistant, Mirage, got an evil, very satisfied look on her face as she hopped up onto the table. As she lay there, restraints came out and fastened around her wrists and ankles. The table then slanted up so that she was facing Mr. Incredible with the device behind them.

Syndrome crowed, “Now watch as we write a new chapter in your history.” He activated the device. A beam struck Mr. Incredible on the forehead. At the same time, another beam struck Mirage on the forehead. Mr. Incredible felt like he was literally being sucked out of his body, then things wen black.

He started to come to with someone slapping his face gently. “Hello? Mr. Not-so-incredible?” His eyes fluttered open to see Syndrome’s face inches from his. He felt very strange. And the more aware he felt, the stranger it got. His perspective seemed off too. Syndrome gloated, “Let me introduce you to someone.” He stepped aside. As he did, Mr. Incredible gasped. What he saw was himself! Well, his body, free from the energy restraints and smiling. He realized that the gasp he had let out sounded odd, even feminine. He looked down to see two small breasts. He was wearing a dress, and platinum blonde hair was on the corner of his vision! He was in the body of Mirage!

Syndrome laughed, “Yes, you realize your position now. But not fully yet. You see, that little device you experienced is a body swapping device. And it worked perfectly.” He turned to Mirage, in Mr. Incredible’s body. “Ready?”

Mirage laughed, “Ready! I have been waiting for this!” With that he picked up the body switching device and began to smash it until it was a small lump of crushed metal and circuitry.

Mr. Incredible let out a very feminine scream of, “NO!!!”, as ‘she’ struggled in vain to free herself.

Syndrome looked at Mirage, “You know the next step. Enjoy!” He grinned and left.

Syndrome walked up to Mr. Incredible, who he now towered over. “You might be wondering where he is going?” He leaned front and kissed Mr. Incredible on the lips, holding is head in place as he did so. “You see, he is going to take your place in every way. He will have a new job working for one of my companies. When I have need of his strength, it will work for me.” He massaged the breasts that now pushed out from Mr. Incredible’s chest, “And in the mean time, he is going to get to know your wife very, very well.”

Mr. Incredible struggled, “She will know it is not me!”

Syndrome laughed, “Why should she? And Mirage has been studying you for months in fine detail. His goal is not only to pass as you, but to see if he can double the size of your family before you are swapped back.” He let that sink in as she stubbled again, “Oh yes, there is a way back. To your body and to your family.”

She stopped struggling, “How is that?”

He grinned, “It is just a device I made. I can make another. But in order to do so, you are going to have to learn how to be a humble, submissive woman. From this moment on, your name is Miss Isabel Marie Shapely. You will learn to answer only to that name. You will learn how to be feminine and you will server me in whatever capacity I require. The sooner you are my perfect, feminine assistant, as Mirage was, the sooner I will consider building a new swapping device.” He slid a hand under her skirt and along the panty-covered slit in her crotch, “And the sooner you can stop Mirage from doing this to your wife.”

He pushed a button that let her loose. She immediately jumped at him, intending to smash him. Instead, he blocked her, grabbed her arm, twisted her around, and then held her tight as he gave her a passionate kiss!. She kicked and punched, but it was like a child to him!

He laughed, “Do you see how helpless you are now Miss Shapely? If you ever want to stand up to pee again, follow me.” He followed him in defeat as he lead the way. They entered some feminine looking quarters. “Here you will find a wide range of clothing. You will find books and recordings on how to become what you need to be, a feminine woman. I suggest you get started.” He left her inside.

Escape is on her mind, but she can’t very well fight and run in a pencil skirt and high heels. Anakin manned the console, and was on the verge of broadcasting his message to the Jedi council when an incoming signal interrupted him. With annoyance, he discovered it was his master, Obi-wan, no doubt checking up on him again. He jabbed the button and Obi-Wan's holographic face filled the cockpit.

"Ah, there you are, Anakin," the giant, flickering head said impatiently. "I've been trying to contact you for days. Where were you?"

"As a matter of fact I was just about to send my report when you interrupted, master," Anakin replied tetchily. "I followed the tracking beacon and investigated Geonosis, exactly as you requested."

"And?"

"Somebody is preparing a droid army."

"That does sound troublesome," Obi Wan said, understated as always. "The Trade Federation?"

"I believe so, master, though there was something else there too. A dark presence on the planet, I sensed, perhaps a Sith lord."

The floating head scratched its beard thoughtfully. "Hm, unlikely... Best to keep your mind on the matter at hand, Anakin. Don't allow yourself to be distracted by things beyond the mission. Send me the report, I will relay the details to master Yoda. Meanwhile, I want you to return to me on Kamino. The Senate may have need of this "Clone Army" we've discovered, assuming what you say is true. It may need to be deployed immediately, if we wish to nip this in the bud. In addition, I have made some troubling discoveries while you were away."

'While you were away'. The way he said it set Anakin's teeth on edge, as though the young padawan had been relaxing in the sun while Obi Wan did all the work.

"Yes, it seems foot soldiers aren't all they've been growing here," Obi Wan continued. "There is a seperate facility, hidden away beneath the first, under the sea. The Kaminoans were determined that I didn't discover it. They've also been cloning..."

1231221111221.content:
A shiver ran down Anakin's spine. Cloning was against the natural order of things, an affront to the force, but cloning Jedi was beyond even that. It was an abomination. "Jedi? Are you sure?!"

"I should think so," Obi-Wan replied dryly. "I'm staring at a whole batch of Miss Secura. Come quickly, Anakin, I'm... I'm not sure how long I can hold out."

"Are you under attack, master?" Anakin asked in alarm.

"Not, perhaps, in the literal sense," Obi-Wan replied with a wry smile. "I think you might understand better when you get here."
-|-|-|-|-

With a tap of a button, the communication droid shut off the channel, the holographic image of Anakin flickering and vanishing. The droid idled away along the gleaming ceramic walkway that ran though the vast cloning facility beneath the waves.

There were day's when Obi-Wan's vows of celibacy were tried harder than others. This was one of these days. He stood, staring upwards at the clone production line, a long rail of liquid-filled, glass capsules, each filled with the sleeping form of the Jedi Twi'lek, Aayla Secura, each as naked as the day she would soon be born.

The encapsulated clones slid past his eyes, a factory of nude, blue flesh. He had known Miss Secura well at the academy. There had been times when it had taken all his Jedi mind training not to stare at those luscious tits bulging out her leather clothing, and there had been other days when he had allowed himself the briefest of glances, a gift to himself after a hard mission.

Now to have her thrust upon him so, a thousand-fold, naked and helpless. It was more than he could stand.

The slowly moving capsules shuddered briefly to a halt as a minor error was detected in the batch further along the production line, setting the water sloshing inside the tanks. The clones shifted in their sleep. The one closest to him was curled into the feotal position, her limbs drifting slowly in the pearly liquid, one thumb in her mouth. Her expression was placid, sleeping, and he could sense no mind inside her body. That would be added later. One of her fleshy head-tentacles was clenched tight between her thighs and her skin squeaked against the close confines of the capsule, her body pressing against the glass, displaying itself as if seeking his approval.

As the production line resumed, a hundred of more clones passed his eyes. It was easier to see the defects in the cloning procedure with the Twi'lek than it had been with the human, Jango Fett. Some of the Aayla's were darker or lighter shades of blue, a few even had skin of green and red.

"Is everything to your liking?" the Kaminoan at his side, a high-ranking male named Kala Ra, spoke up. Its air was polite and accommodating, though he could sense it was annoyed at him for discovering this place. "Would you like to see more? The decanting process perhaps? The imprinting champers? Or perhaps you would like a little time alone with one of the clones for your... appraisal."

"No I certainly would not," Obi-Wan replied primly, disliking the cloning technician's tone. "This factory is an abomination. It must be shut down. In the name of the Jedi council, I demand you halt production immediately."

The Kaminoan's had been placid and emotionless up until now, but this one looks shocked. "Halt production? I'm afraid that is entirely out of the question. Many of these clones are only half-gestated, to halt now would kill them! Not to mention, you have no authority here. This project was authorized by the Galactic Senate itself!"

"I hardly think that likely," Obi-Wan scoffed. He glanced around, his eyes settling on a large, spherical room in the distance, into which many of the rails of clones were being fed. "Ah hah! This must be the central processing core. Very well, if you won't shut this down, I shall," he stated, marching purposefully towards the central room.

The Kaminoan was at his heels, its words unheeded. "No, you can't! Don't go in there, that's-"

12413.content:
"Whosoever wields this armour, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Ironman." Thor removed his hand from the breastplate of the Mk 43 armour and stood back. Stark watched expectantly.

"That's it? No bouquet of flowers? No white doves?"

"Those are the words, yes. Though I must admit, it has been many years since I have practiced the craft of what you would call magic."

"I wouldn't even call that magic," Tony said disappointedly. "You know what I'd call that? Poetry, at best."

"Patience, my friend."

Weakly glowing Norse runes flickered briefly into existence on the armour before fading back into the metal. Thor beamed proudly.

"Better. And this guarantees that nobody other than me can use it, right?" Tony Stark asked.

"Of course!" Stark's shoulders relaxed a little. "Just you and anybody else who is worthy."

"But-"

"Or anybody whose arcane knowledge exceeds my own. They could break through the enchantment quite easily."

Tony looked at the musclebound figure and winced. He knew electrical engineers with more wizardiness than this norse warrior.

"I have done as you asked, yet you still seem troubled, my friend," Thor declared with a frown.

"Me? Troubled?" Stark scoffed.

Thor nodded. "Perhaps it is your involvement in the creation of Ultron, culminating in the destruction of a large slavic settlement, that weighs upon you."

"You just had to bring that up..." Stark grumbled. "Okay, fine, yeah, it is starting to piss me off a little. Not just Ultron. The Iron Legion, War Machine, Obadiah Stane-bot... Last year I helped build helicarriers for Hydra. Everything I build always ends up being used to hurt people."

"Your inventions do have a way of getting away from you," Thor nodded. "Quite literally in fact!" he boomed, chuckling to himself. Jane Foster had been teaching him the nuances of modern earth humour.

Stark sighed. "Some days it's like we're still in the weapon business. I thought a little Asgardian security mumbo jumbo might help me sleep at night."

"Ah! Robots may not be my strong suit but that I can certainly aid you with! A stout ale or two always helps me sleep." He slapped Stark hard on the back, booming, "Come! This night you will drink in the halls of my father!"

Stark's eyebrows raised. "You're inviting me to Asgard? The realm of the gods? Wow..."

12431.content:
Loki was watching by Astral projection, as his little box arrived at Tony Stark's home. The sensor sweep remained silent when no explosives were detected, although the Norse God let loose a short burst of laughter.

Tricks were always his favourite form of vengeance, and he did rather have a score to settle with this particular Avenger. The parcel lay unattended, ignored and inert for the entire morning. Tony was in his lab following up on an new wrinkle for the suit.

The Mark Fifty would be a revolution, lighter, stronger, and faster to wear. But hunger finally drove him from the lab, that and the fact that he'd hit a snag. A break was in order.

As he headed towards the kitchen his eyes were drawn to the parcel. Wrapped in metallic red gift paper, and with a golden ribbon an inch wide around it, topped with a pink bow.

Ignoring it, he headed to the kitchen and made a simple snack, as he finished of a beer. Snagging a second bottle he headed back to the lab. However, he couldn't walk past the parcel. It intrigued him, so carefully wrapped, and the pink bow suggested that it was from a female admirer.

Carefully he opened it.

A spray of pink and silver confetti exploded in his face. He was laughing as he stumbled backwards. As the confetti fluttered down, cute tiny helium balloons letters floated out of the box. They wafted and drifted in the air, their movement was a little unnatural, and as that revelation struck. They formed a word - s u r p r i s e -.

"Shit", Tony thought, "I hate magic."

It was his last thought, as the balloons burst in a pink and white blinding light, knocking Tony backwards over the sofa. His head bounced with a heavy wet smack off a table knocking him unconscious.

Getting to his feet, he spotted his reflection in the panoramic windows. It looked a little off, too. The dark red almost looked metallic pink... squinting, didn't make it disappear. The gold was rather pale too, in fact to his eyes, it looked more silver than anything.

A short hop of a flight, and he stood two feet away from the window.

1243332.content:
In the penthouse suite of Stark tower, the walls still hanging with the strands of silk he'd used to web up here, Peter excitedly pulled on the newest gift from Iron Man. It was like his old suit but even better, made of a strange advanced material that was stretchy and light, but also tough as steel and filled with all sorts of gizmos to augment his already awesome suite of spider powers. He couldn't wait to try them on.

He rolled the rubbery suit up his bare chest and wiggled his arms into the arms of the suit. "Let me just say again Mister Stark I really appreciate this."

"You earned it, kid, after your help at the airport. Couldn't have done... whatever we did without you."

"We kinda lost, sir."

"And we couldn't have done it without you," Stark said with a half-smile. He shrugged. "Best fight I ever lost. Only fight I ever lost. Except the one after it. You want one of these?" He poured himself a large whiskey.

"I'm a teenager, sir."

"So... no? Alright, fine. I'll have yours." Drinks in hand, he came and sat on the couch as Peter wormed the mask up over his head. "How's the fit?"

"Honestly? It's a little loose."

"That's a feature; you're a growing boy. What am I gonna do, make you a new suit every two weeks?" Stark smirked. "Kidding. That's one of the things I added. Watch this."

Stark rolled up his sleeve to unveil the wrist-mounted remote. He tapped the interface once. Immediately the zipper at the back of the suit sealed and vanished. With a hiss, the suit pressurized, forcing out the air, clinging to Parker's skin far tighter than even the last Stark suit had. Parker felt his face redden as he glanced down to see the bulge of his manhood displayed in perfect detail on the hermetically sealed suit. Stark coughed on his whiskey.

"Definitely didn't build that feature into the suit, Stark chuckled. "Hold on a sec, I got some presets. You're gonna love this."

With a touch of another button, the suit inflated slightly, the ribbed fabric reshaping about his body. Parker gaped at himself. The suit had given him the illusion of massive muscles underneath, and his manhood was a rather more family-friendly bulge. "I call that the superhero physique setting. Good, huh. We think it's really going to poll well with the public."

"As cool as this is, I'm just here to help people."

Stark shook his head. He was a little drunk. "Nope. You've got an image problem, kid. All this stuff they've been printing about you in the... the... damn, what are they called."

"Newspapers?"

"Right. Those old things. All that stuff about you being a danger, this is really going to help with people's perceptions."

Peter marvelled at his new physique. "I can't argue with that, Mister Stark."

Dom Cobb lay back in his seat as the Pasiv dream machine began to hiss and pump rhythmically. 1251111.content:
They were sitting at a small metal table in a familiar sun-soaked Parisian cafe. The sound of chatter, rattling teacups, and the bustle of a city surrounded him. Ariadne sat across, idly talking as though they had been sitting there for hours, rather than the few seconds it had really been.

"- and so then I decided to change my course to Architecture. Obviously that was a few more years at University but like I said I just love Paris so much." She noticed him watching her and blushed. "Sorry. I've been talking for ages."

"Are you sure about that?" Cobb smiled enigmatically. She frowned in momentary confusion, her eyes staring into the distance as realisation set in.

"We're dreaming again, aren't we? This is my training."

"Lesson two," Cobb nodded. "Today I'm going to be teaching you about-"

"Lesson two," Cobb nodded. "Today I'm going to be teaching you about shapeshifting." He smiled at her incredulous look. "In a dream you can be anyone or anything you want. It's an incredibly versatile skill and one of the most effective ways of losing attention to yourself in the event that the projections start to converge on you - assuming the person or object you change into fits with the nature of the dream of course."

Even with her brain working at x20 speed Ariadne hurried to keep up. "So you're going to teach me how to... shapeshift?"

"Maybe. It's a very subtle art and not many can do it. You need to hold the image of who or what you want you want to be in your mind and believe in it entirely. But it's risky. You can lose yourself in the role just as easilly as you can lose yourself in a dream."

"You mean I'd actually think I was the person?"

He nodded. "Fall too much in to a role and you might forget who you were, and then you're trapped in that body until the dream ends." Ariadne shivered.

1252.content:
Behind the hidden doorway, deep beneath the arcades where the 80s pop barely reached, was a secret room, layered with dust. A computer display and the racks of servers that filled one half of the room somehow still ran, patiently clocking the minutes, hours, and years since they had been activated.

20:11:20:16:22:15

A curious piece of equipment resembling a large laser stood to the left of the door, but it went unnoticed by Sam Flynn as he approached the computer. He wiped the dust from the touchscreen, activating it. A command prompt waited for his input. For a few moments he tried basic commands and discovered a few things: that his father, Kevin Flynn, had never logged out as user 20 years ago at the time of his mysterious disappearance, and that the last command he had inputting related to something called LaserControl.

Repeating the command brought up a strange prompt: Aperture Command Clear? Yes/No. With a shrugh, he pressed enter.

The laser behind him came to life with a rising whirr. Sam barely had time to turn before the laser hit him in the back, ripping his body into individual chunks of data, and downloading him.

To Sam it felt little more than an uncomfortable, disorientating lurch. But suddenly he wasn't in Flynn's arcade anymore. He was -

12521.content:
Sam felt disoriented for a moment, like reality had just rippled, and as he looked around he noticed that a lot of smaller details were different.

Everything just looked a little shinier, and less dusty... hell everything was dust-free.

But the over-riding change was the weird neon glow at the edges of various items.

As Sam waved his hand back and forth in front of his face. It stayed sharp and in focus, so he ruled out his first suspicion that he'd been drugged, or was unconscious. This needed to be investigated, and there was nothing else to see in the room. Sam went back upstairs to the public area.

The arcade looked largely the same, just cleaner. He continued outside. But the streets were empty of traffic and the weather was different for a few minutes ago.

Looking all around he walked into the centre of the empty street. The road under his feet had a smooth texture, and a hexagonal pattern that he just didn't remember seeing.

It was at this point that a light shot out the sky pinning him in a column of light.

"Stand still program." it announced coldly.

Not sure what was going on, he stood there. He half expected the helicopter to land or a police car to round the corner. Shading his eyes he looked up into the spotlight.

It wasn't any type of helicopter he recognised, and the sheer size ruled out it being a drone.

But it landed and discharged four men who quickly surrounded Sam.

125211.content:
Sam tried to resist but after a couple of shocks from their energy staffs, he boarded the ship. Once in position, a shimmering light formed around his feet. As the ship climbed back into the sky, Sam was sure he wasn't in Kansas anymore.

This had to be the grid. He'd never been sure whether his father was just making up stories, or genuinely believed the incredible stuff he used to tell Sam as a child.

Tentatively he tried shifting his weight from one foot to another... They remained firmly planted to the floor.

He wasn't sure where he was, but he was sure he was awake. What was worrying him was his fellow passengers/prisoners. Their emotions covered a broad range: terror; despair; panic. None were happy to be there.

When the ship, one of his neighbours had called it a 'recogniser'. Unloaded them, the pilot walked along the line tapping each on the shoulder one at a time when he passed.

"Deletion."

"Games."

"Reprogramming."

His neighbour was chanting a mantra under his breath, "not games, not games, not games." Perhaps the pilot heard his words, or not. But with a firm hand he grasped his shoulder.

"Games."

Screaming the man fled. He dived off the end of the platform choosing death over games. Sam was wondering how this could possibly be the dream his father had. A Utopia of freedom and equality. The stench of fear was in the air. The pilot even seemed unbothered by the man's suicide.

He reached Sam.
125211.title: The take him on board the ship.

125212.content:
Two of the men seized his jacket, pulling him towards the transport... thing. "This one has no disc. Another stray." The voice was harsh and electronic.

"Wait. Wait, I'm not a program." Flynn struggled, managing to squirm free of his jacket and out of their clutches. As he turned to flee, the street fell away beneath his feet in hexagonal chunks. He leaped, landing on the solid ground on the other side.

His faceless, would-be captors watched him balefully across the chasm. "Fugitive program. Surrender and be rectified."

"Why do I get the feeling I don't want to do that," Flynn muttered as they turned and marched back into the transport. It rose slowly into the air, the blinding spotlight flicking away from him, and he was finally able to see the city. Vast, monolithic glass skyscrapers glowing with red circuitry reached towards a dark, alien sky. This was certainly not Earth. He'd was there, The Grid, the world within the computer from his father's fantastical tales. It was real!

His awe was short lived however, as the floating transport powered forward, bearing down on him. He turned and ran, ducking down an alley. The transport roared past.

As he moved deeper within the city, keeping to the alleyways, he heard more of the machines searching for him. Whenever he hid, their searchlights always seemed to find him out, forcing him to keep moving. He heard the regimented march of feet as soldiers - surely they could be nothing else - began to search the street.

"Fugitive program. Surrender and be rectified," the voice boomed across the city.

This Orwellian vision wasn't quite the world he had pictured in his dad's tales. Peeking out into one of the avenues, he saw group of soldiers blockading the street with their vehicles. The red hued programs were searching people, grabbing people and examining the discs that slotted into the sockets in their backs. Once they confirmed the presence of the disc, they let them go.

"Gotta get one of those disks..." As he spoke, a woman walked past. She didn't see him, though he was close enough to touch her. Her eyes were on the blockade. She lingered on the sidewalk, unwilling to go closer. The disc on her back was within his reach...

"The subatomic molecular reorganiser!" Professor Keenbean declared proudly, gesturing at the huge complex of machinery spewing steam to his left. To Richie, watching through the viewfinder of his video camera, it was a metal cage on a conveyor belt feeding into a large metal box, out of which came a second conveyor belt.

The Professor continued his demonstration, ranting excitedly as though selling this thing to their shareholders.

"Useless garbage is broken down into its basic molecular components and then recombined to form a whole range of useful new items - from bedpans to bowling balls! Need a new bedpan? I know I do!"

He typed 'BEDPAN' into the molecular reorganiser computer and pressed enter, activating the conveyor belt with a whir. The cage, filled with 15 pounds of yesterday's garbage, was fed into the machine and Keenbean took up position at the output collector. The machine growled and hissed as the garbage was taken apart and reassembled.

"It's quick, it's easy, and IN NO TIME AT ALL, we've taken 15 pounds of yesterday's garbage and transformed it into a brand new bedp- Bowling balls!"

Half a dozen bowling balls rolled down the output chute. The Professor hit the emergency stop button and hefted a bowling ball sadly. It was a perfect bowling ball - nobody would have been able to tell 5 seconds ago it had been a pile of stinking garbage. But it wasn't a bedpan.

Richie lowered the camera. "It's still not working, is it Professor?"

"Still a few kinks need ironing out," Keenbean sighed. "Still, not to worry! Ready for your chemistry tutorial?"

It was the dawn of the first day, the start of a fresh new cycle. The moon grinned down at them from high in the sky as Link walked through Termina field towards Romani Ranch, his fairy buzzing about his head. She pestered him constantly with questions.

"Where are we going, Link? Aren't we done with the ranch? We already rescued your horse, didn't we? Link, are you even listening to me?! We have to go rescue my brother!"

Link ignored her. He didn't have to do anything, and if he did he certainly didn't have to do it now. There was no rush. The world would always be there, waiting to be saved. Even if it was destroyed. He had already failed once, even been killed several times, but every time the world of Termina reset and he found himself stepping out from the wooden doors of the clock tower.

He had decided to take this cycle off. To enjoy himself. He had earned it. He'd spent more cycles than he could remember running hither and thither, risking life and limb for the citizens of Termina, and for what? No matter how many he helped or how many times he helped them, they never remembered and indeed it was almost as though he had never helped them at all once time reset itself. All he had to show for his efforts were the contents of the bomber's journal. It was rather demoralising.

He would spend the cycle enjoying himself. The beauty of the situation, he had realised, was that he could do anything, anything at all, no matter how wild or destructive or depraved, and it would be consequence free. All he need do is play his ocarina and it would never have happened.

Just one cycle. The skullkid would wait.

After some thinking, he had chosen to spend his time on Romani Ranch, concealed beneath the Romani Mask, given the five star treatment beneath the soft, caring hands of the beautiful Cremia and her sister. As he neared the edge of the Ranch, his excitement grew. Eagerly he pulled the cow head mask over his own.

Link had gone to visit Zelda. It was the afternoon, and Zelda was scheduled to have some free time. Link entered the castle, and went to Zelda's room.

"Hi, Link!" Zelda said as Link entered the room. She was holding what looked to be an ancient book in her hands.

"Hey!" Link replied. "What's that book you're holding?"

"It's a spell book. Apparently, this has hundreds of old magic spells in it, and I just found the spell that Cole used to separate my spirit from my body. I'm gonna try it out."

"Are you sure? That sounds kinda dangerous, especially what happened after Cole had used that spell."

"It's okay. I'm just gonna test it out for a minute."

Before Link could say another word, Zelda recited the spell from the book. After she said it, however, a dark purple orb flew out of the book and started bouncing around the room. Before they could react, however, the orb hit Link and pushed what appeared to be his spirit out of his body, and then it flew back from impact straight into Zelda, knocking her unconscious.



A few minutes later, Link woke up. "Urgh..." Link placed his palm on his now aching head as he started to get off of the ground. However, he realized that groan he just let out didn't sound like him, but like Zelda. As soon as he noticed this, he saw long, blonde hair in front of his face. Link jumped back in shock, but lost his balance due to what appeared to be heels he was wearing on his feet as he then fell onto the ground, where managed to fall on his behind and sat down. Link looked down at himself, and noticed he was wearing Zelda's dress, and had what appeared to be breasts on his chest. Looking forward, he saw his own body lying on the ground!

"Oh, please, PLEASE no!" Link worried as he got up and walked towards a mirror hanging on the wall. As he stared at it, he saw Zelda staring back at him, copying all of his movements.

"I...I possessed Zelda...?" Link was (rightfully) confused, wondering what exactly happened when Zelda used that spell that sent him into her body. Whatever happened, this was the result. Diplomatic relations had been cut short. Literally. The King of Hyrule's head departed from the King of Hyrule's neck, flew through the air trailing blood, bounced across the floor of the Hyrule throne room, and came to rest at the feet of the leader of the Gerudo, Ganondorf, who sheathed his bloody sword and set about dispatching the castle guards with bolts of dark energy.

On the other side of the Hyrule Castle, Zelda paled as alarm bells began to sound and soldiers scrambled into action. It was the day she had been dreading for a long time. The one from her nightmares. It was all coming true.

"Princess." Impa strong hand took her shoulder, half-reassuring her, half-hurrying her to the door. "We have to go. There's a horse waiting for us."

The screams of dying men and the smell of burning bodies rang through the corridors as they raced for the stables. It sounded more like an army besieging the castle than a single man. Almost there, Impa pressed a piece of inscribed parchment into Zelda's hand.

"It's a spell of the Sheikah that will mask your appearance. Use it to disguise yourself."

13121121.content:
There was a dazzling flash of light and the sound of rending cloth. Where there had once stood a young princess, now there stood a horse, a magnificent white mare. The torn scraps of a dress hung around its muscular torso. A golden tiara sat rakishly over one ear, nestled in the golden-brown mane that flowed down the beast's snow white body.

The horse nickered and stamped its hoof in agitation at its predicament, and Impa instinctively moved to sooth it, stroking her hands down its side in a way she would never have dared done to the Zelda before. The Princess huffed indignantly, reminding Impa of her true status. The battle-hardened warrior and handmaiden blushed.

Behind them, a castle guard flew through the air on a torrent of purple-black magic, slamming into a wall and bursting. Ganondorf was almost upon them. His armoured footfalls rang in their ears.

A disguise is a disguise, Impa though,

131212.content:
That fateful day, Zelda rose early and waited at the palace gates. The guards watched her pace fitfully, wondering what could be worrying such a girl.

This was the day she had seen in her dreams, the day Ganondorf would murder her family and everyone in the castle, and yet Link was nowhere to be found.

Resolutely she decided she would need to act to stop Ganondorf if the great Hero could not be depended upon. She had magic of her own taught to her by Impa, not to mention access to all the arcane artifacts both in the castle vaults and for sale in the market town below, potions and enchanted weapons and wonderous masks. All she need do was kill, incapacitate or otherwise distract Ganondorf for a single day and the terrible threads of fate would be severed.
