1353311112111212.content:
Fire. Death. Blood.

Those were the first thoughts on Shepard's mind as he awoke. He remembered the Normandy crashing, an unknown foe having attacked. But...he wasn't dead. He looked around, as realized he was in a lab. There were scientists are around him, looking at him. A woman in a tight white jumpsuit came up to him, frowning. She was curves in all the right places, and if he was in a different situation, Shepard might have been interested in learning more about her. "Hello, Commander Shepard. Can you hear me?" Her voice had a light Australian accent to it.

If he didn't feel so tired, the commander would have rolled his eyes to the comment. "Yes, I can. My hearing works fine." Something seemed off about his voice, but he couldn't quite tell what it was. His whole body was numb. He gave a look around the room, and noticed that everyone was shocked, staring at him. Shepard scowled and asked the gorgeous woman closed to him, "Why are you all looking at me like that?"

That time, Shepard was sure his voice sounded different. Higher pitched, maybe. The woman was the only one looking him in the eyes, and she answered with, "Commander, what is the last thing you remember?"

It hurt to think about, but Shepard replied anyway. "The Normandy was attacked by an unknown ship, and...I thought I had died trying to get everyone out."

"You almost did," she said. "Your body was damaged beyond repair, and we were frankly amazed to find that you still had a faint pulse. We tried to keep you in stabilized condition, to heal you. But even the most advanced medical minds in the galaxy were at their wit's end. Then your body started to succumb to it's wounds, and we were left with only one choice: Operation Jericho."

That set off alarm bells for Shepard. "What is that? What did you do?"

Instead of answering, all the woman said was, "You should be able to walk, so you should stand up and look into that mirror on the wall. It's better if you saw for yourself, rather than having us explain it."

Shepard was scared, but he still complied with her request. Standing was difficult, but he managed it anyway. Trying his best to fight through the numbness engulfing his body, Shepard walked over to the mirror, one slow step at a time, and froze when he saw his reflection. Instead of the tall, muscular man he'd always seen before, the mirror showed him a tall asari. Her skin was a teal that was more green than blue, and the hospital gown she wore did little cover her athletic build and large breasts.

That...was him. He turned to stare at the woman he'd been talking to, anger coursing through his body. "What did you do to me?!" It was only now that he noticed somewhere in the back of his mind that this was why his voice had sounded different: it was the breathy contralto of an asari maiden.

The woman in the jumpsuit seemed unphased by his rage. "Operation Jericho was a worst case scenario. As your own body was damaged beyond repair, we managed to copy your mind and transfer it into a new one. The lifespan, natural biotics, and galactic reputation of the asari made it the best choice for a new body. I do not know much about the brain-dead asari we used, but we made sure to get one whose height was as close as possible to your own, so minimize difficulties when transitioning."

More than anything else in the world, Shepard wanted to lash out. To use his biotics to destroy this place, attack these people. They had violated every sanctity he had, and yet she stood there like it was nothing. Instead, Shepard did his best to put aside his anger and be more rational about this. "Could I please get your name?"

The question seemed to surprise her. "Miranda Lawson."

"What is the name of this organization?"

"Cerberus, but you must know..." Shepard raised an open palm, and Miranda stopped talking. He didn't have the patience to debate ethics on this right now, he would save that for later.

He only had one more question for her. "Are you in charge here?"

Miranda shook her head. "No. We have a unique communication device in the next room, out that door, and it is linked with Cerberus's leader. You can talk with hi-" before she had finished talking, Shepard stood up and walked out the room, not even glancing back at the scientists still standing there. The next room was small, and circular. As Shepard stepped into the circle, a hologram of a man smoking a cigarette appeared, and he turned to look Shepard in the eyes. Cerberus's leader had robotic blue eyes, and the look of a man nearing the end of his prime.

The hint of a smile played across the man's lips, and he said, "I assume you have some questions for me."

Only one, Shepard thought. "Why?"

The question seemed to confuse the man. "Commander, you were humanity's best and brightest. Sure, you didn't always play nice with us, but we have a bad reputation. The Reapers are coming, and we both know that. The ship that destroyed the Normandy was a Collector vessel, and we have reason to think they work for the Reapers. Your old squad survived, but they've moved on without you. This base is on Illium, and whatever you do from here is up to you. I have official Alliance documents saying that you are in fact Commander Shepard, and that the change in body was due to a mysterious biotic event, possibly related to the Collector ship. You already have you Spectre status back. I'm called the Illusive Man, and you will not hear from me again. Good day, Commander."

The hologram disappeared, and Shepard heard the sound of a door opening behind him. It was Miranda, obviously wondering what to do now. He turned to her and told her, "Get me some clothes, I have to go see..."
1353311112111212.title: Asari what you did there

choices: Shepard goes with Liara for some help in releasing tension
13533111121112121.content:
As the car sped towards the area where Liara's business was, Shepard had time to think. His body had lost that numbing quality, and now he was really struck by how different his body was. He'd always had short hair, so the new cartilage fringes weren't that much of a change, but everything else...His chest felt a lot heavier, and it was even clearer now just how voluptuous his new body was. He felt about as strong as before, yet sitting in the car allowed him to feel how soft his butt was now. And his genitals...from what he was aware an Asari's sex organs were almost identical to a human female's, but while it wasn't alien in that way, it was still very alien to him, a previous man. He'd even briefly wondered if he should change pronouns, as he now looked much more like a woman than a man. Then again, Liara had always made a point to tell him that Asari were a monogendered race, so really either pronoun could apply to him. Considering he'd grown up a man, he felt that the male pronouns still worked just fine.

Before he knew it, he was standing outside of the information broking firm that Liara ran. He steeled himself, then entered. He'd been given a hotel room by Cerberus, as well as a new ship. Out of his new set of clothes, Shepard had chose to meat Liara in Asari battle armor. He'd always been the most comfortable when in armor. Liara sat at a desk, and briefly looked up from her omni-tool's hologram long enough to meet his eyes. "Hello, how my I help you?"

It took nearly an hour, but Shepard managed to convince her he was telling the truth. He'd had to show her all the evidence Cerberus had forged, but eventually she relented. There was tension between them: before the mission on Ilos, the two had slept together. It had been a moment of passion, driven by the fear of their imminent deaths. Afterwards, they hadn't mentioned it. It had become a one-night stand. "Shepard, I'm sorry I was so stubborn but...well, you must admit this all seems ridiculous!" she said. "Still, I can't tell you how happy I am that you're back now." Her eyes flickered over his body, something they had done many times during their talk. Now, though, there was something more in the gaze. "I must say, of all the bodies to be stuck in, you've ended up being even more attractive than before!"

Shepard blushed, something he'd never done before. "Oh, really? I don't recall being quite THAT ugly."

"T-that isn't what I meant!" Liara stammered. It was only then that she saw the smile on Shepard's face, and realized he had been joking. "Really though, John, I was wondering...I've been lonely since you've been gone. Would it be okay if you...came over to my apartment tonight? I know it's sudden, but..." She tried to reach for an excuse before giving up. "Goddess, John, I just really need you right now."

In less than a minute, a small, thin, monkey-like creature was staring up at him from the ex-Salarian's crumpled-up science suit. The large omni-tool slipped from its diminutive grasp, but it barely seemed to notice as it examined itself excitedly, running the tips of the long fingers of its hands over the mottled body and tail.

"Experiment complete success!" it squeaked. "Genome rewritten. Body transformed... Hmm... Possible miscalculation. Reaper technology capable of maintaining or degrading mental function to fit body... May have left degrade function...active..." Only then did the little pyjak notice the discarded omni-tool, now the size of its torso. It tried to fit its paw around it, but it was much too big. "Commander Shepard. Require your assistance returning to normal. Haste preferable... Higher order brain functions... becoming... difficult..."

135331111222111112.content:
"How could something made from Reaper technology prove useful?" Shepard asked, obviously distrustful.

"Think Commander. Lots of advancements from Reaper technology." Mordin began, "Modern galactic civilization unable to function without mass relays. EDI and this ship both products of Reaper technology as well. Even Thanix Cannon that destroyed Collector ship reverse engineered from Sovereign's wreckage."

"I understand all of that but, well..." Shepard trailed off.

"Understand hesitation but not all Reaper technology bad." stated Mordin, "Take Omni-Change as I call it: works by synching up with databases galaxywide. On Citadel, on Omega, taps into population, personel, etcetera databases and then applies that to recipient changing target into virtual clone of... anything! From wisest Council member to bravest Alliance soldier to lowly Omega dweller to, er, simple pyjack."

Shepard eyed Mordin warily, "I'm still not sure how this helps."

"Simple." Mordin answered, "Disguise, obviously, deep covert operations. Need to find out what Blue Suns are planning? Become one. Need to get edge on diplomatic deal with turian, take the place of turian embassy worker. Also, take on abilities of target to minor extent."

"The abilities of a target?" Shepard asked.

"Exactly!" Mordin exclaimed, "Turn into biotic and gain biotic abilities. Turn into asari commando and gain vast combat skills. Not exact however. Won't kill people if turned into now deceased daughter of Samara for example."

Deciding to take the device back to his quarters for study, Shepard bid farewell to the salarian scientist and left for his room. Upon entering he went to the bathroom. A mirror, after all, would make it a more ideal place to test this out. Deciding to start with something simple, he activated the device and, scanning through it, used it to change himself into a copy of Jacob Taylor.

"Not bad." he said to himself, Jacob's voice emerging from his mouth, "I'm surprised it actually works. Let's try something a little different though."

Again using the device he transformed into a copy of Thane Krios. And then Kelly Chambers, Grunt, Gabby, Samara and finally he stood there in the form of Jack. "Okay, I'll admit this thing is pretty cool." he said to himself, admiring Jack's tattoos and shaved head and the way it all worked on her, "I could have a lot of fun with this. I need a break after that ordeal with the Collectors so maybe I could use this to have a little fun messing with people."

As he looked, he used the device to change again, this time into a copy of that nosy reporter Khalisah al-Jilani. "Man, she's a bitch but she's got a pretty nice little body..." a grin suddenly spread on the fake al-Jilani's face, "I bet Liara'd like to have fun with it. Maybe I can use this device to spice up our relationship a bit."

13533111122211111212211.content:
"But of course!" Shepard brought out as he had a rather brilliant idea! Next he sat down at his private terminal and started to write a mail to Miranda.

***

One week later, the Normandy docked at the Citadel, a giant space station supposedly of Prothean design.
For the past week, Shepard found his XO talking about nothing else but meeting her sister on the Citadel.
Oh, if she'd only knew... he thought as he stepped out of the airlock and took one of the shuttles to Zakera Ward.

***

An hour later, what looked like Oriana Lawson stood in front of the Zakera Cafe. Nervously the essentially younger, otherwise near-identical twin of Miranda Lawson ran a hand over her hips.
Maybe this wasn't such a great idea after all! Shepard thought as he, now rather she, noticed another boy was checking her out.

The past half hour, humans, turians and even the occasional asari marveled at her body. Shepard couldn't even deny the fact that they were quite right doing so. After all, Oriana was a 19-year old version of her older sister, and it seemed her beauty ran in the family - or rather, in the genes!

Suddenly her trail of thought was interrupted when somebody called her out. "Ori?" it came from...
13533111122211111212211.title: He turns into her sister Oriana.

choices: "But maybe we should find somewhere private."
135331111222111112122111.content:
"Ori?" Miranda pushed her way through the cafe, looking almost about to well up as she pulled her "sister" into a hug. As they finally broke it, Miranda looked about the pleasant cafe in suspicion. "Are you sure you weren't followed Ori?"

"I'm sure," Shepard said honestly. Nobody could have followed Orianna here; she'd arrived as Shepard, slipped into the cafe toilets when no-one was looking and used the omni-change to make the switch into the beautiful Orianna. If anything, she had probably lost a few reporters tailing Commander Shepard.
135331111222111112122111.title: Orianna

choices: "If you don't mind, I'm waiting for somebody." [Renegade]
135331111222111112122112.content:
In all the Cafes in all the Wards in all the Galaxy, he had to walk into mine, Shepard thought glumly, as the boy made his way between the scattering of tables towards her. He called Oriana's name cautiously, approaching her like he would a gazelle, terrified she could bolt at any moment. Shepard had half a mind to. She looked around hopefully for her "older sister" but Miranda was nowhere in sight.

This definately wasn't a great idea Shepard whimpered. The boy made it to her, utterly failing to repress a big beaming smile. He seemed to weigh up the possiblities of a hug but the Commander's nervous, rigid stance discouraged him.

"Oriana," he said, breathlessly. His (rather handsome, Shepard had to admit) face crumpled as she gave a non-commital half-smile. "You don't remember me," he said sadly.

Of course I don't. I'm not her! Please go away! But she couldn't help feel stirings of sympathy for the dissapointed teen. At least she hoped it was sympathy.

135331111222111112122221.title: Krogan female

1353311112221111121222211.content:
Female Krogan were a valuable and dwindling resource, closely guarded on their homeplanet of Tuchanka where they lived in seclusion, never leaving the planet and killing anything that came close. Not suprisingly, less than a half-dozen scans of female Krogan individuals existed in the Omni-change, all of them dated around the time of the development of the genophage. No doubt these were scans taken from Mordin's research. Perhaps stored on here were the only fertile, genophage-free Krogan in the Galaxy.

Shepard retreated to his quarters to make the change. Slipping out of his clothing, he set the device for self-change and activated the selected scan.

The first changes were minor and radiated out from the left arm holding the omni-change to cover the rest of his body. His skin mottled a yellow-green colour, thickening like old leather. His body hardened into a block of tough and sinewy muscle, gradually losing its human proportions and developing the Krogan's hunched stance to accomodate the muscular hump swelled on his back.

Further changes were more uncomfortable. Two fingers of each hand withered before his eyes into nothing. Claws sprang from the toenails and remaining fingernails, forcing out the originals. The thickening skin on his arms, head, and chest crusted over further to form stony crests that enveloped his hair and genitals. He gruntled a little as redundant organs sprouted within his chest, and his nervous and circulatory system underwent a massive overhaul.

As the changes slowed, she examined herself skeptically. She didn't feel female, nor did she particularly look it. Rather, se felt like seven feet of powerful muscle contained within an armoured shell, with the potential to destroy something with the slightest movement.

She took a cautious step towards the elevator on legs that felt put on backwards, staggering into her display of model ships and scattering them over the room in a shower of broken glass. Grunting in annoyance, Shepard made it the rest of the way to the lift and with the aliens fingers of her hand, keyed the elevator for engineering.
1353311112221111121222211.title: As a female Krogan

choices: -leads him on a wild goosechase through the ship
13533111122211111212222111.content:
The elevator descended through the ship. Shepard shifted uncomfortably in her new, alien body, as naked as the day it had been scanned into a medical databse by Salarians all those years ago. The Krogan inside her didn't like being cooped up in this metal box. It wanted to be free, and fighting. How could Krogan live like this? Getting antsy if they hadn't punched something in five minutes.

The elevator door pinged open at the Combat Center. "Um. I'll just get the next one," Kelly Chambers stuttered, taking a step back from the huge, unfamiliar Krogan that filled the elevator from ceiling to floor. The doors slid shut.

The doors opened again at Engineering and Shepard disembarked happily, stretching her massive shoulders in the space that Engineering deck provided. In a body now built like a tank, sneaking up on Grunt would be impossible. Instead, she decided on the direct approach.

Grunt leapt to his feet as Shepherd stepped boldly into his room. His stance was confused, unsure whether to fight this intruder or... something else. For the first time in his existence he retreated, taking a nervous step away from the first female Krogan he had ever seen, that had suddenly dropped into his world.

Shepard smiled to see his surprise. What's more, she found herself marvelling at the aesthetic appeal of his body, which took her by surprise. Before he had just been a crude wall of muscle. But now, looking at him through these eyes, he had aspects she had never even seen; the gentle, smooth motling of his skin, the exquisite blend of power and speed in his physique, and the almost-prepubescent undeveloped head crest. Pure krogan indeed.

She...
13533111122211111212222111.title: ME2: I am pure krogan; you should be in awe

choices: Grunt beat him to the room
135331111222111112122221111.content:
Shepard's lips spread into a wide scaly smile. He'd known Grunt for literally all of his life and it had always bugged him how the 'perfect' Krogan never showed any sign of humility, vulnerability, and (for lack of a better word) humanity. But the way Grunt was looking at Shepard's naked female Krogan body showed Shepard that Grunt wasn't just a killing machine, he did indeed actually seemed to have a capacity for not being a stubborn hardass. Having accomplished everything he wanted to do Shepard waved goodbye and went back to the elevator and pushed the button to go back to his cabin so he could change back and plan his next action.

But as the elevator reached the half way point Shepard noticed something was a bit off. There was a very loud rumbling going on just outside of the elevator, Shepard only had to wonder for a few seconds what it was before his Krogan nose told him the answer. "Grunt." Shepard said as he smelled Grunt's male pharamones going crazy and they seemed to be going through the rarely used ladder-ways and duct work. And Shepard knew that Grunt could probably smell him and was going to meet him wherever the elevator stopped.

"Crap." Shepard said as he tried to use the modified Omni-Tool to change back but he cursed himself, "Damn damn, I forgot, I left it back in my room. Why did I decide I had to be naked for this?" Finally after what felt like forever the elevator stopped at Shepard's room. Shepard didn't wait for the doors to open and used his Krogan strength to rip them open and charge into his room.

1353311112221111122.content:
"Miss T'Soni, there you are! I'm so glad you could make it!" exclaimed "Khalisah" as Liara walked into Shepard's cabin.

"Yes, well when you contacted me I felt it was my duty to come." Liara said, eyeing the reporter suspiciously. "Although I have to wonder just why it is you're contacting me from Shepard's ship."

"It's not as odd as you may think, Miss T'Soni." the fake reporter replied, "I'd been sent by my news agency, Westerlund News, to interview the Commander. Colonists go missing, Shepard returns and then the attacks stop. That's not a coincidence and as a reporter it's my job to get to the bottom of stories like this."

"A reporter... I could say things about that." said Liara, a hint of contempt on her face.

"Khalisah" shook her head. "You may object to my methods and views but I still AM a reporter. That's why I contacted you... well the Shadow Broker but imagine my surprise when that turned out to be you."

"Me? The Shadow Broker? Ms. al-Jilani you flatter me but overestimate my abilities. I am merely an agent and not the Shadow Broker him or herself." replied Liara.

"Right, I see." "Khalisah" said, a knowing smirk on her face. "But anyway, down to brass tacks I suppose. I contacted you because I needed more information on a group known as Cerberus."

Liara was a bit taken aback by that. "Cerberus?" she asked.

The fake reporter nodded, "Yes, no doubt as an... agent... of the Shadow Broker you've heard of them. I feel it's important for both me and Citadel Space at large to know about them."

"But Ms. al-Jilani, your views are..." Liara started.

"Pro-human?" answered "Khalisah" finishing her thought, "Yes, well I feel that their views are a bit too extreme. I've read reports buried deep within Alliance databases about the experiments they've done in the Maroon Sea, among other things. They need to be exposed to the galaxy at large."

"That is... rather surprising." Liara stated, "I wouldn't have expected such a moral stance on the subject from you."

"Khalisah" smiled at Liara, "Yes well as a reporter my job is to bring the truth to the people, only now do I realize that the truth is more important than an agenda. My experiences, both with Shepard and more recent ones, have shown me that I may have been somewhat wrong about non-humans... you asari especially."

The reporter walked towards Liara smiling. She took her arms and draped them over Liara's shoulders, looking into her eyes. "So beautiful, you asari. Your lovely blue skin, your gorgeous eyes, you're beautiful souls..."

"M-Ms. al-Jilani, I don't know..." Liara started. She was, however, cut off by the lovely Middle Eastern reporter bringing her mouth up to Liara's and kissing her. The asari resisted at first but pleasure overcame her and she relented. Something about the way Khalisah kissed her felt so safe and familiar. So right.

Shepard, in his mind, smiled. He was enjoying the feel of Khalisah's body and impersonating her in order to fool Liara was fun. But while he was enjoying being her, he also wanted to try a couple other forms on Liara; Gabby was cute and would be fun to try, Jack was rough and lithe and combined with her biotics would make for an interesting time, Tali... well before contacting Liara Shepard asked Mordin what would happen if he turned into a quarian. Would he inherit their weak immune systems? Mordin had said most likely not so that might be fun to try. And so many lovely asari...

However, Shepard was enjoying being Khalisah. Impersonating her, acting like her, the feel of her body... especially now as it was pressed against Liara's gorgeous form. She was a smart girl, perhaps he should let Liara figure things out on her own.

"The cheerleader won't admit what Cerberus did to me was wrong," Jack spat.

"It wasn't Cerberus, not really. But clearly you were a mistake," Miranda retorted.

"Screw you. You have no idea what they put me through. Maybe it's time I showed you..."

Shepard activated the omni-tool. If he didn't resolve this quickly the whole ship could be in danger.

Tali stirred in her sleep, sending another shiver of pain through Shepherd. He stared at the clock tick by in the dark. He didn't feel tired. As a piece of footwear, he no longer had any need for sleep. The passage of time was almost as torturous as the sensations themselves. The night seemed eternal.

As dawn finally came - as far as one can say such a thing on a spaceship - Tali was roused by the coms. It was Miranda.

"Tali, are you awake? We have a situation. Somehow... Shepherd isn't on the ship, and neither is Mordin."

They had noticed him missing! Hope awoke in Shepherd, just as Tali slipped quickly out of bed, slamming her foot into the ground.

Mordin's form began to change, both his body and his outfit. His body becoming human, long black hair constrasting with his pale white skin and large breasts held in by a skintight black and white jumpsuit. He placed his hand on his new breasts and then smiled at Shepard. "Reverse engineering, modification a success. Great news." came the new, accented feminine voice.

"Miranda?" Shepard asked in complete shock.

"Only physically. Inside still Mordin. Still have my genius intellect." the fake Miranda stated. It was weird, her voice but with Mordin's speech patterns and inflection.

Shepard just stared in complete amazement. "How did you do that?" he asked.

"Quite simple actually." the Miranda-dressed Mordin stated, "Like Reapers device or Omni-Change works both mechanically AND genetically. Links up with databases in Citadel, Omega, Alliance, merc groups and others. Copies appearance and genetic information from databases into device. Selecting person and using device causes target to transform into copy of selected person. Human, asari, turian, KROGAN... can transform into all of them! Right down to clothing even!"

"So does it only work for the user?" Shepard asked.

Mordin just shook his new pretty head, "Shepard, please. Not simple krogan scientist, made sure it works on selected target. Could be user, could be somebody else. Allow me to show you."

Mordin lifted his hand, pointing it at Shepard and, after a bit of searching, found what he wanted and used the device. Shepard could feel his body quickly shifting and changing in ways that were quite odd. Getting skinnier in some places and larger, sometimes MUCH larger, in others. His fingers elongated, fusing together until their was three and his legs bent backwards at the shins in a way that was alien to him. It was done quickly and Shepard looked down throw the purple visor at a black bodysuit with purple cloth in various places. He ran his now three-fingered hands over his new breasts.

"This is..." he stated, his voice now feminine and accented, "I'm Tali!"

"Thought it would be best to turn you into someone completely different as display of device's abilities." Mordin stated in his current Australian accent. "So how are you feeling Tali'Zorah vas Neema?"

"I feel..." Shepard took his new hands and ran them over the large hips and ass that the quarian woman possessed, "quite good." There was a seductive quality to the amused tone of Tali's Eastern European accented voice which Shepard found pleasing coming out of his mouth. "But wait, if I'm Tali right now does that mean I have the weak quarian immune system?" he asked.

"Surpisingly no!" Mordin answered. "Change is genetic but not complete. Become Jack and acquire biotic abilities. Become deceased daughter of Samara gain ability to dominate the minds of others however WON'T become ardat-yakshi. Become quarian and gain aptitude for engineering but not weak immune system. How it works still not sure but that is what happens."

"So all the benefits but none of the drawbacks." Shepard said looking down at his lovely quarian body, "Mordin you're the best, you know that!"

Out of nowhere, the sound of the lab's doors opening was heard. "Hey Mordin, you said you wanted to see me when I went on bre--WHOA!" The Normandy's pilot, Lt. Jeff Moreau, more commonly called Joker, stopped in surprise as he entered the room, seeing Shepard hugging Miranda. "I'm, uh, not interrupting anything am I?"

"Oh, what? Joker?!" Shepard said confused, pulling away from Miranda-Mordin.

"Ah, Joker! Yes, was hoping to see you. Time for biweekly check up. See Vrolik's Syndrome has progressed either in good or bad way, find out if there is new useful data for me to use, other assorted things." Mordin stated.

Joker just looked wide-eyed. "Miranda? What are you talking about?" he asked in confusion.

"Oh, uh, pardon me." replied Mordin, "Forgot I still looked like this." activating the device, he changed back into himself. "There we go, much better. Operative Lawson's form quite appealing if I were non-salarian. Advantages as well but difficult to adjust to... certain elements."

"Okay, I am now officially freaked out." Joker stated. "I get relieved thinkin' everything's gonna be normal but noooo, I find the Commander getting all touchy feely with Miranda except it's not Miranda but Mordin. Maybe I'm going crazy, suffering a little PTSD."

"Joker, calm down. You're not going crazy." Shepard said with a small laugh, "It's this device Mordin invented. Here, we'll give you a demonstration." Shepard turned to Mordin and whispered something to the scientist. He then turned back towards Joker and smiled. An omni-tool then appeared on Mordin's arm who aimed it at Shepard. Shepard was hit with a bright flash and then Joker watched, amazed, as Shepard's form changed. "It allows you to change yourself or someone else into another person. Or asari, or turian or anyone."

"Sh-Shepard?" Joker asked.

Shepard shook his head, "No Joker, it's Tali. Physically at least." Shepard walked up to Joker and ran a hand down his face, "You know, you're kind of cute Joker." Shepard said in Tali's accented voice, "Since I lack her weak immune system perhaps I could show you what's under Tali's helmet. I've been wondering about that myself."

Joker took a step back in surprise. "Whoa, Commander I don't know... what's gotten into you?"

"I'm a quarian babe, Joker." Shepard replied running his Tali hands over his Tali hips, "It can be fun to act out a bit as someone else."

"Shepard, I don't know..." Joker said, unsure of what to do.

Glancing at Joker, Shepard then turned his head back to Mordin. "Mordin, perhaps you should let Joker in on the action. Turn him into... I don't know, Jack."

"Whoa now, Commander I don't know--" before he could finish Joker was struck by the same flash and in short order, his body had changed. He looked down to see that he was wearing practically nothing but some straps up top and that his torso and arms were heavily tattooed while his chest was on the small side. He reached up, feeling the very small amount of fuzz on his shaved head. "Holy shit it... I..." Joker started.

"Well outside of being a girl which is, you know, WEIRD AS HELL, I feel great!" Joker exclaimed, "I feel normal too! Not all crippled and made of glass."

"It's a great device isn't it?" asked Shepard.

Joker could only nod in agreement. "I gotta admit, it is pretty cool. Uh, since I'm relieved of my piloting duties for a few hours could I, ya know, take that thing? Mess around with it? I got this chance to be normal for a bit and I am NOT passin' it up."

"He has a point, Joker." Shepard said. "What if something comes up and we need you?"

"Oh c'mon, really?!" Joker protested, "Look at you, you're just gonna wander around looking like Tali like it's nothing?"

"Tali's a sweet girl, I'm sure I could do something to put any weird feelings she has to rest if she sees her double." Shepard explained, "But say we get the alert and you come out looking like Miranda or Jack or Samara. Do you REALLY want to find out what could happen if they saw someone impersonating them?"

Joker frowned, an expression that wouldn't be out of place on Jack's face if it were a frown of anger instead of disappointment. "C'mon Commander! Look, okay since you said it earlier how about you bring the device with you, we go up to your cabin, have a little bit of Tali/Jack sexy time aaaaand then you give the thing to me for a bit. Sound good?"

135331111222111212211111221.content:
I think there's some points you've missed here. Didn't it occur to you that with this, we could do more than infiltration work? If diseases don't carry over, couldn't we cure illnesses, wounds?"

Mordin brought a finger to his chin, pondering. "Theoretically, yes. Omni-change utilizes pure genetics. Like starting over from germ line. May even ignore epigenetic effects. Data points...insufficient. What did you have in mind?"

"Tali. Her weak immune system doesn't just hurt her, it reduces the effectiveness of the team. Besides, if we can fix her, we may even be able to fix the rest of the Migrant Fleet. They could settle a new world."

"Hmmm...quite possible. Immunology is a complicated subject. Not an expert on Quarians myself. Quarian's immuno-compromised nature caused by several factors. Little selection pressure for immunity, lack of acquired resistances, lack of acquired tolerances, and lack of beneficial symbiotes in system. Might work, or at least improve the condition."

"And you're sure this is safe?" Shepard tried to temper his enthusiasm. It would hardly be the first time experimentation with Reaper technology had gone wrong.

"Yes. Well, almost certain. Probably." Mordin scratched at the shortened nub on his head.

"...Maybe I'd better ask her about this first."

Tali had jumped at the chance of permanently improving her immune system. As happy as he was to see her enthusiasm, it made Shepard feel more than a little guilty. He still wasn't sure how much Mordin had tested the omni-change. If Tali were hurt...wouldn't he share some responsibility? The Quarian immune system was a major barrier in their relationship, and always would be; even more so than their difference in species. Knowing Tali, he couldn't help but feel that she might only be doing this for him, that he was abusing her trust. Not to mention, Shepard couldn't deny the possibility that he had an ulterior motive for fixing her. That night together before their last mission had been wonderful...but all too brief. They hadn't gotten to truly experience each other the way Shepard was used to.

They met in the med bay, Tali taking a seat on a cushioned examination table. Doctor Chakwas was, mercifully, absent. She would surely have raised objections.

Mordin cleared his throat and gave them a pointed look. "Omni-change keyed to genetic data. Recommend against holding hands. Genetic interference could be...unpleasant." Reluctantly they broke their touch.

"On the count of thre-wait, still not used to base ten number system. I'll just say go. Go!" Mordin fired.

The blood tests revealed none of the old Quarians' beneficial microbes which once patrolled their blood vessels as an alien analogue to a human's white blood cells. Many of Mordin's allergy tests, including ingredients such as human saliva and sebaceous fluid, resulted in a hyper reaction by the Quarian's few remaining crystal cells, which had to be suppressed with drugs to prevent an immediate medical situation.

Mordin's head was bowed solemnly. "I'm sorry. There's no sign that the omni-change benefited you at all. Perhaps a flaw when morphing the subject into themselves, or the problems with the Quarians' immune deficiency extend far beyond genetic factors."

"It's ok, Mordin." Tali sighed as Shepard wrapped an arm around her. "It was stupid to get my hopes up. New tech never works the way you think it will." Mordin simply nodded.

They complied, though dealt a parting blow to his ego by way of the disturbing slurping sensation of them sliding inside his body. The feeling was so sudden he began to teeter...only to find himself unable to catch his balance and collapse onto his bed. His feet were positioned wrong. They felt too long, yet simultaneously seemed to hang in the air, affording very little contact to the floor. And the huge distance from which his thighs now projected from his hips, combined with the new spacing of his legs; was simply too much for him to overcome. He landed on his new ass, whose width and corpulent softness cushioned the fall comfortably, spreading out across his mattress like...well, a mattress.

The shrinking had stopped, as had (finally) the growth of his hips. Shepard felt the prickling of his hands and feet falling asleep for a brief moment, and flexed them as they achieved a familiar, tridactyl configuration.

Just when he thought it was over, he felt a pressure in his chest heralding a sudden bout of expansion...albeit in a far more specific manner than the general contraction of his torso and waste earlier. Erupting from his pecs, too mounds forced their way outward like twin erupting volcanoes, triggering a complementary explosion of sensation when his newly hyper-sensitive nipples began rubbing against the plastic smoothness of his suit. He heard himself gasp in unwanted pleasure. A very light, girlish gasp. And then...it was over.

Shepard lay in silence for a time, until prompted by Tali's soft voice. "You can open your eyes now." Her tone was dripping in guilt. Shepard opened his eyes to find Tali's face nearly pressed against his, her concern visible through her mask. One identical to the one Shepard was wearing. In fact, both their masks were clearer than it seemed to Shepard they should be. There was no purple haze tinting the light that penetrated their helmets. The Quarians' visible spectrum must have been slightly different from a human's.

"John? Are you okay?"

He made himself smile.

"I'm fine. Tali." Her eyes widened at the sound of Shepard's soft, accented voice; yet he saw her mouth curve into a smile. One that he knew was a precise mirror of his own.

Tali leapt at him.

Shepard again found himself unable to breathe. Tali's arms fit around him in a way they never could before, and the strength of her hug was like a vice. It was worse than the suit had been when he was still transforming.

"I'msorryI'msorryI'msorry! Oh, keelah! What was I thinking just zapping you like that?!"

"It' ... *hack*...ok, Tali. Please. Have to...breathe."

"Sorry!" Tali bounced off of him. Shepard ignored the reciprocal bouncing that had settled in his breasts as he caught his breath.

Shepard rose from the bed and regarded Tali again. It was so strange, seeing her at eye level. "So. I'm you."

"Yes." Tali blushed. God, he could actually see her blush. It was going to be hard going back to human eyesight after this. "Is this ok? I mean, did it make things weird or anything? I mean of course it's weird but is it making you uncomfortable or-"

"It's fine. Really." Shepard hugged her, though he broke it off quickly, perturbed by the feeling of their breasts squashing together. If Tali was likewise disturbed, she didn't show it.

"Thank you." She whispered. "I love you."

"I love you too. So...now what? It's not like I have a problem with your body, but why did you want a twin?"

"Heh. A couple of reasons really."

"Such as?" Shepard prompted.

"Well, I got the idea when Mordin accidentally told me that you'd uh...experimented, I guess? With my body I mean. I was a little mad, but I couldn't help but be curious. See what it would be like, you know?" She paused. "Is that really what I sound like?"

"Yes, and it's adorable. Now stop dodging the question."

"Yes. Sorry. Okay. I also wanted to see if, well...Mordin said that using the omni-change to fix my immune system might not have worked because of some problem with the device being used to turn a person into themselves. I'd hoped that maybe, if I made you me instead, that maybe it would work."

"Okay...but how does that help you?"

Tali somehow appeared even more flustered. "I'll get to that, alright?!" She took a deep breath. "But first, let's talk about how it helps you." She clasped Shepard's hand, a bizarre feeling when they each only had three fingers, and drew him to the small mirror in his quarters. "We've never been able to properly see each other. I don't just mean without my mask. I mean without the suit...or anything. It may seem strange to a human, but for a Quarian to be naked with someone is kind of a big deal."

Shepard couldn't help but chuckle, although it sounded more like a giggle. "Actually seeing someone naked is kind of a big deal on Earth, too." Tali responded with a playful poke in his chest. Which felt strangely good. Something else new.

"I'm being serious! I know it's not the same...but wouldn't you like to see me? I mean all of me? With nothing separating us from each other? This way we could do that. And if you get sick, we can just change you back?"

Shepard's mouth had gone unaccountably dry. "Of course I want to see you. But like you said, it's not the same..." He regarded his...her...their faces in the mirror. "...but I think I'll give it a shot anyway."

"Oh, thank you! Thank you!" Tali was already fumbling with his helmet. " But there was one other thing..."

1353311112222211.title: What does it do?

13533111122222111.content: Today was a momentous occasion. Most of the crew had gathered into Liara's room to look at an ancient Prothean artifact recovered from Ilos. It was a cube, and even after many man-hours of cleaning it still showed the signs that it had been buried for tens of thousands of years. "My top scientists believe that if we channel a mass effect field into the device, it will activate. I thought everyone would want to be here for the first test of that theory, especially in the case that something dangerous were to happen." In this case, "everyone" meant Commander Shepard, his girlfriend Tali'Zorah vas Normandy, Garrus, Kaidan, EDI, Joker, James, Javik, Miranda (visiting the crew), Diana Allers, and Samantha Traynor. All eyes were on the artifact as Liara's hand glowed bright blue. The energy moved from her hand and into the device, and at first it seemed like nothing had happened. The next second, however, the artifact began to glow with a deep violet hue. That was the last thing any of them remembered.
13533111122222111.title: Once more, into the breach!

135331111222221111.content:
Shepard's eyes opened in rush. What had he been doing? That was right, the experiment. Had he been knocked unconscious. He put a hand on what felt like a wooden floor and struggled to rise to his feet, hearing the groans and mumbles of others as he did so. It was only once he was standing at his full height that he realized that said full height was nowhere near what it had once been. How did an experiment with a Prothean artifact affect his height? That was about when his eyes started to focus on the others around him.

They each resembled a member of his crew in some way, but aside from a few humans he'd never seen anything like them. Several of the people in front of him were taller than him but shorter than the humans, with pointed ears and thin faces. Others looked to be around his height, quite short and stout. A few others towered above everyone with thick, bulging muscles, curled horns growing out of their temples, and cloven feet. Shepard also began to take notice of their surroundings: a ship. Not a spaceship, as he was so often used to being on, but instead a wooden boat on an open ocean, with no land in sight.

One of the people, a human man with a slim build, a shaved head, and wearing white robes with an orange trim, asked him, "Commander, is that you? From what my new sensory input is telling me, I can deduce that we are in a completely different spacetime from out own, and that our physical forms have been altered to match our new reality." So then, that was probably EDI.

A woman with pointed ears and tight clothes scratched her head. "Spacetime? Mind saying that again in english, chica?" That was...James?!

"It means we're in an alternate dimension, you dolt," came the rumbling basso of a man the same height as Shepard with a long black beard and white leather armor.

Shepard was getting annoyed with this very quickly. "Look, everyone, let's stop for a moment and introduce ourselves, just so everyone is on the same page as far as who is who." It was only as he spoke that Shepard heard his own voice and noticed that it was slightly higher in pitch than normal, and looked down to see behind the black platemail armor he wore to the large breasts underneath. He raised an eyebrow and looked at his crew. "Anyone mind telling me why no one said that I was a woman?"

A tall human with shoulder-length black hair and purple robe smirked at him, one hand on his hip. "We all changed genders, Shepard. Or did you think I always looked like this under my suit?" With the words came a fascinating accent that Shepard knew well: that was Tali.

One of the exceptionally tall horned people, a woman in sailing clothes, spoke up. "Yeah, Commander, you're not the only one dealing with extra weight on their chests." There was a short pause before she added, "Oh, I'm Joker, by the way."

Another horned person, the word 'Qun' suddenly appeared in Shepard's mind as the name of the race, this one a man in blue-green robes, chimed in. "As an ex-Asari, I must admit that suddenly belonging to a species with gender is quite odd."

A grunt came from an Elvin girl. "I find this new form ridiculous. It resembles the human species too closely, and is too small and brittle for true battle." Those words, combined with her bright red battle armor, clearly proclaimed to everyone that she was Javik.

The Dwarven man who had spoken earlier only opened his mouth again to say, "Miranda." Next to him was a human girl in blue leather armor, with a quiver and box strapped to her back. She merely nodded tersely, her face stoically blank, but just from that Shepard knew that she was Garrus.

Once Shepard knew that, it was fairly clear who the other three here were. The tall Qun in rich clothing was Diana, the other Dwarven girl in armor was Kaidan, and the only male Elf there was Samantha. Commander Shepard looked at Joker, eyebrow raised, and asked her, "Can you steer a ship?"

"Commander, I can thread the needle with a kilometer long starship, I think steering a boat won't stress my skills," she replied.

"Well then, I think everyone else should explore the ship. Make sure to stay with at least one other crew member, and be careful. We don't know much, if anything, about this new world."
135331111222221111.title: A Whole New World

135331111222221112.content:
Shepard groaned as he came too, sheilding his eyes from the sun for a moment before realising he shouldn't need to do that. Sitting up stiffly he realised he was lying at the edge of a forest along with a number of other people all of whom were in various stanges of awakening.

''Welcome back Commander'' Shepard turned and found Miranda standing beside him, dressed in a tight white what he beleived to be leather armor, which in turn caused him to examine his own as she helped him up; strong but heavy mix of uknown metal and leather ''We're some of the lucky ones to stillbe humanafter this mess'' ''Though some of us didn't get to keep their original faces'' Shepard turned in the direction of Kaiden's voice and couldn't find him, but he did find 2 more humans; a thin man with red hair and a tall leggy blond. Both were wearing much lighter armour than he was, much closer to Miranda's outfit. ''True but it feels so strange to be ... alive'' the blond commented telling Shepard just who it was. ''Kaiden? EDI?'' ''Correct'' EDI replied while Kaiden nodded

''They're lucky to get to be in a body they recognise'' another female voice added from somewhere past Miranda. Shapard turned expecting to find someone but didn't ''A little lower Commander'' she repeated and he obeyed, spying the shorter girl with a cute face and the biggest blue eyes he'd ver seen ''Godess this is strange'' she said aloud, telling Shepard this girl was Liara ''You took your time, the others are still getting used to their new bodies, though I'm the only one in a body with a strange gender. Well being a guy would be stranger but still'' she stopped talking and lead Shepard to a clearing a little way in. Here he saw a few more of the shorter people Liara was, more human sized but willowy people and tall, well built horned entites, one with backward pointing horns looked like he could take on a Krogan singled handedly.

Miranda took charge almost imediately ''Okay, now everyone's up and waling around let's start off by introducing yourselves and ten we can figure out what Liara's device did to us'' this got a loud HEY from the smaller girl. A guy in blue leather armour, blue facial tatoos and a large crossbow stepped forward ''I think you can guess who I am Shepard'' he smirked ''Well nobody wears as much blue as you do, so I hope it's you Garrus'' Shepard joked, as he saw the second elf step forward a litle nervously ''Specialist Traynor reporting for duty Commander'' she pushed her dark hair out of her eyes and Shepard noticed the spiral tatoos on her face too, though they were pale green. ''Well one interesting thing came out of this'' boomed one of the behemoths ''I didn't think I could any more ripped than I already was, eh Loco'' he laughed and Shepard rolled his eyes, that was obviously James, leaving the other 2. ''Well I can't top that'' said the other female dwarf ''Hey commander, it's Diana and I hope nobody minds this being broadcast all it's own if/when we get back to the ship'' ''That will be difficult from our position in a liniar, non culmonating section of space-time'' EDI stated ''It makes sense...'' began the gruff voice of the dwarf with the thick red beard ''... as this was most likely an escape attempt by my people to get away from the Reapers, most likely by becoming their counterparts in another reality'' ''If these are this world's versions of us, then our world me got screwed over severely'' the other horned male stated ''Oh and I'm Joker by the way'' he said suprising most of them, the wall of mucle jumped though when he felt Edi's arms circle around one of his own ''I think I'll like this world Jeff, but we'll need to be sure'' she purred and the rest of them learnt the Kossith (aka Qunari) can blush.

This didn't matter to Shepard, what did was the last member of their group who was still silent; the woman with snow white hair and spiral horns, who's suprisingly thin fingers findled amongst themselves, wrapped in deep purple robes that implied a stunning figure. When he was standing directly in front of her he spoke ''Tali?'' he asked and she inclined her head, revealing purple/blue tinged eyes and silver lines (which were more likely some kind of paint than tatoo) that came down her cheeks starting at her lower eyelids ''Yes John, it's me'' she said quietly, though Shepard smiled at the fact she somehow manged to keep her accent ''What's wrong?'' ''I'm exposed, I don't know what I am and I have this energy burning up inside me that makes me feel like am about to explode'' Tali yelled as she stood to her full height, Shepard finding out she was taller than James and Joker but was less of a wall than the guys, he only came up to the large breasts of her new body though. Shepard took her hands in his own and smiled up at her ''Don't worry love we'll sort this out together, everything even down to your magic'' he said trying to comfort his girlfriend ''Um Shepard, how do you know about magic?'' Miranda asked with quirked eyebows ''Well Javik said these were esentiall this reality's version of us, maybe we gain knowledge of this world simply from being them'' Shepard put forward with a shrug ''It ecplains why I now know how to use these'' Kaiden put forward, pulling open the coat section of his armour to reveal 2 daggers on his hips ''And why I know the best way to use that axe, and that you're wearing dragonhide'' James added pointing to the huge axe and ten Miranda ''How do you know that?'' Liara sked curiously ''Smell'' Tali answered still embracing John, his head side-on to prevent sufocation.

''Well that should make integrating much easier, we just need to figure out what to do now we're here''Mirada said trying to return things back on topic, but was interupted by a laugh from the Protean turned dwarf ''Stupid primitives, you can't even tell when you're surrounded'' Javic actally laughed slightly ''What matters isn't what we do now, it's what we do when they're finished with us''

So who are ''they''? (This also helps determine when in the Dragon Age timeline/universe they are)
[By the way EDI and Kaiden resemble their voice actors, and James & Sam are the races they are due to who they are in DA:I, James being voiced by the same person as Bull, and Traynor's voice actor being the default for female elves and humans]

It turned out Javik was right and the realm jumpers found themselves surrounded by soldiers, all wearing armour detailed with a stylized eye on their shields. A red headed dwarf, apparently the leader stepped out from behind them ''Okay, you have to the count of 5 to explain... Bull?'' the dwarf began to threaten but was confused to see James' counterpart ''You know her?'' Shepard asked ''Don't know Loco, things are still fuzzy. Same for the rest of us I presume?'' 135331211.content:
"I'd just like to let you both know that I'm very, very sorry," Ryder told his squadmates. It was a fairly insufficient apology, considering that himself, Vetra, and Liam were all stripped of their weapons and armor, bound in shackles, and standing in an experimental kett facility, facing The Cardinal through a pane of glass. "If I'd known she would do this to us, I'd probably have killed her last time. Or blown this place up. My bad."

Despite her annoyance, Vetra just rolled her snakelike Turian eyes. "Don't stress about it, Ryder. You couldn't have seen it coming that someone was going to get us captured."

Liam's face blushed a shade or two, and he fired back indignantly. "Listen, my plan would have worked if they hadn't been expecting it."

All of a sudden, the hum of the mechanisms around them coming to live ended their conversation,and their imminent transformation into Kett hit them. Ryder looked at Vetra, fondness in his eyes. "Vetra, since we're all about to basically die, I might was well tell you: I really wish I'd had a chance to screw you. Like, I was really excited about that."

Despite the situation, Vetra found herself smiling at the moron, and let out a happy sigh. "Me too, Ryder. Me too."

Seemingly on a roll, Ryder turned to his other squadmate. "Liam, I have something to tell you too: you're pretty hot and a bang would've been cool."

The man let out an awkward cough, and looked away from the Pathfinder. "Um, I'm flattered, but I don't swing that way, man."

"Oh," was all Ryder was able to say before the machine activated.

135331211211.content:
"Oh, Peebee, you're so silly, I won't take you one missions..." the Asari mused as she slipped through the Kett base, undetected, mumbling to herself. Finally she reached the key part of the new Kett mechanism: the power generator and the receptacle for Archon DNA. Apparently this bit of wizardry could exalt people en masse. Sabotaging either part would've been okay...for an amateur. But Peebee knew she wasn't one of those. With a few clicks on her omni-tool she set the generator to overload, and then she reached over and removed the Archon DNA, not taking notice of a sharp bit of wire near it, which cut her enough to make her blood start dripping from the wound. "Shit!" Peebee looked at the wound, then at the DNA, then shrugged. "Oh well, it's disabled, who cared. 'Peebee, I'm sorry we didn't have space sex before, let's have it now.' 'Sure Ryder, if you insist.'" She then began making kissing and other more vulgar sounds as she exited the base, not realizing her own DNA from her blood had entered the receptacle.



Everyone knew immediately something was wrong with the device, because instead of just the prisoners rising into the air, everyone in the building did. Ryder watched, confused, but wasn't able to focus on that as the changes begun. He watched, and did not see bone armor rise out of his skin, but instead as it turned a dark blue color. His entire body lost its layer of ripped muscle, replaced with softer, more curvy features. His waist cinched in tighter, while his hips expanded out, giving him an hourglass figure. Ryder noticed something odd on his shoulders suddenly, and checked to see his hair had fallen out, and reached up to find it had all been replace with a familiar tentacle-shapped nest of cartilage. He watched as his under-armor tank top became a valley of cleavage, as large blue breasts swelled out of his flat chest, and felt his pants get tighter over a thicker, softer ass. The last change came with his genitals, which withdrew inside of him, leaving him with the Asari's equivalent of a vagina. As the changes ended, Ryder looked himself over and was forced to admit he had become an Asari, one with a deep blue skin tone and one of the largest chests he'd ever seen.

He looked to where his squadmates had been standing, and saw two other Asari there. The one that had been where Vetra was had a purple skin tone, an expression that bordered between confused and annoyed, and the largest, most succulent ass Ryder had ever seen in his life. Liam had become a green Asari, and while she still had a fairly good figure, it was clear she was the least buxom or bodacious of the three. Then Ryder's eyes moved past them to the crowd outside the chamber...all the Kett were now Asari too.

Death is frequent, and life is cheap. Soldiers die and are reborn, before being thrown once more into the meat grinder of combat to be gunned down once more, a bloody cycle that shows no sign of ending.

You are...
1353323.title: Planetside

13533233.content:
Indar. Broken Arch Road. Late afternoon.

Clad in your skin hugging infiltration suit, you lay flat on your belly on a rocky outcrop jutting from a mesa, high above the TR facility below. The sun is setting on the desert continent, and a brisk, dry wind whistles down the high-walled ravine. Shuffling over the red dust to the edge of the outcrop, you lift the sights of the V10, the high-velocity plasma rifle, to your eye, scanning the facility below.

A nanite swarm crawls over your skin like liquid, encasing you, warping the light around your body. The new cloak nanites are performing well, though they sure do itch. Anybody looking at you would see only the faintest shimmer in the shape of a man, lost in the wavering columns of hot air that rise from the sun-baked stone as the evening cools.

The facility is quiet. The rifle sight moves from empty door to empty door, searching out movement. A terran heavy tank sits idle in the road that runs between the facility, its cockpit open and empty. The side is pitted with impact damage, and a gout of black smoke flows from the holes in the thick armour plating. You wait.

Movement in one of the doors. An engineer emerges from a building, walking unhurried towards the tank. She crouches down beside the dented plating, lifting her nano-armour kit to the damage. A flicker of white energy shines from the tool, and the rent armour starts to heal.

You line up the rifle on her head, slowing your breathing, squeezing the trigger.

As you do, you hear the deep thrum of a Galaxy dropship engine. growing closer. With a sudden roar, the vast ship soars above the mesa, the turbulence of its passing shaking the rock under you. It flies with a slow elegance, like a whale swimming, banking sluggishly. Its vast belly is covered with floodlights which scour the land beneath it. Darklight floodlights. You press yourself back against the rock, but it is too late - the nanites on your skin fizz and pop as they try to bend the darklight, burning themselves out in the process. Your once-invisible form is outlined in sparks of purple and green.

Damn it. You climb to your feet, slinging the rifle over your back, and start to scramble across the rock. The floodlights follow you. At the same time, you hear a new roar over the sound of the Galaxy engines. You look down to see the heavy tank is repaired, its massive turret pivoting up to point directly at you.

"May the will of Vanu protect-"

"-me."

With a rush of sound and light and a brief jolt of agony, you awaken inside a rebirthing tube inside the warp gate. You step out of the tube. An information analyst steps forward, a data pad in her hands as she prepares to take your intel.

"Place of death, Broken Arch Road. Cause of death, tank," you mutter, rubbing your sore limbs. Rebirthing never got any easier.

"Anything useful to report?" she asks dryly.

"Yeah, your damn cloak doesn't work anymore," you snap back angrily, tearing the cloaking device from your armour and tossing it far away. "Their darklight sees straight through it, I might as well be wearing lumifier out there for all the good it does."

"If you have a problem with the tech, you're perfectly free to choose another class," she bites back. "Alternatively the armoury are trialing new prototypes in the field that should circumvent the issue with darklight. If you wish, I can download the specifications to your terminal now, though you'll be expected to file a thorough report on its use."

"Sure, anything."

She shrugs, tapping a button on the data pad before walking away.

You appraoch a terminal, loading up your loadout display. The prototype device is there. Prototype TXF47. Capabilities...
13533233.title: The Vanu Sovereignty, technophiles and alien wo...

choices: And set out a pained gasp
135332331.content:
The terminal disgorges a flow of nanites that crystalise into a palm-sized, circular device that slots neatly into your armour where the cloak had once been. The technical specifications of the prototype move across your HUD, while the recorded voice of command begins to speak in your ear.

"Thank you for opting in to the TXF47 prototype beta. The field data you collect will be invaluable to the perfection of this crucial piece of technology, which we believe will grant us the advantage in infiltration and reconnaissance, and allow us to bring this war to a swift end. You are now being instant actioned into battle. Best of luck, soldier."

Your body begins to fade away as nanites consume it from within. "Wait a sec-"

"-cond."

For the second time in five minutes, you are rebirthed mid-sentence again. This time you find yourself strapped into a metal frame. Thick plates of metal slide into place, sealing you in a pitch black, tiny tube. You're being orbital dropped.

The G-force hits as the drop pod is released. The seat shakes violently as you plummet towards the ground below. At the last moment, the rockets kick in, braking the pod just as it slams into the earth. The pod opens like a blossoming flower, disgorging you into the heat of battle. Tracer fire whizzes overhead, and tank shells explode mere metres from your location.

Out in the open, exposed, you suddenly wish you had your cloak back again. You sprint for the nearest cover, a stunted, alien bush growing in the shadow of a boulder, diving beneath the dense foliage just as your drop pod is blasted into shrapnel.

As you peer out from your hiding place, your stomach drops. They haven't dropped you into friendly territory, or even into a Vanu battle. TR infantry clash with NC. Hundreds of tanks race across open ground, exchanging fire, with you stuck right slap bang in the middle.

You almost jump out of your spandex as the voice of command speaks in your ear once more, "Prototype TXF47 is the latest in chameleon camouflage, utilizing reconstructive nanite technology to disguise soldiers in battle. The effects are undetectable to both darklight and all known forms of scanning equipment, and will allow infiltrators to walk in the very midst of our enemies without detection. To adopt a disguise, the prototype must be activated while in contact with an object."

A camouflage kit? Neat. You press yourself into the yellow-red auraxium dirt and activate the device by touching your hand to the slot in your chest. Instantly you feel a prickly wave of nanites swarm out from your chest to envelop your body. Your tight-fitting bodysuit is broken down to its elemental components and reformed, and as the nanite swarm retreats your find yourself clothed not in spandex and metal, but in rock and dirt. From head to foot, your skin has the exact colour and texture of the yellow-red dirt beneath you. There are even scraps of vegetation growing from your rock encrusted body.

You lay there for a while, admiring how your body blends perfectly into the landscape, until you hear the rumble of tank treads. You scramble out from beneath the bush just in time. An NC Vanguard rolls over it.

There goes your cover. Now you're stuck out in the open, momentarily hidden by the cloud of dust kicked up by the Vanguard. Better hope this camo works. You lie flat, not daring to move, as the bulky blue-and-yellow forms of NC infantry storm past, their heavy boots thudding inches from your face. Yet none of them see you.

This is fantastic. This is even better than optic camo. I could - hrggh.

A steel-shod boot thuds into your ribs and an NC medic trips over your prone form, falling hard in the dirt, swearing. "God damnit," she snarls, brushing red dust from her armour as she picks herself up. "Those suits better cut me two bonus cheques for this. Stupid rock," she growls, kicking the offending "rock" hard.

You bite your tongue to quench the yell of pain...
135332331.title: Advanced Infiltration Disguise

choices: Attempt to take the place of Sara for the time being
1353323312.content:
but it's no use. Her kick knocks the air out of your lungs in a pained whimper. In an instant, she is reaching for the pistol at her side. Shit, she sees you!

You leap up, barreling into her chest, knocking the gun from her hand and her feet out from under her. On top of her, you whip the force blade from your hip and drive it towards her chest. She grabs your wrist, the blade halting inches from her heart.

"R-rock monster!" she screams. "Wait, Vanu?! The hell? This isn't even your fight!"

"Tell me about it," you reply through your mask. She is strong but your position is better, and you overpower her, driving the knife into her chest. She looks more annoyed than afraid, as blood spurts across her uniform. She grabs your shoulder in a death grip, pulling you closer, burbling through a mouth filling with blood, "I'm coming back for you, Vanu. Very soon."

As the last of her life slips away, she thumps you weakly on the chest. The prototype flickers into life, disgorging its payload of reconstructive nanites before you can stop it. They swarm over you, and over the thing you're touching - the dead body of the NC woman.

You feel the painful sting of the nanites over every part of your skin. Not only are they eating away at your armour and helmet, they're seem to be stripping away the upper layer of your skin. You feel stabs of pain across your chest as nanite tendrils worm into your flesh. Your helmet disintegrates from around your head, and you feel the nanites inside your lungs as you suck in air. They're inside your organs, tearing you apart into your base molecules. A high scream of pain escapes your lips, and you fall back on to the desert floor, limbs spasming.

Suddenly, the nanites halt and flow back into the prototype device, which falls from your chest into the sand. Weakly, you sit up. Your body feels... off... Alien.

"What on Auraxis..." You stare at your hands. The spandex is gone. Your hands are wrapped in brown leather gloves. Dirty, loose-fitting khaki material covers your arms, and a bulky blue shield generator rests awkwardly on your upper chest over a crude ballistic vest. It sits awkwardly, its weight cumbersome. Khaki combat fatigues and steel-shod boots cover your legs.

A glance at the insignia on the shoulder pads confirms it. The camo device has given you an NC uniform, mimicked from the soldier you killed. Not bad. Not bad at all. A thick, sun-visor obscures your vision, and you lift your new helmet away from your head. As you thought, the red and white symbol of the medic adorns the helmet, just like the woman lying dead at your feet.

The cold noon wind blows through your hair, and a few strands of long, brown hair blow in front of your eyes. You grab them between your gloved fingers. This isn't right. You have blonde hair, not brown.

Your heart begins to beat faster. Surely it couldn't have... You tear away the gloves. The skin of your hands is deep brown, far from the pallid complexion developed from months inside your full-body suit. You grab the chestpiece, worming the cumbersome armour over your head, and tearing open the ballistic vest.

Your bare breasts greet the chill desert wind. Stunned, your hands reach inside the combat fatigues, finding only a warm slit where your male member should be. You're a black New Conglomerate female medic, identical in all ways to the woman bleeding out in the sand, save for the mortal wound, thank Vanu. The nanites have been thorough. Not only is your armour and appearance hers, your weapons too. The recon device at your hip is now a medical applicator. Neither has your coms device been spared. Gone are the reassuring, grandfatherly tones of Vanu command. Instead the orders and war cries of trigger happy NC fill your ears.

Replacing the helmet, the HUD reappears in your vision. The radar draws your attention - five NC signatures are closing in on your position. Their footfalls grow closer.

Your radio crackles into life. "Sara, do you read me? Are you okay? The team is coming to you, stay where you are."

Shit. In about ten seconds, they're going to crest the hill and see you standing over the body of their fallen comrade. NC uniform or not, you're going to have a hard time explaining the situation, and why you so perfectly resemble the dead woman. You have no fear of death, not anymore, not after so many rebirths, but what worries you is that if they capture you, the existence of the TXF47 prototype will be exposed. That is something you can't allow to happen.

13533322221111.content:
It was a nice summer afternoon in the Wright and Co. Law Office, and Phoenix was going through storage boxes in the back room. It had once been Mia's personal office, and due to what had occurred in the room, Phoenix had been avoiding it for several years. But after taking care of all the lingering things holding Mia to his Earth, Phoenix felt like he was able to clean it out and start using the room again. Most of what he'd found so far was case files, but now he was digging through a box labeled "Kurain". Most of it was old robes and magatamas and stuff like that, but at the very bottom was an ancient parchment scroll with a piece of printed paper right next to it. Phoenix grabbed the scroll, feeling a warmth pass from it to him for a moment, then read the letter.

"I found this scroll back at home, hidden in a secret compartment in the Fey family home. I felt as though it passed something onto me as a touched it, and I spent years finding the language it was written in. It was Khura'inese, confirming an old suspicion I'd had that my family had immigrated to Japan from the rarely heard of Asian nation. The scroll offers a powerful ability to all who touch it, regardless of their spiritual ability. They can channel the dead, like any Fey medium, but not completely. They gain the body of the target, but it's incomplete somehow. I don't think anyone should know this exists, but maybe I'm wrong. Phoenix, if you read this, try it out, see for yourself. At the very least, it should thumb the nose at those village elders."
13533322221111.title: Phoenix Wright, New Medium

Phoenix's mind boggled as he finished the letter. His immediate instinct was to doubt that this could be true, but the scroll had given him that feeling when he touched it, and this was Mia's writing style. But what did she mean by 'incomplete'? Should he really give this a try? What he didn't realize was, as he was thinking all of this, he was picturing Mia a lot in his mind, and his body began changing without him noticing. A new pair of breasts, a new set of genitalia, and a beauty mark on one cheek. In less than a minute, Phoenix had completely transformed into Mia Fey.

He realized what had happened...he'd channeled his late mentor! But that couldn't be, he was still thinking like himself...was that what she meant by 'incomplete'? Just the body, but no memories? Feeling a little uncomfortable in a very feminine body, Phoenix concentrated on his old body, on turning back, but when he opened his eyes nothing had changed. Letting out a breathy sigh, Phoenix realized that until further notice he was stuck like this. Looking back to the mirror, he knew that it wouldn't look right to walk around in a suit this baggy, it looked awful on him. He didn't even notice how odd that thought was, how unlike him it was. Instead, he thought of options. It was a good thing he'd been sorting through these boxes, he'd already found another set of Mia's work clothes (though they looked like they were the kind she'd been wearing when they first met), some casual clothes, and her medium robes. What to wear?

As Ginny pulled back, she saw the tears swimming in the eyes of her bride. Oddly she felt better, she felt right, a completeness she'd never felt before. A sense of purpose, of having someone to protect, and the strength... and the body to do it. She was almost eager for the disguise ring to lose it's power, so that she could show her Jerry once more. This masquerading as Harry was fun, but it was unsettling to take in his bride, and see the face from the mirror looking back at her, the adoration on her face. But also not her face.

Before risking becoming any more confused, and unsettled, she turned and left. The sound of his feet as he descended the stairs made Harry feel alone. It harped back to those long years under the stairs, serving as a barely acknowledged servant to the Dursleys. Raising a hand to her bosom, she felt her heart racing.

This was an final end to that chapter of her life. A book she sincerely wanted to close. They had given her a home, and protection, however grudging. Her life had opened up, at Hagrid's arrival, at Hagrid's announcement.

"Yer, a wizard, Harry."

His gruff certainty, opened his eyes to hope, to freedom, to a whole new world. Despite the pain, the fear, the trials he'd faced, the Dursley's had kept him grounded. They'd never treated him as the wizard who vanquished Voldemort. She found herself nodding, she really must thank them for that.

Dabbing her eyes, and smoothing out imaginary wrinkles from the dress, she set off downstairs.

The day passed like a dream, every face lit up as she passed, brightening her smile in return. There wasn't one person there, she regretted coming. Arthur Weasley holding her arm, as they walked up the aisle. The flashing of the camera. The knowing smile of Luna, as she swept past the former Ravenclaw's seat.

However for Harry, it was tempting, but nobody, but nobody would look at his grades. It was rare for people to react to anything more than his name.
