141112211112212331223123113121231321311.content:
As soon as they walked into the courtyard, Harry felt the same feelings of safety and being home, that he always associated with Hogwarts. Lizzy's whole body language eased, and her manner was easier. Even Jerry picked up on this. It was a source of endless amusement to Ginny that Harry found Hogwarts such a balm.

She'd tease him about which was his most relaxing year. The year he discovered the Dark Lord, who tried to kill him. Or the year, he thought his Godfather was a killer, and wanted to kill him... On and on her teasing went, (although usually gentle and well intentioned). Harry took it on the chin. He was just glad to have someone who saw his as a human being, flawed but capable of love.

"Greetings, visitors."

An instinctive, nervous, guilty shiver raced down Lizzy's spine as she heard that voice. It was older, perhaps more care-worn, but still stridently Scottish. As feelings of forgotten homework, and stories just short of lies filled her thoughts. She tightened her grip on Jerry's strong comforting hand.

There was a round of applause from some of the visitors, as the cat languidly resting on the edge of the fountain morphed into the familiar teacher... now Head.

Lizzy glanced to her partner, Jerry was smiling broadly, as Ginny hadn't picked up Ron's study habits, or those of Fred or George such as they were. She'd been studious as Percy, but grounded like Charlie, in contact with her passions.

"Welcome to Hogwarts, I am Minerva McGongall, the Headmistress."

She gave them a respectful nod of her severe head.

"I will show you around the main points of interest of the castle, and after lunch, leave you free to explore at your leisure."

An excited murmur rippled through the visitors, as they whispered their reasons for coming.

"Can you tell us about...."

The voice was timid, and tapered off into silence.

"Yes. Hogwarts has a long and illustrious history, although recent years have seen their share of pain." Taking a deep breath she continued, "It has served as the cradle to a variety students who went on to achieve greatness in the wider wizarding world. Many of whom were Gryffindors."

Without further introduction, she walked towards the heavy castle doors.

"I hope you have on comfortable shoes, as there's a lot of walking."

Now, that was the tone that Lizzy recognised.

They entered the castle, as the Headmistress pointed out, the great stone statues that fought to defend the school and pupils. Their battle scars largely repaired. Lizzy ran her palm over one figure. It upset her, that magic that could perfectly repair the physical, still left so much emotional, so much mental pain and scarring untouched. They looked fine, but ... Lizzy dismissed the thought.

The group passed immense tapestries, and certain portraits introduced themselves. Almost at random, Minerva would have to warn them about trick steps, and of course warn them about the poltergeist Peeves.

Lizzy thought that Peeves had mellowed over time, finding a purpose for his boredom, an outlet for his frustration in the battle of Hogwarts. But she'd never spoil the spectre's reputation.

The stairs shifted and twisted. Although, Lizzy felt even they were being more obliging to the Headmistress, than she expected. As they headed up the Astronomy Tower, Lizzy felt her footsteps become more leaden. It was the height, she just was getting swamped with memories. Minerva was moving with a sprightly step, eager to show off the magnifcent view over the Loch, and down the Glen. The angle even made it easier to see the monster in the water.

But for Harry it would always be... where Dumbledore fell. Even now, it was complicated for her. It's meaning changing with time, and knowlege. No longer was it where Snape betrayed Dumbledore... No longer even where Dumbledore was murdered. The price of destroying that Horcrux, had already fatally marked the Headmaster.

She felt Jerry wipe away a tear racing down her cheek. She hadn't realised she was crying.

"We can stop. I'll say I'm tired..." Jerry offered quietly.

"No... No... I'll be okay." her voice gaining strength as she spoke. Through a narrow window, the Sun peeked, and the pale blue sky tempted her higher... the view would be magnificent.

It was.

The Headmistress pointed out the local landmarks, including a point on a hill where 'Snuffles' had hidden. She pointed out the Quidditch pitch, and where the labyrinth had been for the Triwizard tournament. The Forbidden Forest, listing off a wide variety of it's inhabitants. Lizzy smiled, when she even mentioned the Cabin for the groundskeeper, in passing. Finally she told the group, this was where Dumbledore was killed. Leading the group in a profound minute's silence for her friend.

The walk back down was more subdued, her stomach rumbled quietly, and she realised that soon the tour would be over.

Professor McGonagall still had a few surprises left though.

"Crumbly Shortbread."

The gryphon statue turned on it's base, revealing a short stairway leading up to her office. It was barely large enough for everyone. Lizzy took in all the changes. There was an old Quidditch broom mounted proudly on the wall, and a dark green tartan banner. Out of the way, up against the wall, Lizzy recognised a perch, the perch for a very particular Phoenix. Jerry spotted it too. They exchanged a look, a memory, no words were needed.

"Are these all headmasters..?" one man dressed in a green cape asked. His arm sweeping an entire wall of pictures.

Before she could confirm, "Is that Snape?" a voice asked, cold contempt dripping from the question.

"That's Professor Snape." Lizzy said with surprising passion.

Minerva's eyebrow quirked up, in pleasure and agreement.

"There has been much confusion about my colleague, and friend's deeds and loyalties." her voice trembling. It wasn't age, though. Nor was age making her shoulders tremble either. Harry recognised it, instinctively taking a step back. This was suppressed rage. No... Not rage, frustration.

Her shoulders fell, it wasn't their fault... It wasn't anybody's fault. Although the Daily Prophet needed a stern letter against mud-slinging. Mentally Minerva set aside time for that.

1411122111122123312231231131212313213111.content:
Minerva had been about to correct the visitor herself. But the passion of .. Lizabeth put her on a back foot. It's was spoken with such restrained anger, and almost sounded like someone trying to do an impression of Albus Dumbledore.

Intently she focused on her cluttered desk, and the mounds of work piled there. However, she was entirely focused on listening to her -so- knowledgeable visitor. Her eyes darted towards Lizzy, and saw the supportive way her partner was holding her hand. It was always nice to see newly-weds visiting the castle. After all, as the best magical school in the country, it was very popular.

There was a slightly frosty look on the other woman's face. Her jaw was firmly closed, as she bit back an angry retort. Professor Snape was a controversial figure, with even the Daily Prophet being cagey about his alliances and deeds.

From the frame, even the portrait looked a little startled at being defended. Although, the change of expression was minimal, a former student would be capable of reading the slightly wider eyes, and the curiosity replacing the strain in his mouth.

Jerry snuggled in close behind Lizzy as she started talking. The warmth, the proximity of his body providing her with comfort against the painful memories.

She started with the hardest details. The petty acts of vengeance, the bullying of Neville Longbottom, Harry Potter, and most Gryffindors. These acts were unfortunately widely known, and beyond dispute. The stories from Slytherin students sending them far and wide long before his 'so-called' redemption.

Minerva's smile tightened, as she wanted to defend her friend. A tear came to the corner of one eye, as she knew the facts herself.

Lizzy then moved on to the more disputed events, the events where the Daily Prophet had liked to speculate. Her eyes were no longer focused in the room, instead wandering through her memories. She told the room of the troll in the dungeon. She told them of Harry's challenges, his steadfast friends. She told them of Harry's surprise at discovering Quirrell.

The room held it's collective breath as Lizzy told them about the basilisk, about Fawkes and rescuing Ginny. She told them how Harry freed Dobby, and of SPEW. Her breath caught and her story faltered, at Dobby's name.

Taking a deep drink of water, she moved on.

She spoke of Harry's struggle for the truth, about who Sirius Black was, about what he had done. Her eyes sparkled as she spoke of the confrontation in the Shrieking Shack, and when the curse broke free. She made sure the room knew which professor had stood between the werewolf and the students, ready to die in their defence. She was rather more reticent about other events, omitting entirely the saving of Buckbeak, and the rescue of the accused.

As Lizzy's voice croaked, she smiled to Jerry, and took a seat.

Jerry continued the story, telling proudly what he could about Snape's double-dealings. With a side-ways glance, she also mentioned Harry's own doubts regarding the integrity of that particular professor. He gushed rather effusively about the trials, especially the first, the combat against a dragon. An odd irritated tone came to Jerry's voice when he mentioned the other competitors, especially, for some reason, Fleur Delacour.

His tone softened, as he described the final challenge, and the return of the two Hogwarts students to the castle. As she paused, the whole room, lowered their heads simultaneously, unbidden for a moment's silent respect for Cedric Diggory.

When he continued, he made mention of the Daily Prophet's rather flexible interpretation of the facts, it's dismissal of Dumbledore and Potter, and it's puppy-like eagerness to follow the Ministry's line.

Jerry had heard the rest from Harry, the impossible demands put upon him by Dumbledore, the eternal peril of trying to deceive an expert in legilimency. Especially one so prone to violence. But he was also aware of how sensitive he was.

He rounded off his story fiercely defending Severus Snape, as one of the loyalest and bravest men he had ever known. Nobody noticed, as mutely Lizzy nodded her absolute agreement with that sentiment.

Minerva had long given up the pretence of working. Her eyebrow quirked up, as she reached a few conclusions. The tear in her eyes were rare but intimate and severe.

As if a spell was broken, Jerry stepped back to join his wife.

"Well... I mean.... That's what I heard.." he finished, a little unconvincingly.

Professor McGonagall clapped her hands, and stood up, "Well, it's now the perfect time for your meal, in the Great Hall. After which, feel free to roam the castle on your own. If you get lost or have any difficulties, the portraits and ghosts will be more than happy to help." she snorted softly and smiled, "excepting Peeves.".

Stripped of its Dementor wardens since the fall of the Dark Lord, Azkaban was no longer the inescapable prison it had once been. It was nearly a year since the sibling Death Eaters had escaped Azkaban together, a year of running and hiding, forced to disguise and live among muggles to survive.

Together they had vowed to avenge the Dark Lord. Impatiently they had waited for a chance to strike back at him, but the boy was well protected, surrounded by Aurors and friends, skilled veterans of the second wizarding war. Killing him would be impossible unless he could be separated from his friends. Tonight, on the eve of his wedding, an opportunity had emerged. By morning, Harry Potter would have lost everything he held dear.

Alecto Carrow, "Suzie", lead the boy backstage. Feigning giddy excitement, the Death Eater stripped Harry of the remainder of his clothes. Her slim fingers were shaking as she tore away the boy's boxers. He stood there, wandless, utterly naked, defenseless, and she savoured the situation. She could kill him now if she so wished. But no. It was the Christmas holidays. Harry and Hermione sat in the Great Hall, huddled in warm coats before the log fire as snow drifted gently from the enchanted cealing and settled on the four long tables. They were playing wizards chess, although as it was their eigth game of the day they weren't playing it with particular enthusiasm; Harry in particular, who had lost all but one of the games.

It was the day before Christmas eve and the castle was all but empty of students. Hermione had kindly stayed behind to keep Harry company through the lonely days. Mostly they played games of wizards chess, but even the violent-brawl-in-miniature was starting to lose its appeal.

Harry barely noticed as Hermione's queen brutally decapitated his King. "How about we make the next game the last, Hermione?"

"Okay," hermione agreed, as she reset the pieces. "Actually I was wondering if you want to make a little bet to make it more interesting," she said, with an unusually sly look in her eyes. "I've been trying to practice my transfiguration spells but it's hard without an... assistant. If you win, you have to help me with my transfiguration."

"And if I win?" Harry asked, aware to himself that it was largely hypothetical.

"I'll make you a special Christmas present," Herminone smiled.

"Sure," Harry shrughed.

Nothing happened. "Accio chess piece," she optioned. His tiny form popped out from between two flagstones and into her hand. Her sigh of relief steamed in the frosty air.

With mixed feelings, she had to admit, as she turned him round in her mittened hand, that her spell had worked. He resembled his counterpart on the chess board perfectly - a small stone Queen piece, identical even down to the centuries of chips and cracks and wear from thousands of hands that had all but erased the original's facial features.

And like all Wizard Chess pieces, it could move. It examined itself slowly, the miniature stone arms exploring up the carved body until they reached the eroded face with horror. A guilty weight filled her stomach.

"Sorry, Harry. I'll get you back to normal right away! Just as soon as I figure out how."

She set the Chess Piece That Lived on the table, far away from the other, more-mundane pieces, and flicked hurriedly through her transfiguration book for reversal charms.

Rather angrily stomping over to Harriet, she swung her hands out from behind her back.

"There." she snarled, "I don't know how you did it... But that's your egg."

She thrust the enormous fabergé egg into Harriet's startled and disbelieving hands. She was just as confused, her lips half-open, a natural and alluring pout on her face.

"It apparated at my feet. But we have to go to Dumbledore, because something is definitely not right." she insisted.

"I've said that since my name came out." insisted Harriet.

She turned towards Ron, thrusting the egg into her startled hands. "And I didn't put it in myself. Do you think I want to be incinerated?"

"Sorry, Harry... of course not." Ron managed to squeak the words out.

"Fleur, I know I can trust you. But I didn't apparate that egg. There's still someone out there, ensuring I stay in this bloody contest."

She shrugged, "Perhaps Dumbledore can get a clue from this thing."

The four of them walked down a couple of corridors, and found a fresh draught coming round the bend. In a few steps they were out the carriage, and looking up at the imposing walls of Hogwarts.

Ron looked a little disappointed, that he was still a Beauxbatons girls, head to toe. Even with her ginger hair, she looked distinctly different. Harriet had check out her reflection at times, and knew that she looked nothing like Harry Potter. She looked as feminine and girly as Fleur, and however intently she stared, there wasn't a hint of a scar on her forehead.

Only Hermione looked the same, at least physically. With the blue uniform brightening her smile when she relaxed enough to smile.

It was certainly a different experience walking the halls like this. Almost like a different kind of invisibility cloak. The girls glanced at her, and quickly, often sniffily, looked away. The boys were oblivious to her, or at least her face.

Harry would have given 10 galleons to be invisible to one more boy. As Cormac came up and stopped in front of the four of them.

"Do you.. I mean, have you got.... Can I take you to the Yule Ball?" his voice cracking as he finished asking Harry.

Harriet shrieked 'No!', and barged passed. Unfortunately, she wasn't as hefty and, her bust crashed against his arm, and she fell to the floor her arms flying. The bounce and ripple from her bosom was tremendous, and drew Cormac's eyes, hypnotically holding them.

He looked torn between fleeing the shrieking girl, and his obvious staring, and helping her to her feet.

"That wasn't very polite." Fleur interrupted, "She is terribly flattered, but alas she is spoken for."

Cormac nodded his head, swallowed, and left as quickly as he could. They all heard his running feet, once he rounded the corner.

"I suppose, this is your way out of asking someone to the ball." Hermione said a little huffily.

Harriet dusted off the worst damage from her uniform, and Ron glowered at the floor, embarrassed by the truth of Hermione's accusation. He just didn't feel confident enough to ask anyone to go. Even though Fred and George had done it in a second.

The outline of Snape's legs shifted, becoming smoother and rounder.

Gesturing to herself, Harry wasn't feeling as sympathetic towards Hermione as he might have been in other circumstances. Taking some clothes from the Trunk at the foot of her bed, Harry dressed herself. Both wishing to do it with her eyes closed for her own modesty, and Hermione's dignity.

But, as she finished smoothing the imagined wrinkles from her skirt, she looked across the room. Hermione had bitten the bullet and dressed for breakfast. However, her version of the school uniform was rather more risque. Her skirt several inches shorter, her jumper and blouse just too tight, clinging to her curves.

Harry noticed that she was bustier, and curvier than her friend, but at the same time looked less so, against Hermione's more revealing clothes. Hell, even her shoes had a higher heel. As he closed the Trunk, Harry failed to notice his name etched into the wood. 'Harriet Jane Potter', with a shared tight nod of their heads, the pair headed down to breakfast.

Both girls wanting their skirts to be longer, and their identities to be less well-known through out the school. There was a pensive look on Hermione's face as they left the dorm. Both girls walked through the common room, with a spring in their step not wanting to draw the experience out for longer than necessary.

But, they managed it without any bother, without any more than a few customary hellos, and friendly nods or smiles.

Exiting from the Fat Lady's portrait, Harry thought Hermione looked more concerned. Keeping her own head low, she avoided all eye-contact. However, it was quickly clear that they weren't going a direct route to the Grand Hall, and breakfast.

With a whispered hiss to Hermione, she asked what was going on.

"I could be wrong... I don't want to say..."

It was hard for her to pick the right pace, as she felt the girls jostling if she went up and down stairs too quickly. Worse, she knew others were also noticing the movement, the boys eyes snapping to her blouse before she passed them.

Her bust once again proving troublesome, as Hermione stopped without warning. Harry crashed into her friend. Her bust swallowing Hermione's arm, in the deep cleavage.

A nod of Hermione's head, directed Harry's attention to the Trophy cabinet. The various shields standing proudly on the glass shelves, polished to a mirror shine. Her expression was tight lipped as she got Harry to read the names on one shield.

'Harriet Jane Potter: Seeker'

Harry's mouth dropped open in disbelief. "The magic hasn't just made you fit to visit the girls' dorm. I think it's altered you history...."

Her words trailed off, as Harry's mouth gaped. Opening and closing, silently, like a confused goldfish, unable to say any coherent thought, or phrase any question.

Harry snuggled into the overstuffed chair as she turned the pages. Starting was a bit difficult at first — the dull prose nearly put her to sleep, and whenever she leaned back to nap, the swell of her bust obscured the slumber-inducing book. But she found a rhythm, and soon each paragraph had her rapt with attention.

Occasionally she would find a particular passage of note and dogear the page, making a mental note to tell Ron about it later. Unbeknownst to her though, Ron was constructing small animals out of the unlimited paper supply she had access to, enchanting them to move with greater aptitude than she had demonstrated earlier...

It was an hour later and the one-hundred-and-twentieth page that gave her pause, though. Her eyes flitted across the text: 'The four Founders all made peace with Separate Creatures of their Realm, and enlisted their help in construction. It was Rowena Ravenclaw who...' "Enlisted the help of Pixies to lay a glamour!" Harry finished out loud, a proud smile displaying her triumph. It had been such a long time since she had... Wait, had it?

The smile melted away from her face as connections formed in her head. Harry had never read that book, but Hermione...

Panicking, she shot straight up, a wince and half an outstretched hand at the book laying spine-up on the floor before the Harry side quashed any literary sympathy.

"RON!" She cried out, her voice made shrill by dread. After a few seconds longer than what should have been normal, a shock of frizzy brown hair popped up from the other chair, sending a flock of origami swans flying.

"I think it's happening faster, Ron!" Harry fretted. Her hands worried at the hem of her skirt, a nervous tic that Hermione had oft engaged in before a particularly stressful test.

Ron strode over to Harry and rested a hand on Harry's shoulders, a gesture that would have been more comforting were they not the exact same height at the time.

"Don't worry, Herm— er, Harry. It's only going to last a day at most, yeah?" She waved her hand at the menagerie of animals he had assembled.

"So we're a little better at charms for a day, who cares?" A languid shrug was all the care she seemed to give to the pressing matter — a much different attitude from earlier.

"You don't understand, Ron!" Harry shouted, feeling tears of frustration prick at his eyes. "I read the book, and, and — I remembered it!"

Even Ron could grasp the gravity of this issue — neither of them had even gone near A History of Hogwarts before.

"What're we going to do then, Harry?" Ron's voice was starting to gain an edge of fear.

Harry simply grabbed Ron's hand and ran out the door, heading to their best bet, ____.

With a -whuff- of displaced air, Dobby returns moments later. Harry hearing the words "... can't apparate within..." spilling into the room, as Hermione arrives.

A queasy look on her face, Hermione doubles over, clutching her unsettled stomach as she arrived. Steadying herself with a hand on Dobby's head, she wasn't really aware of anyone else.

"This way, Mistress Hermione." Dobby offered her a long-fingered hand leading her to a comfy arm chair. Head pounding, her hand to her brow. She heard more than saw her friends come to her side

Head sinking into her hands, for Hermione the room still spinning and twisting. She muttered, "So, what did Ron, and Harry do then, Dobby?"

Her tone suggesting she wasn't in the best of moods.

For explanation Dobby stepped back, withdrawing the damp cloth, he'd just summoned from her forehead. He gestured, with wide arms to either side. A flick of his hands introducing Harry on one side, and Ron at her other shoulder.

She squinted in confusion at first, frustration on her features. Moments later that was displaced by a cold rage.

"Ron." she snarled. A timid bob of her head nodding yes.

"and Harry." her voice calmer, but colder, and perhaps still as furious.

He gave an awkward smile, a shrug and gestured to her doppelganger body.
1411322221312243.title: It's only moments later, as Dobby returns.

choices: She discovers a gender change spell.
She sees a complex potion that does what she wants.
Harry quietly walks up, and sees what she is researching.
1412.content:
Hermione enjoyed the company of both Ron and Harry, but there was always the difference that felt the weirdest. Especially after meeting them on the train when she was so young. But deep down she wondered if they would be better friends or closer friends if they were all boys together.

With her exams being over, she knew about the Polyjuice potion was used by some on Hen nights and Stag Do's. However, she was interested in a gender change while still keeping her own identity.

She found a range of spells that would enhance a woman's beauty or a man's ruggedness. However, she did recall how Ron blushed when she mentioned it even obliquely.

As both herself, and Harry were from non-wizarding backgrounds, she liked how he reacted.
1412.title: Hermione

choices: She spotted an obscure spell book.
Extendible Ears, A Weasley Whizz invention, Patent Pending.
She wasn't sure what it was, but it demanded her attention.
14121.content:
Hermione had overheard the details of Harry's party, when she was visiting 'The Burrows'. She had always enjoyed a good friendship with the boys. But. But she was always a little separate, a little apart. Ron told her half-jokingly that it was because she was such a buzz kill. Always ready to pour a dampener on proceedings.

But she knew it was (at least partially) because she was a girl. There would be an rising voice, as Ron or Harry started going off on a tangent. Then with a sly glance over to Hermione, the conversation would tail off, with the boys descending into mock coughs and changing the subject entirely.

She felt especially slighted when she was 'sent' to the Kitchen with Ginny, and Molly while the boys made their plans. Hermione for all her gifts was a hazard in the kitchen, even the simplest of task seemed to end in chaos. Ginny and Molly assured her it was because she wasn't used to a magical kitchen, Hermione knew when she was being put aside. She fancied clearing her head, and a dose of healthy fresh air looked like the best option.

Mr. Weasley was in the garden, and working to clear out the gnomes again. With a sigh, she headed into the living room. She liked Mr. Weasley, but my God, when he started asking questions about muggle ways, he never stopped.

Her nature drew her to the bookshelf, but it was one thing that caught her attention.
14121.title: She discovers a gender change spell.

choices: She tore a page from the book.
She tucked the book away, she wanted to... needed to study it.
Ginny brings her through a cup of tea.
141211.content:
Hermione picked it off the shelf, and with a quick look around she raised it to her face and inhaled. She loved the aroma of musty old books, and knew the boys would tease her if they ever found out. She quickly regretted it as she started to wheeze, the book was very dusty.

'Transfigurations: A series of Experiments.'

She ran one finger over the gold embossed title, wiping away the accumulated dirt. The name had faded too much to be read, but it had her attention. She curled up in front of the fire, a blanket across her lap, and Crookshanks on top of that.

When her cat started to cutely snore, she knew she was in for the long haul. She was not the sort of monster who would disturb a sleeping cat.

Hermione found it to be intriguing. It reminded her of Harry's potion book, and felt like it was written by someone with a real insight into transformations and transfigurations. She wondered how it ended up here. It was hard not to be dismissive, as she looked around the ramshackle, but homely house.

Reminding herself, it was rude to make such judgements, and that she was a guest. She dismissed the uncertainty, as just a thing that an old wizarding family picked up.

She found a whole range of spells, including a whole... well, ceremony... rite?.... to help a wizard or witch to become an animagus. It came with a worryingly long list of warnings, but she filed it away mentally.

On page 56, she found a gender reversal spell. She read it twice to be sure, as polyjuice, and other such potions were generally considered the simplest way to perform a transfiguration. The risks of miscasting a spell, could lead to rather horrific results, and formed the basis of some legendary creatures, according to her History Professor.

Sadly she thought of Professor Snape. He had been incredibly proud of his prowess with potions. Understandably so, and when she discovered he was the half-blood prince, he went up in her estimation.

A smile crossed Hermione's face, as she realised that the twins had obviously never spotted this... this treasure trove of spells.
141211.title: She spotted an obscure spell book.

choices: The girls quietly finish their tea.
Inside her bag, the book starts to glow ominously.
Ginny changes the topic of conversation.
1412113.content:
Hermione packed the book away when she heard Ginny approach. She knew she shouldn't but some instinct told her it was the right thing to do.

"A nice cup of tea, for our politest guest." Ginny said as she offered the cup to her friend.

Looking for a quiet chat, Ginny sat down opposite, and sipped at her own cup.

"My brothers tell me you're working on a new spell." she asked.

"For tea.." she prompted when Hermione looked blankly at her.

The pieces fell into place, and Hermione was left trying to work out how to preserve some dignity, for herself and others. This was a joke she'd shared with Harry. It was a Christmas break, and she'd been enjoying a nice cup of Hot Chocolate, when Ron had arrived with a blanket. The memory made her smile, he had a such a soft side.

Unfortunately, in the confusion Ron got the wrong end of a dull conversation. Later when Hermione wanted to fix things, well clear them up, he'd already proudly told his brothers, (and worse) his father of her new magic artefact.

"Thermos."

Ron had tried pronouncing the spell a number of different ways, but nothing ever worked. If Mr. Weasley ever worked out it was a muggle thing rather than magical, she'd have to spend the entire day with him. He was a sweet man, but rather ...mmmm... magical in his understanding.

"It's probably tricky to get the sounds just right." she finally said, cautiously.

"I might supply them myself with it." she added encouragingly.
1412113.title: Ginny brings her through a cup of tea.

choices: In bed that night, in the Burrow, Hermione reads intently.
A puff of blue white smoke emerges from the garage.
Hermione tries to work out, who she'd like to switch genders.
14121131.content:
Apparently Ginny's time with Harry was paying dividends, or something from Muggle Studies stayed with her.

"Thermos." she repeated, in a more quizzical tone.

Either Hermione's smile was too big, or Ginny simply worked it out, but she too smiled, and chinking their tea cups against one another added, "Well, it'll keep them busy for a while."

Ginny's smile vanishing as she raised the cup to her lips. The prankster sense was strong in the Weasley DNA apparently. Hermione's sense of guilt at the thought of the Weasleys' being crammed into their own garage trying to replicate her magical artefact, well, it evaporated. The girls were also sure that Molly appreciated having them out from under her feet.

"Boys." Ginny snorted with amusement, but without malice as she lowered her cup.

"Yeah, they can be entertaining."

Hermione took the opportunity to probe Ginny about Poly-juice, and her own problem with Millicent Bullstrode's cat. The pair chatted idly for a while, before she brought up the idea of a gender-change poly-juice. Just curiosity, obviously. But coming from two muggle parents, she was interested in knowing if those raised by a witch and a wizard were more .... experimental.

Leaning closer, so as not to be overheard, Hermione listened intently for Ginny's answer. The pause in the conversation felt like enough of an answer to her, but she was eager for more details.

Her head darting to every door and window, Ginny checked she wasn't being observed or overheard, before she too leaned towards Hermione.

"But, at one dinner there was an awkward conversation at the table. A joke about me being the first Weasley daughter to go to school. Fred and George exchanged amused looks and a silence fell across the whole house."

"So." pressed Hermione, "Did you see Freya or Georgina?" she asked eager for every salacious detail.

"I don't think they were experimenting on themselves at that point... but I can't be sure even of that...."

"Yeah, but you saw the twins smile. You must have seen something else... an idea who was Molly's first daughter...."

"Well, I did try and winkle it out of them later. But, either they had received a firm warning from Mum, or perhaps the Ministry? But, I worked out, the spell lasted almost a week."

The two girls exchanged looks, as Hermione quickly reached the same conclusion.

"So, it wasn't polyjuice."

Ginny just shook her head in agreement, as she took another deep swallow of her tea.

Hermione eager for more, realised that Ginny didn't know any more, and thought that part of the conversation was over. She swallowed her frustration with another mouthful of tea, but she had a lot to consider. It certainly sounded like that old spell book was genuine.

Her first thoughts, had been to take away one of the divisions between them. As a swat, she wondered if Harry and Ron would find it easier if she were a Herman, rather than a Hermione. But a teasing thought at the back of her mind wondered how Ron would cope with being female. Or perhaps, with Malfoy's experience as a ferret, he should take a turn at being a witch.
14121131.title: The girls quietly finish their tea.

choices: Whirling around, Ron saw the door shrink away to nothing.
Ron was surrounded by pale statues covered in white sheets.
Ron sees himself reflected in an assortment of mirrors.
14131.content:
Ron was in a funk. Harry and Hermione were buried in books in the library, and that gave him time to be alone. Alas, that meant that he was thinking about his life and how average, and insignificant it was.

He was just another Weasley, not as studious as Bill, he was destined never to be a prefect. Just like Percy. He knew that for a fact, even without magic. He lacked Charlie's passion for magical creatures, a fire even Hagrid had noticed. Grinding his teeth, too at the fact that Charlie had also played Quidditch for Gryffindor. Just like the twins, just like him.

Hell, the twins, even though she might curse them loudly and frequently. Ron was sure that they were Molly's favourite. They had an easy charm, a laid-back manner and luck that meant that things just happened for them.

Harry had given them the money, but it was the twins who ran the business. Frankly that surprised the hell out of everyone else in the family.

Even Ginny, little Ginerva, well, she would be the first Weasley daughter to come to Hogwarts. He scuffed his feet as he walked along.

An afterthought, that was it. He was an afterthought, a hanger-on. Even with his friends, even Hermione and Harry, they liked him, he supposed, but he was just sort of there. Never the one with the breakthrough, never the one to lead.

OH God! He was the Gryffindor equivalent of Crabbe or Goyle. He sent a loose stone skidding across the passage in anger at the realisation.

"I can help..." a voice hissed on the breeze.

Instantly, Ron drew his wand. It was almost certainly Draco, had he been muttering, talking aloud.

"I can help..." the voice repeated, spectral and sibilant.

"Show yourself." Ron answered as bravely as he could. But he couldn't even pin down where the voice was coming from.

"Just through the door... on your left."

Ron tried the door.

"Your other left." is said in an amused tone.

Looking a little embarrassed, he went to the right door, and opened it. The room was unlit, with only a beam of light catching the dust from a small window, and the shape of the glass on the floor. He could almost make out shapes in the room, perhaps statues covered in cloth, or mirrors, but they looked fairly immobile.

"I can make you unique." the voice promised. Even now, he couldn't pin down the direction. It was clearer, and inside the room, but beyond that he simply couldn't tell.

"I'm not scared."

As he entered the door, the door wrenched itself from his grip, and slammed shut with a resounding oaken boom, shutting out the light from the corridor.

Lumos.

His wand bloomed into life, lighting up the whole room.
14131.title: Ron

choices: A small piece of parchment was revealed in the wand light.
Unsteadily getting to her feet, Ron looked for something to wear.
Ronni groaned, and tentatively felt the solid band around her neck.
Kicking at the floor, Ronni scuffed away the last of the chalk.
141312.content:
It took him only a second to realise it was his fellow students. Their movements too human, their enchanted coverings just a little too imperfect. However, the delay was just long enough.

"Stupefy."

The spell shooting from one of the hidden figures, robbed Ron of his consciousness. He didn't hear or feel it, as his head bounced with a sickening wet noise against the stone floor of the room.

In his dreams, he was taunted by fears of being average, of being forgotten, and overlooked. He worried about how obvious it was to his fellow students, that he was so gullible. The promising voice obviously someone who knew him, knew what he hated and feared.

- - - - -

Ron awoke in the dark room, the silence eerier than the tempting calls for exceptionalism. He groaned softly, as he rose to a sitting position. The cold stone making his bones ache, he wondered how long he was unconscious. Moments later, bending forward, blindly he scrambled for his wand.

Even Slytherins wouldn't steal a wand. The idea of relying on Slytherin integrity making his fingers scrape more harshly over the unlit floor. It was almost enough to make him miss the sense of wrongness coming from his body. Swallowing, he hummed to himself, testing his fear against his thoughts.

It sounded a little quavering, and worryingly a little high. He'd been transfigured into a witch. His thoughts oddly settling as he could now assume, it was his hair... -damn it- her hair tickling her shoulders, and not spider's web, that his imagination had been suggesting.

A soft wooden scrape, told her, when her fingers brushed against the abandoned wand on the floor. But with the sound to guide her she crawled towards the noise. The weight shifting on her chest, making her whimper and groan. She was a big girl, and that ass she felt, too, the wide hips, all added to her humiliation.

"Lumos."

The wand flared into life, allowing Ron to take in the damage. She scowled at her hands, painted in the Slytherin colours a further joke at her expense. With a clear view of her bust, she was still stunned by the size of the girls, mauling her nails deep into the humiliating tender flesh.

"Bye, Ron, Hello Ronni." was written in chalk, on the floor. Even that taunting joke was fading, in the wand glow.

https://66.media.tumblr.com/50b0485e8e5e...

Hell, she was the bustiest Weasley in the family. She knew that she'd get no sympathy from Fred or George, even if they helped to take revenge.
141312.title: Ron was surrounded by pale statues in sheets.

choices: It was Ginny, Hermione and worst of all Lavender Brown.
Ronni found herself facing the Pansy, Millicent & Daphne.
A metallic cacophony announced her squirming attempt at modesty.
Ronni groaned, realising he was in the Gryffindor girls side of the tower.
1413124.content:
It was disconcerting for Ron, to find her body so distracting. Her male perspective making her love the generous curves, and the toned muscles. Knowing it was only there to annoy, she still kicked angrily at the vanishing marks.

Her body jiggled and shook at the effort. The new centre of balance making her flail more than she'd have preferred, those wide hips, and that gorgeous fuller ass making her feel less than sure-footed. The damned inertia as her bust belatedly caught up, moving once she'd stopped.

Looking beyond her own body, Ronni realised she wasn't in the same room anymore. While she'd been unconscious, she'd been moved. She had no idea where she was in the castle. Who/What was on the other side of that door.

- - - - -

It was a hurried, harried whisper from the other side that sent Ronni looking for cover.

"Nox."

The tell-tale light wouldn't give her away. Instead, it was her collapsing into a clattering humiliating tangle, as she walked straight into a pile of cauldron... or whatever. The noise was deafening, and she was the epitome of graceless femininity, ass of display, tits swaying awkwardly, as the door was thrown open.

The silhouette of three witches pointing their wands directly at her. With nothing better, she gave them a weak wave, and an apologetic smile. Her eyes took a moment to adjust to the light, as her vision swam back into focus.
1413124.title: Kicking at the floor, Ronni scuffed away the la...

choices: Ronni gets taken to Madame Pomfrey, in the Infirmary.
She holds a hand to her pounding head.
She keeps them talking, needing answers.
Pain flares, as Ronni's mind floods with new memories.
14131241.content:
"Hey..." Ronni got to her feet, the cauldrons falling loudly to the floor, as she rose. Mortified, at being discovered by his sister, and Hermione as a witch, and even Lavender. It was hard to imagine her ever calling her Won-Won, again.

It took her a moment to realise, they weren't fazed by her new gender. Nor, were they concerned about the fact they were in dressing gowns, over their nightwear.

"Veronica Peaches Weasley." Ginny imitating her mother, was about to plant her fists on her hips. Her expression softened, as she took in the sprawled, splayed figure in front of her.

"C'mon sis." Ginny's weary words, and offered hand snapping her back to here and now. Hell, Hermione wasn't even paying attention to her. Her gaze was deeper, beyond her.

"You haven't abducted Neville again?" Her voice, sleepy and jaded.

"I'm a girl." Ronni said, desperate for her friends to notice. However, there was a hint of an eye-roll from Lavender, "That's no excuse. You can't just kidnap a boy."

"You'll appear too desperate, needy, even." Ginny's words, her boy hunting advice made Ronni want to recoil in horror. Helping her out, Ronni found she was now in Gryffindor Tower. The view out the window, slightly different. The perspective was off. She swallowed as she realised she was in the Girls' Dorm, and just as worrying she fitted in.

Her head still throbbing, from the cauldrons, and feeling the start of a bruise on her over-padded arse, she let herself be lead back to bed.
14131241.title: It was Ginny, Hermione and worst of all Lavender.

choices: Tomorrow is the Yule Ball and Ronni still doesn't have a date
Tomorrow Ronni gets career advice from Professor Mcgonagall
Tomorrow is the quidich cup and Ronni's keeper
141312412.content:
Ronni removed her hand from her pounding head and was relived to see that the red on his hands was just strands of hair and not blood from blunt for trauma from the cauldron mishap. Hermione looked at her friend with some concern and said, "Are you hurt Ronni? Would you like me to take you to Madame Pomfrey?"

"No thanks Hermione, I just want to get to bed." Ronni said looking down at his bulbous chest, 'And hopefully wake up from this weird dream...Merlin let this be a dream.' Ronni followed Lavender and Hermione up the spiral staircase, passing by Ginny's dorm on the way up. Ginny gave her newly made big sister a big hug before saying, "Good luck tomorrow." Seeing the odd display of sisterly affection from his sister made Ronni confused, but she had a lot of other things on his mind...and body that distracted him.

A few more floors up and the 3 Gryffindor girls arrived at their dorm room where fellow Gryffindor Parvati Patil had already turned in for the night. Ronni watched Hermione go to a bed that looked like it had a small library surrounding it along with a small bed for her cat Crookshanks and Lavender went to her bed that had some star charts and posters of celebrities around it leaving the last bed for Ronni. Even though everyone was acting like it was normal for him to be a girl, he was still surprised to see his things in the girl's dorm. His bed was still messily put together with schoolbooks tossed about and dirty clothes stuffed under the bed that the house elves couldn't pick up, although there were 100% more bras, panties, and skirts than before. Ronni even saw his favorite Chudley Cannons poster on the wall, although he was mortified to see that there were now visible lipstick stains on the cheeks of some of his favorite players.

Ron was so overwhelmed wondering about this life he now had as Ronni and how someone had done this to him. Why had it happened? How was he going to find them, make them turn him back and give him his old life. These and 100s of other questions flooded Ronni's mind and he couldn't even focus on one. Ronni rubbed his still aching head and began to lay down feeling his breasts and rump shake noticeably as he sat down. Figuring he may as well try to sleep and hope things would be magically better by tomorrow Ronni roughly shoved his long red locked from her face and fell to the pillow with great force.

"Good night Ronni, good luck tomorrow." Lavender said from the bed next to his.

'"Good luck tomorrow?" That's the second time someone's said that to me.' Ronni thought before turning to Lavender and saying, "Why? What's tomorrow?"

Lavender looked at Ronni in shock, "Are you kidding? You're being even ditzier than normal. Tomorrow's the big day!"
141312412.title: Ronni holds a hand to her pounding head

1413124121.content:
Lavender had a look of shock on her face as she looked at the red haired beauty getting ready for bed, "Ronni, did you get hit with a bludger? Tomorrow is the Yule Ball! And what's more you don't even have a date yet! Merlin's beard it's only the most important night of the school year!"

"Excuse me, final exams are much more important, they directly impact what you can do in the..." Hermione said immediately upon hearing the idea that anything was more important than schoolwork. Lavender however just dismissed Hermione with a hand wave, "Well this more important than school! Not only is it the night that impacted your social standing in the school. But what's more who you go with is like a public declaration of love! It could determine what boy you marry and have kids with!"

"What boy I'll marry?!" If Ronni still had testicles they would have shrunk and gone internal at the though of going out with a guy.

"Yes!" Lavender said with a knowing nod. But Hermione just shook her head and decided it wasn't worth arguing with Lavender as she waved her wand and turned out the lights. Ronni lay in the dark with thoughts of what had happened today to him to make him a her. Every little uncomfortable shift in the bed made Ronni very aware of how soft and foreign his body was from every jiggle in her chest to every ripple in his ass, Ronni couldn't escape her current reality even in her dreams. Ron was running through a forest of cloaks and cauldrons that kept trying to close in on him until they all collapsed on him. He managed to push them all off, but his body was Ronni's again and there was a mysterious stranger standing over her. Ronni didn't know anything about him but that he felt deep down this man was handsome, Ronni tried to approach the mystery man to see who it was when a flood of red hair made it's way into her mouth choking her.

Ronni coughed and spit until all the red hair was out of her mouth, it took a moment for her to realize she was still in the girls dormitory and yesterday was not a dream, Ron was in fact a girl named Ronni.

"You okay over there Ronni?" Ronni heard Lavender say from her bed. Ronni looked up and saw that Lavender and Hermione were already dressed to go down for breakfast.

"Yeah, I'll live."

"Good, because you need to get dressed and grab some breakfast quick. We need to get ready for the Yule ball tonight!"

"But that won't be for like 8 hours?"

"Well we need to make sure we do everything we can to look our best, and some potions that will help take that long to brew." And Ronni was surprised to hear Hermione say that.

"Maybe I won't go." Ronni said, he figured his time would be better spent trying to figure out what had happened to her, she might even go to the library of her own volition.

"Don't be daft Ronni," Lavender said and then with a smile she added, "Besides, Ginny told me someone is waiting for you outside the portrait hole waiting to ask a certain someone a very special question."

"Great..." Ronni said as she finally got out of bed. She looked under the bed and grabbed a the freshest looking pair of underwear and began to put it on. Ronni was a bit surprised at the size of bra he needed to wear. He'd never seen one that big in person! Than again he'd only ever seen his mom and sister's at the burrow when his mom made him help her with laundry, but it was still impressive. With some odd looks from her fellow Gryffindor girls, Ronni managed to get the bra on during her second attempt and put on the rest of the girl's uniform. The three girls went down the staircase and at the portrait hole stood Ginny talking to someone outside. Ginny turned back and smiled. "And here she is," Ginny walked back and started walking ahead with Hermione and Lavender. "We'll leave you two alone," She said before adding in a whisper to her new sister, "Don't blow it. You've got him on the line." Ronni gulped and nervously stepped out to see who her prospective suitor was.
1413124121.title: It's the Yule Ball and Ronni needs a date

choices: "Of course, I recognise my Ronni." he added in a steadier voice.
"Why... why wouldn't I recognise you?" puzzlement in his tone.
"So... Is... this yes, to the Yule ball?" he asked, smiling weakly.
Ronni flushed, her cheeks as red as her hair. Harry calmed her with a kiss.
14131241211.content:
Letting the girls get ahead of her, Ronni paused, still uncomfortable with her new body. All too aware how much attention Ron would pay to it. She was already dressed in her least flattering, least feminine clothes, a red Gryffindor hoodie.

She could feel his presence, as she was leaving the portrait hole. Flipping her hood up, she licked her parched lips and gathered her racing thoughts. Taking the final step she almost crashed into Harry Potter.

https://66.media.tumblr.com/9b353833bb95...

"Say you know me..." she babbled, the joy at seeing her best friend replacing all her worries, she hugged him tight. "Please... please... please..." coming in whispered mantra.

It took her calming down, she didn't know how long in seconds, but she felt the pat of Harry's hands on her back. He was eager to break the hug. Ronni taking control of herself, patted his back too. A silent agreement to break the hug.

"Of... c-c-course I remember you..." Harry's voice a nervous stutter.

Awkwardly, Ronni realised she'd excited Harry. A look of distaste flashing across her face, as she felt Harry's stiffening response to her hug.

Wiping her face of all emotions, she broke apart. Relief was clear on Harry's face, as they broke apart. Unable to meet his eyes, Ronni looked intently past his shoulder. Unwilling... unable to lower her gaze, to risk seeing .... 'the bulge'. It was Harry who first broke the silence.
14131241211.title: Harry Potter

choices: Get advice and a reading from Lavender
No preparation need, just use the Weasley charm
14131241213.content:
Ronni hadn't even stepped down from the portrait hole before she saw him. In the distance Ronni could see the tall and thin silhouetted figure with an unmistakable curved nose wearing thick fur robes. "Krum." Ronni whispered breathlessly. Viktor heard his name called and his sallow skin seemed to brighten a bit upon seeing the curvy red head enter the hall. "Ah, Roon-ee. It is very good to see you." Viktor said with his thick Bulgarian accent.

"What in the world are you doing here? Here, outside my common room. Viktor bleeding Krum."

"I'm here to talk to you Roon-ee." And Krum took a few steps towards Ronni with his oddly duck footed walk. It was hard for Ron to imagine Krum walking all the way up to Gryffindor common room, Ron began to picture Krum dramatically flying through the halls, darting around corners, dodging Peeves before landing flawlessly before the fat lady's portrait guarding the common room.

"Me?" Ronni said with a little bit of a disbelieving squeak.

"Yes." And Krum stood still as though he needed a minute to find his words, and then a little quickly he said, "Will you go to Yule Ball with me?"

"Me? Go to the ball with you? But I'm a bo...I'm just not someone who...would normally be asked out. Why would you ask me?" Ron stopped himself before blurting out he was really a guy, Not that Krum would believe me anyways Ronni thought as he mindlessly played with his skirt.

"I ask you because you are very pretty." Viktor said bluntly and then feeling he was too blunt added, "And I've also seen you fly with Potter. You fly very vell, very beautifully."

"Oh, well thank you." Ronni said as he thought about how even in this weird reality where he was Ronni instead of Ron he was at least still pals with Harry and still loved to fly. At least some things were the same.

"Vell," Viktor said expectantly, "Will you go to the ball with me Roon-ee?"

"Uh, go spend time with you? With dancing? I...sure." Ronni said weakly, his desire to not go out with a guy was completely overwhelmed by the chance to hang out with Krum. And what's more in just a few words, Krum made Ronni feel more appreciated then most people he's ever known.

"I am very happy to hear this, I look forward to seeing you tonight." Krum nodded curtly and then turned to walk away. Ronni walked away too down to the great hall as though she was in a daydream. Had that just happened? Before she could rationalize anything Ginny had practically dragged Ronni to Hermione and Lavender. "So...did he ask?"

"Did you say yes?" Hermione questioned and Lavender scoffed at that, "Of course she said yes, give us the details!"

Ronni retold the tale of what just happened, she was in so much shock over the whole thing she didn't even fill her plate with the usual mountain of toast and bacon she'd had just about every morning. When Ronni got to the part where she accepted Lavender screamed loud enough to draw looks from the other house tables, "I knew it! I knew you had it in you to get a 10 like Krum! Oh this is great! But you can't just go into tonight like usual, I'll give you the best advice, I'll help you get made up. Ohh, I'll even give you a reading your tea leaves to see what you're and Krum's future holds."

"Don't talk nonsense Lavender, divination is a joke. Ronni, I'd recommend using some potions to make sure you are at your best tonight. Something for the nerves and a few other little potions would work marvels."

"Or you could just be yourself and unleash the good old fashion Weasley charm." Ginny said roller her eyes at the other girls suggestions. "How do you want to get ready for the ball sis?" Ginny asked her brother turned sister.
14131241213.title: Viktor Krum asks out Ronni

choices: Ronni finds nothing and heads back to the dorm to get ready for the Ball
Ronni once again hears the mysterious voice
141312412133.content:
Ronni looked at his fellow Gryffindor girls who all were staring at her in anticipation. Ronni felt her face turning as red as her hair, she wasn't used to this much attention on her. And she wanted to get away from it. "I think I'm going for a walk." Ronni said as she downed a quick glass of pumpkin juice. "But Ronni it's going to take hours to get..." Lavender said but Hermione cut her off. "That's a very good idea Ronni, it's best to go into a big even with a clear and focused mind." Glad that Hermione stood up for her a little bit, Ronni gave her an appreciative smile before walking away. As she passed by the other house tables she heard snide whispers from the Slytherin's about, "How could Krum want to spend time with that." "She's all body and no brain." "She's probably already given Krum what he wants." "It'll just be a pity fu-" Ronni's face was going from red to a dark crimson as she felt tears well up in her eyes.

"Don't listen to them Ron, Krum likes you for you." Ron said to himself before shaking his head, "What are you talking about, you've got to figure out what in Merlin's beard is going on? Why am I a girl and why is it so normal to everyone?"

Ron went to the library to begin his search for why he was a her, but seeing the tens of thousands of books just intimidated her, figuring she wouldn't even know where to begin Ron just walked away without even cracking open a book. Ronni thought about going to Dumbledore, "No, there's no way Dumbledore would take time from his day to help me. So having no where else to go, Ronni decided to go back to the scene of the crime. "I think it was in this hallway," Ron said before turning down a 7th floor corner to begin her investigation.
141312412133.title: Ronni takes time to try to figure things out

choices: At the ball, Krum pulls Ronni aside into the bushes
Draco has something nasty planned for the 'blood traitor' Weasly girl
The most Ronni dances with Krum the more she forgets about Ron
1413124121331.content:
After several fruitless hours of wandering the halls in search of a room that seemed to have magically disappeared Ronni hung her head and made her way back to the Gryffindor dormitory. In the common room there were dozens of people waiting excitedly for the Yule Ball to begin, all talking about what songs the Weird Sisters would play, what food would be prepared, and most importantly who was going with who. Before he could get to the girls staircase Ronni definitely heard her name mentioned under a few peoples breathes. Ronni didn't want to deal with it and headed up the staircase where Lavender and Parvati were putting on more makeup than Ron had ever seen in his life and Hermione and Ginny were hanged out by Ronni's bed. When Ronni entered the dorm all eyes turned to him.

"Where were you! The champions and their dates have to be down in the Great Hall in less than an hour!" Lavender said nearly hysterically.

Ronni just shrugged, "It won't take that long to put on my dress robes." Lavender and Parvati seemed to have been stunned into silence as Ginny approached and said, "I know you don't like it, and you're naturally hot no matter what you do, you're still wearing some makeup. You are my sister after all and don't you want the Weasly girls to be the belles of the ball?"

Ronni mumbled something cross under his breath but Ginny ignored it, "Come on Ronni, strip down and lets get you ready." Ronni reluctantly began stripping off his clothes. It had almost been 24 hours but Ron still wasn't used to seeing the massive lumps of flesh on his chest. Looking down at them he wouldn't be surprised if he had the biggest breasts not only in his year but the whole school. Reluctantly Ronni looked for his dress robes and found them oddly in the exact same place she'd left them when she was a he. Draped over Pig's cage. And what's more they were the exact same dress robes as before with ruffles and lace all over them that looked like they were from a previous century. "No matter how my reality changes I'm always going to be poor." Ronni thought sadly looking at the robes that actually looked like they'd fit Ronni better than Ron. As she held up the dress robes Ronni heard Lavender gasp. "Oh no, THOSE are your dress robes! What were you doing going out for a walk! We could have had time to fix this!"

"Back off Lavender." Hermione said warningly wanting to protect Ronni's feelings.

"Yeah, my sister just going to look even better when she makes even this thing look good." Ginny added. Ronni wasn't sure about that, but decided there was no use putting it off anymore and removed her skirt to show off her thighs before covering himself up with the ancient robes. Ronni looked at herself in a mirror and thought, "Well, one plus side of being a girl is I don't have to wear these stupid things as a guy." And indeed these dress robes really put the emphasis on the dress with intricate lace patterns lining the bottom of the robes in a way that made them unmistakable look like a dress. Ronni couldn't critique himself any more before Ginny joined her sister's side in the mirror and said, "Come on sis, we've got to go. Champion's dates have to go down to the great hall in just a few minutes."

"Wait, your coming too?" Ronni asked and Ginny rolled her eyes, "Of course, while you were making goo goo eyes at Krum I was using the Weasly girl charm on Mr. Harry Potter, and I think now that I can string two words together around him I think he likes me." And Ginny smiled as she added, "And it does hurt that I'm almost as developed as my big sis." Ginny playfully cupped her own breasts for a second before playfully cupping Ronni's boobs to compare. Ronni blushed and for the first time he took a good look at his sister and realized she was starting to become a woman.

As the sisters walked to the great hall Ronni thought about his sister and Harry. "It'd be nice if those two hit it off well, hell Harry's practically a brother to me...doesn't mean I won't kick his arse if he hurts her though. Although if Harry's attracted to a girl like Ginny surely he's not also attracted to..." But before Ronni could finish her thought she and Ginny were greeted by Harry and Viktor. Harry a little awkwardly said hi to both Weasly girls and Viktor took a deep bow and took up Ronni's hand and kissed it. "You look lovely Roon-ee."

"No no no I look like a...nothing. I look so dumb with these stupid robes." Ronni rambled on.

"No no, the robes do not matter to me, I like what is, how you say, under them." Viktor said in such a stoic manner Ronni wasn't sure if that was a perverted come on, a genuine complement, or some translation error.

Ginny giggled at Ronni's silence, "Well you two can talk all about what's under Ronni's robes later, we have a ball to go to."
1413124121331.title: Ronni gets herself ready for the Yule Ball

choices: Ronni screams as a strange looking beatle crawls over her body
Snape curses away the bush ruining the moment
14131241213311.content:
Professor Mcgonagall gathered the champions and their partners in a room off of the great hall in preparation for the first dance which the four couples would be leading. Ronni looked at the company she was keeping. Cedric Diggory and Cho Chang were smiling and having a casual chat like they were old friends. Harry and Ginny were chatting away as well, it looked like Ginny was trying to make Harry laugh and loosen him up and it seemed to be working. And Fleur Delacour was with the Ravenclaw quiddtch captain Rodger Davies and...he kept glancing at Ronni. Fleur glared at Ronni as with a flick of her veela like hair she drew Rodger back to her, but she had to do this a couple of times. 'Wait a second, is Fleur...jealous of me?' Ronni thought as the door opened and the very stoic Viktor Krum offered his arm. "Shall ve go Roon-ee?" Ronni gulped and said the only thing that could come out, "Sure."

The champions took to the dance floor as the Weird Sisters played some slow and romantic sounding song in the background. Ronni felt the eyes of the world on her. Ronni felt his face turn redder than his hair. For a brief second he thought of running away and hiding away in the chamber of secrets where nobody could look at him again. "It is all right, I am with you Roon-ee." Victor whispered in Ronni's ear in a very sweet way that came through the accent. Ronni looked up at Krum, and just like that the world went away. Krum was looking at her as though she was the most important thing in the world, even more important that the snitch. And for the first time since he'd been turned into a girl and his world was turned upside down, Ronni felt ok. Ronni let herself rest against Krum's warm chest and let him lead the slow dance. Before everyone knew it, the song had ended.

A more upbeat song began to play and the dance floor began to swarm. The feeling of hundreds of eyes on him returned and Ronni looked round nervously. Viktor seeing this carved a path towards some bushes. With all the chaos and dancing and teenage hormones going on they actually didn't notice them.

"Thanks," Ronni said taking a breath for what felt like the first time since the Yule Ball began.

"It is no problem Roon-ee. I just vish I could do more for you. You are so beautiful."

"Oh, uh, thanks. Viktor. You don't look too bad yourself." Ronni said wanting to return the compliment. And before Ronni knew it, Krum was leaning closer and his hand was moving up her leg.
14131241213311.title: Krum pulls Ronni aside into the bushes

Ronni wakes to find herself in competition for Harry with Ginny?
As she sleeps, memories of being Ron start to fade, Ronni rising...
1413124123.content:
"It's the match against Slytherin." Lavender said in disbelief. A look of concern crossing her face.

"If you don't feel up to it, Ginny can go in goals." She offered, unable to hide the smile that flashed briefly across her face.

Feeling a little better, well, at least safer amongst her friends, and tucked up in bed Ronni risked a joke.

"She'll just want a chance to ogle Harry's taut bum." she said with a wry smile, and a twinkle in her eye.

The comment about male bums, made Lavender giggle, but her cheeks flushed nonetheless.

"Just kidding...." Ronni blurted out quickly, sensing she'd gone too far. The suspicion that Ginny wasn't a person to annoy was still strong as strong with Ronni, as it had been with Ron. He didn't want to piss of his sister, in this reality or any other.

"At least they won't accuse me of smuggling bludgers." Lavender said in a faux-whisper loud enough for everyone to hear. A pointed glance towards Ronni's large chest underlining her barb.

It was Ronni's turn to blush crimson, as she worked out her sister's meaning. Tugging the sheets up, as high as she could, and sinking as low into the bed as possible. At the same time, she wanted to throw her shoulders back, and make as proud a display of her body... her bust as she could. Why should she be embarrassed by her body.

Lavender's comment triggered a memory. Every time, she had to block one of the goals with her body, the pain of the impact, and the reaction from the crowd was mortifying. It had felt like a tactic, a clever Ravenclaw tactic, to make her more nervous. Fewer attempts at goal for her to punch, or kick clear, and more body blows.

"Yeah... something a little more binding this time." Hermione suggested softly.

"Um hmm," Lavender agreed, "You had Lee Jordan stuttering whenever you saved a goal against Ravenclaw."

"Perhaps, a spell as well as a couple of sports bras." Hermione added.

Ronni sank even lower in her bed. Just the top of her head popping out from the sheets. She could tell from the look on her face, Hermione already had a spell in mind. An eagerness to try and experiment with it glittering behind her eyes.

"Yeah. I'll be fine to play." Ronni answered, a hint of impatience in her voice, "But, I will need a good nights sleep."

Lavender and Hermione exchanged a look, at Ronni's snappishness. But, let it end.

Nox

The lights extinguished, darkness claimed the room, and in minutes only the sound of slow steady breathing came from the girls.
1413124123.title: Tomorrow is the Quiddich cup and Ronni's keeper.

14131242.content:
Unsure what to expect, Ronni was surprised to see the girls lower their wands. Tucking them away, the looks of concern on their faces looked genuine. But, that didn't stop Pansy's look of amusement, at Ronni's humiliating discovery.

"Veronica Peaches Weasley." The tone sounding like her... damn it!... his mother's delivery. She shuddered, somehow the name was familiar, was right. Her head pounded at the realisation. Either that or one of the cauldrons that had clattered it in the chaos.

Millicent, and Daphne, help Ronni to her feet. With as much dignity, as she can muster.

"I know it's hard to be the first Weasley in Slytherin." Daphne offers her hand.

"But, you don't need to practice in secret. We want to help you. We can work together, get stronger together."

Ronni realised, whatever was going on, it was weird. The hissing, slithering tickle, as Millicent summoned up some clothes for her keeping her aware of how off this all was. She tried to organise her thoughts.

Everyone (apart from herself...?... himself), recalled Veronica Peaches Weasley.

She was a Slytherin. A cautious hand to her bust, confirming the Snake proudly there. The press of her bust giving it an extra curl. It was the feeling of satin, silk and the lacy trim of her underwear that was at the forefront of her mind.

"You're in the right house, for someone who wants to stand out, to excel."

Deep inside, Ronni knew she did. She wanted to stand out from her brothers. Win the Quidditch Cup, become a prefect. Not be, just another Weasley. Pain flared across her forehead, as her thoughts whirled. Her feet stumbling on the uneven stones of the floor. The girls help her keep her feet.

1413311.title: Polyjuice - Dumbledore in disguise!

14133111.content:
Professor Dumbledore sat in his office, watching the final stage of polyjuice potion bubble away like thick mud in a miniature cauldron set upon his desk. Occasionally he would add a little extra dried skin of boomslang or knotgrass, and then gesture over the mixture with the elder wand, muttering incantations beneath his breath.

Inside a glass vial beside the cauldron was the final ingredient - a lock of light brown hair, freshly clipped from the head of The-Transfigured-Being-To-Be. He took it now in his wizened hands and tipped it into the potion. The thick, grey gloop cleared, becoming a thin, dark purple-pink liquid. Taking a small cup, he gathered a sample (enough for a transformation of roughly an hour; hopefully long enough for his purposes) and drank it. He was relieved to find that it didn't taste of earwax.

He sat back into the headmaster's chair and patiently waited for the changes to complete. Beneath his robes, his flesh bubbled and rippled unpleasantly like molten wax. Old bones cracked. Young, strong muscle grew within him; and tough-as-leather joints becoming supple once again. Colour flushed into his silvery hair until he was a brunette. Touching a hand to his face, he felt the wrinkles of age and the furrows and lines of an oft-stressful life vanish. His beard accumulated as a pile of hair in his lap.

The changes subsided. For a moment, the aged Professor stared around his office in bleary-eyed confusion before giving a cry of 'Ah!' and removing his half-moon spectacles. For the first time in many decades, his vison was perfect.

As was his body. Stiffly, he rose from his chair, uncomfortably aware of the way the heavy, coarse robes moved against his naked breasts.
14133111.title: Dumbledame

141331111.content:
He reached for his wand laid on the desk with a dainty hand. Much to his suprise, the wand twitched and leapt away from his grasp, ending up landing on the floor. Odd. Crouching to retrieve it, he found the powerful wand once again slipped from between his fingers. It was as though it didn't even recognise him as its master.

He smiled as realisation dawned. That put rest to the old conundrum: of whether the Elder Wand could make a polyjuice potion so powerful that even it wouldn't recognise its transformed master.

Still, he could hardly just leave such a destructive item lying on his study floor... Momentarilly overcome with youthfull energy, he made a full-body leap for the wand and managed to wrap both hands around the wooden shaft.

141331111122212.content:
She felt the magic working to transform her body even as it transported her away. Dumbledore tried to recall all the defensive spells he had cast to protect himself and all his possessions.

He was glad that he'd made his defenses not to be lethal, unless they were threatened with destruction. However, they were designed to deter the individual from trying again. He had set many of them up to embarrass or humiliate the person in question.

With a wand as powerful as his own, he swallowed nervously at the range of options it could impose on an assailant.

As the journey ended, she felt reality reform about her, and she examined her surroundings.

1413311111222121.content:
As reality appeared around the transformed teacher it was clear that he was no longer a full-grown woman. She was now a senior student. She looked down at her pale blue uniform. Cursing under her breath she knew that Beauxbatons was an excellent wizarding school. Although he -she giggled- she didn't agree with all their rules.

At Beauxbatons she knew that feminine grace and decorum were rigorously enforced by magic. She was also worried as she found a rather feeble wand tucked in the sleeve of her uniform jacket.

She ran her hands down the side of the uniform. Feeling the narrow waist and the swell of her hips. She didn't feel ready to examine her chest yet. Even now, it seemed to loom large in her view. She was certain that that was one of the Elder Wands' last tricks on her.

She felt hair waft around her head, and with a frustrated gesture tried to flick it aside.

It felt like a wave of blonde tresses crashed across her face. With a frustrated blow she tried to clear it away.

Vanity overcame her as she suddenly realised she didn't have the least clue how she looked, well beyond having blond hair.

Spotting a window, she darted over to see her reflection. Even doing that gave her a hint as she felt her chest shift alarmingly.

The girl in the reflection was an absolute beauty. Her curly blonde hair framed an elegant face, with a petite nose, and full lips her wide eyes completed it. The face was a mask of innocence, it seemed to suggest that the girl in the glass was incapable of retaining the least of thoughts, let alone a spell.

She allowed her gaze to dip down. It was then that she confirmed that the Elder wand truly had a twisted sense of humour. Her curves stretched the uniform to it's limit. She wasn't a seasoned judge of these things, but she guessed that she had an E-cup or something similar.

"You girl! Don't spend all day entranced by your reflection." The voice snapped behind her.

Dumbledore snapped around like an obedient pupil.

"What's your name, girl?" the professor asked.

"Dora." she answered against her will. It was confusing, but she hadn't chosen that name. It came unbidden.

She tried again. "I'm Dora."

She'd tried to say her other name. To say any other name, but 'Dora' was all that would come out.

"Call me Professor.... or Professor O'Donnell." the teacher glowered at her.

"I'm Dora, Professor O'Donnell." she even added in a little curtsy as she answered.

14133111112221211.content:
Dora always was open-minded as Dumbledore, besides if it's only for a hour until the poly-juice wears off....

Dutifully, Dora skips after the professor. The scuffing of her shoes sounding loudly on the stones of the hallway.

She skips a couple of steps before taking a more grown-up pace.

Professor O'Donnell looks back at her a little suspiciously.

"Which class are you skipping just now?" she hisses at the rather too happy student.

Dora pauses, she can't name a class or a teacher... everything will fall apart then....

"Don't dawdle girl... answer me, you insolent child."

Dora's mouth slipped open as she thought, suddenly it came to her, free study.... she was meant to be in the library....

They'd certainly have a library here, she thought.

But it appeared that the professor's patience had run out. Dora watched as O'Donnell's lips moved almost silently incanting a spell.

She yelped, suddenly and shrilly. It felt like someone had grabbed her ass.

It came again, this time harder... Her head snapped around, but there wasn't anyone there....

Looking back at the teacher it was clear it was a punishment spell. In total six swats fell on her ass. It didn't matter how or where she moved her hands the blows fell. Each time a girlish yelp or squeal bursting out. Once it was over, she tenderly ran a hand over her pained flesh, it felt hot and sore..... and oddly she ....liked.... it. She was feeling very confused.

"I'm meant to be in the library, Professor." she answered with a curtsy.

"Now girl, that wasn't difficult. Let's get you to the library."

14133111122.content:
With a sigh, Dumbledame stripped out of her over-sized professorial robes. She went over to the cupboard with the impounded items in it. There was bound to be something in there that she could wear.

When she reached the cupboard she had to restrain the shriek of frustration, she didn't even have a wand.

She took a deep breath, and clasped her hands around the lock, "Alohamora!" she muttered. There was a snick, as the lock released. A sense of satisfaction filled her, making her forget the soft tones of her voice.

She found several piles of carefully folded uniforms within, along with a selection of wands. With undue haste, she snatched a wand from the shelf.

With a swish and a flick, she cast a simple spell. The wand shook in her hand, resisting her efforts, but the tip of the wand lit up. It wasn't perfect, but should allow her to do a simple locating spell. She would have tucked it away, but without any clothes that was difficult.

As she rummaged, the choices quickly reduced. Half of the clothes were for boys, and absolutely wouldn't disguise her. Rather they'd draw attention to her. Another couple wouldn't fit, just being too small for her. One was too big, for a final year student.

She gave a surprised little snort as she held one up, it was over a hundred years old, and didn't match the modern uniform at all.
